story:
With A Buzz In Our Ears We Play Endlessly


Inspired by the Sigur Ros album of the same name, With A Buzz In Our Ears We Play Endlessly is a simple comic finding curious folks spending their summer days in a unique way, running through country fields as freely as a person can, celebrating the joys of life. It is also about the woman who stumbles on them and their new, unusual way of looking at the world.With A Buzz In Our Ears We Play Endlessly is a wholesome, fun, and whimsical story on the lighter side of strange that is surely not safe for work. It's naughty, but it ain't dirty!

After printing a small initial run, With A Buzz In Our Ears We Play Endlessly was well-received and acclaimed between its first appearance at Small Press Expo and other select events and locations. With this campaign, we are looking to print a larger run and bring this quirky tale to a wider audience.

Gibson Twist and Rori! bring you their first collaborative print effort, and every backer of this ordering campaign will come with an IndieGoGo exclusive bookplate, limited to the number of comics backed here.

Join us on our run through the field, and enjoy some fun!

Cheers!

story:
*UPDATE
2014 SPECTRUM FANTASTIC ART COMICS GOLD AWARD to my piece " The Red Door ", which you'll find inside the book !

INTRODUCTION

Hello ! My name is Thomas Campi and I'm an italian professional illustrator and comic artist, currently based in Hangzhou, China. Over the last 14 years I have worked for many publishers such as Glenat, LeLombard, Sergio Bonelli Editore, Dupuis, Zanichelli among others.

My upcoming comic book " Les Larmes Du Seigneur Afghan ", written by Pascal Bourgaux and Vincent Zabus, published by Dupuis, will be out May 9.

You can visit my website for more info about me and my work, or my Tumblr for some work in progress stuff 

NOCTURNE is a full color, 80 pages collection of drawings, sketches, illustrations with also some step by step of my process. 

*PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO ADD $ 10 FOR THE SHIPMENT


A FEW THINGS ABOUT ME AND THIS BOOK

I love my work, and I'm very lucky that I get to draw for a living. Even so, I still dream everyday of creating my own personal Art Book. For a few months now, I have been drawing a lot in the night time. Every time brings something different, something new, characters, color sketches, illustrations, but somewhere there's a pattern. Every one of these drawings is a mood, a sensation, rage toward someone or myself, a song I was listening to, a dream or just an image stacked in my head. I tried to put all those feelings in colors. It is the sublimation of my different states of mind.


TO MAKE THINGS CLEAR FOR EVERYBODY

For you backers goes all my appreciation. This book means a lot to me, because these images are a little part of me. Thank you !

You can find me on my Tumblr, Facebook, or Twitter. We can chat, talk about comics, illustration and art. I can share my process, give you advice on your work if you are an amateur and want to become a professional, or if you just want to improve as an artist. If you love art then we’re already friends!

During the day, I work as a comic artist. All the illustrations for Nocturne are created in the night time, so please back me and help me to stay awake and paint more ! With your contribution I can realize my dream to share a part of me with all of you.

I already have about 75 images, and my target is to get to 100. If you back me you should also know that some of the money will go to a young designer who’s helping me with all the layout work to design the book, the cover, and the few writing parts.


INSIDE NOCTURNE

2 different editions:

- Softcover Edition. Standard Portrait, 7.48"x11" ( 19 x 28 cm ), 80 pages.

- Hardcover Edition ( ImageWrap ). Standard Portrait, 7.48"x11" ( 19 x 28 cm ), 80 pages.

(This is just a sample, the final layout is not ready yet.)

What you will find inside Nocturne is a variety of drawings, almost all are digital,  that can be described as sketches, illustrations, paintings that go through different genres, from romantic subjects to surreal situations and characters. The most important thing to understand is that every one of the images are stories. You will have to decide the beginning and the end - I’m just showing a moment in between, a moment that somehow I experienced. You’re very welcome to write me and tell me what you see and feel looking at them. I would really appreciate it.



Once the campaign concludes, I will finish the book and head to the printers. Then I will print the cards and the Art Prints, draw the original art for you generous backers and double check everything, because I really want to give you something I can be proud of. There is no doubt that this book will be completed, it's nearly done as it is. The only risk here is perhaps getting it out a little later than I anticipate.

I plan to start delivering  on November 2014.  Please be patient; it will take me some time to wrap and ship all of the perks.



WHAT YOU GET

 In return for your support, because you believed in me, and because you're just cool people I came up with some nice PERKS. 

Below you can see some of them, but know that the prints, postcards, and other drawn goodies, such as original art, are still in production ( the short stories are completed ). Everything is up to you guys, and how much you can contribute. I will keep you update on here.

Remember, You are my publisher ! Please feel free to drop me a line if you have any questions or comments.

PRINTS: Giclée print on natural white, matte, ultra smooth, 100% cotton rag, acid and lignin free archival paper. NOCTURNE SMALL 8"x10" ( 20,3x25,4 cm ) and NOCTURNE REGULAR 13"x18" ( 33x45 cm ).

*PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO ADD $ 10 FOR THE SHIPMENT


POSTCARDS: They're printed on a heavy paper with silky finish. 4.13" x 5.82" ( 105mm x 148mm )



WHAT I NEED THE MONEY FOR

CREATION: $ 2000

I’ve already created 75 images, but I need to create 25 more. To draw this amount of pieces takes time. Same goes for the bonus material and all the original drawings that  I will make for you. This means that I will need to take some time off work, as well as working in the weekends, so I will need some money to cover this period of time.

PRINTING : about $ 8000

If I get 100 % funded I can make at least 200 copies of this book. It depends on how many copies with softcover and hardcover will be printed. Some of the copies will go to you of course !  Some of them I will use it for promotion. Some copies might be sold on my website.

PERKS - BONUS MATERIAL: about $ 2000

I will need the money to print all the bonus material, such as the Giclée prints, and the Postcards. The amount will depends on how many of you have backed me, I hope a lot of people !

PACKAGING and SHIPMENT: $ 1400

This is to cover the cost and the preparation of the packaging that I’ ll use to wrap books and bonus material for the shipment. 

WEBSITE COMMISSION : $ more than 1000

If I exceed the goal, I will spend the extra money on buying a new Wacom graphic tablet, because the one I’m using is slowly dying ! This will help me on the creation of Nocturne Vol. 2 !!!

*PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO ADD $ 10 FOR THE SHIPMENT


IF I DON'T REACH THE GOAL

Since I received several messages about wether or not I will fulfill the rewards and print NOCTURNE, my artbook, if I don't reach the goal, here what's gonna happen:


Yes, I will print the book even if I don't reach the goal. 

There are some conditions though. I will e able to print the hardcover copies and add more pages, therefore more illustrations, only if I reach the goal. Otherwise it's really too expensive for me. I am totally on my own on this project.

If I don't get the amount I requested, I will print just the softcover version. 

If I don't reach at least $5000 I will make the art prints but only in the small size ( A4 ), but I will send more postcards ( because are cheaper to print ).

About the original art, that won't change, you will still get anything related to the perk you've chosen.

I hope this is enough for you 

Thanks to all of you that backed and all the people who helped sharing this campaign .


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you are not able to financially support my project, there are many other ways to help me. You can add Nocturne to your favorites on Indiegogo and leave a comment, and you can also use Indiegogo social sharing tools or spread the word by posting information on your website or blog.Thank you!


Thomas

story:
The Firelight Isle is a creator-owned graphic novel that explores the depths of human culture in a fictional setting. Like Freakangels, it will be published for free on the web and then collected in print. There's much more information on the website for the project, The Firelight Isle.com

My goal for The Firelight Isle is to produce a graphic novel without compromises, and put every ounce of quality that I can into the story, the art and the design. The finished product will be a 200-300 page full-colour comic, with production values inspired by beautiful publications like Habibi and The Arrival, in which every detail of the book contributes to the atmosphere of the story. In order to achieve this, I'll be focussing intently on the writing, research, design and thumbnailing before I move onto the production of the pages themselves. I plan to document this creation process online, putting up notes, sketches, designs and illustrations as I go! You can already see the first few entries on The Firelight Isle Blog, and there's more detail about how much time each aspect of the creative process takes on the Creative Process page of thefirelightisle.com.

I'm estimating that the pre-production stage (writing, research, design and thumbnailing) will take me around 80-100 days of full time work, and the production stage (drawing and colouring the pages) will take between 400-900 days of full time work, depending on how long the project ends up being, and how smoothly it goes! As it stands I can only afford spend one day a week on The Firelight Isle, and at that pace it could take up to two years to finish the pre-production, and over a decade to finish the production! This is where you come in...
I'm self-employed, and earn enough from doing commercial artwork to make a living, but unfortunately there is very little money out there for creator owned comics. At the moment, every day I spend working on The Firelight Isle is a day during which I don't earn any income, and this is a big financial risk - but your input can help change that!

I'm looking for funding to help me complete the pre-production stage of this project - the goal is $6000, which on the current dollar-pound exchange rate works out at around minimum wage for 100 days work, 8 hours a day - just enough! That still leaves the matter of funding for the production itself, but I have a feeling that's too substantial a goal for crowd-sourcing (even at minimum wage and fastest possible production time, that would require about $25000 on top of the $6000 I'm asking for). After the pre-production is finished, I plan on using the collected concept work to seek more substantial funding from publishers, or perhaps to launch a second campaign using the interest gathered if this first campaign is successful. This also means that any money I raise for the project above the target or outside this campaign will go straight towards funding the production stage.

So, what's in it for you?

  • I can promise a great comic in return! I'm dedicated to getting this finished, whether it takes 3 years or 30, and having delivered 144 episodes of Freakangels at an average of 4 weeks out of every 5, you can be sure that I've got the dedication it requires!
  • You'll get to watch the project develop faster! I'll be posting my progress online, and with every new contributor, I can produce more material to share each week.
  • You'll be helping to back creator owned comics! Whether it's self-published or not, I intend to add The Firelight Isle to the ever growing list of creator owned material and support that sector of the industry in my own way.
  • I also want to be totally up front with every aspect of this project because I know how easy it is to mislead with crowd-funding campaigns. I will be completely open with where your money goes and what it helps me achieve!
  • And of course there are the perks! At this stage it's worth explaining that I can't offer free copies of the finished book to any but the biggest of contributors because I don't yet know who will be publishing or how much the book will cost to print and post, but hopefully the other perks will make up for this!

story:
Okay, what’s this about?

Gundeath Carnival (血液爆発超暴力！ガンデスカーニバル ~Oblivion Nightmare Megakill Fantasia XXIII~ lit. BLOOD EXPLOSION ULTRA VIOLENCE! GUNDEATH CARNIVAL ~Oblivion Nightmare Megakill Fantasia XXIII~) is an action web manga about the virtual reality first person shooter (VRFPS) Gundeath Carnival, a game that, in the year 2027, ended all armed conflict all over the globe and turned all international territorial and resource conflicts into the world’s biggest E-Sport.

I intend for the manga to be a biweekly serial released on Batoto, Tapastic and MangaMagazine, with 20-30 pages every fortnight. The reason for me not considering a weekly schedule is because I am also a Computer Science major in university, and the weekly mangaka schedule (according to current working conditions) is too hectic to allow more than one day without work. As for “why not monthly,” I’d like to remain motivated enough to consistently put out good stuff, and a monthly schedule would force me into a ridiculously slow working pace that could potentially lead to a loss of interest and motivation. I don’t like that. That’s bad.

What’s with the ridiculously over-the-top title?

The alternate version of the title is an affectionate parody of ridiculously long Japanese visual culture titles such as “The Society for the Study of Modern Visual Culture”, “This Is the Police Station in Front of Kameari Park in Katsushika Ward”, and “No Matter How I Look at It, It's You Guys' Fault I'm Not Popular!”. Following in the footsteps of over-the-top anime and manga series such as “Heaven-Piercing Gurren-Lagann”, “Mobile Fighter G Gundam” and “Kill La Kill”, Gundeath Carnival aims to be as ridiculously over-the-top as over-the-top can be, while retaining its serious undertones and relevant themes.

Do you promote violence or something?

The manga does not, in any way, promote or glorify violence - as a matter of fact, I aim to drive the following points: WAR IS BAD, INTERNATIONAL CONFLICTS ARE VERY BAD, and SPORTS IS THE BEST WAY TO UNITE THE WORLD. By doing away with the concept of armed international conflicts and providing a viable alternative, the ‘world government’ aims to establish unity and peace throughout the world. Of course, such an ideal solution reaching its best conclusion would be unrealistic; this web manga aims to tackle, among others, the following issues:

Violence (specifically gun violence)

Corruption

Sportsmanship and unity

Gamer culture (and a subset, the ‘bro culture’)

Virtual reality and its implications

This may seem like a lot to tackle, but I’m hopeful that I will be able to carry my points across through this story. Being a gamer myself, a lot of the themes of this manga are a product of my experiences playing first person shooters, real-time strategy games and massively multiplayer online games, so there’s definitely a lot of things that hit close to home.

So what do you need the money for?

In order to resume my work on the comics, and to improve my workflow by mixing digital and traditional elements, I will need to gather $1500 to upgrade my current desktop computer and purchase a new graphics tablet. I'll also be using the money to obtain comic paper, pen nibs and inks.

Should the funding break through the initial goal, I will be using the extra money for MORE traditional art materials, so I can send Gundeath Carnival artworks straight to you!

A sample page of GUNDEATH CARNIVAL. Isn't it cool!?

STRETCH GOALS

$2000: Gundeath Carnival Original Sketch Extravaganza Super Deluxe Turbo

Everyone who donated $50 or more gets a signed original Gundeath Carnival character sketch on high quality IC manga drafting paper! Estimated Delivery: February 2014

$3000: Greetings from Japan: Gundeath Carnival Uncle Samurai Edition HD Remix

LOCKED! Revealed when Stretch Goal 1 is achieved

$6000: Final Strike! Gundeath Carnival Ultimania Murderkill Edition

LOCKED! Revealed when Stretch Goal 2 is achieved.

you!A sample page of GUNDEATH CARNIVAL. Isn't it cool!?STRETCH GOALS
$2000: Gundeath
Carnival Original Sketch Extravaganza Super Deluxe Turbo
Everyone who donated $50 or more gets a signed original Gundeath
Carnival character sketch on high quality IC manga drafting paper! Estimated Delivery: February 2014
$3000: Greetings
from Japan: Gundeath Carnival Uncle Samurai Edition HD Remix
LOCKED! Revealed when Stretch Goal 1 is achieved
$6000: Final
Strike! Gundeath Carnival Ultimania Murderkill Edition
LOCKED! Revealed when Stretch Goal 2 is achieved.

story:
¡¡Seguimos Adelante!!

A pesar de vuestras generosas contribuciones no hemos podido lograr el objetivo marcado de nuestra campaña de micromecenzago quedándonos en un 39% del mismo. A pesar de ello, estamos un gran esfuerzo y vamos a intentar  editar el cómic en español. Estamos terminando de pulir varios detalles de la edición y buscando medios alternativos de financiación.  Si todo se cumple según lo previsto el cómic entraría a imprenta en un par de semanas y podríamos presentarlo la ultima semana de enero.  Todos aquellos que habéis realizado una aportación que incluya una copia del cómic lo recibiréis, pero necesitamos algo mas de tiempo. 

De momento podéis seguir apoyando la causa  realizando alguna compra en nuestra flamante tienda: https://www.etsy.com/es/shop/UnpopularTales?ref=hdr_shop_menu

Saludos


 ¿Que tal suena un cómic de 45 paginas a todo color que cuenta la historia verdadera de la Caperucita Roja? ¿Y si os dijéramos que es una escort de altos vuelos, que trabaja en el burdel de la abuelita y vive aterrorizada por su novio el leñador?  Bienvenidos a: LOS CUENTOS IMPOPULARES VOLUMEN I; CAPERUCITA ROJA. Una historia real plagada de sexo, violencia y acción. ¡Ven y diviértete con nosotros! 


 Toda la financiación del proyecto se destinara a pagar el coste de producción, impresión y distribución del cómic en formato papel. En caso de no conseguir el objetivo, responderemos todas las recompensas y utilizaremos el dinero para seguir desarrollando  la historia a nivel electronico y prolongar la serie con otros relatos. 



  Las recompensas irán desde agradecimientos, pasando por copias del cómic, hasta ilustraciones únicas, reservadas a coleccionistas.


 Poco a poco y gracias a vuestra ayuda queremos llegar a mas sitios, conocer a mas entusiastas del cómic y crear toda una comunidad en torno a las historias. 



A todos aquellos que no podáis colaborar directamente en la campaña, por favor compartirla con todos vuestros contactos


Gracias de antemano a todos 

NOTA IMPORTANTE: Todos los envíos fuera de la Europa continental deberán añadir los gastos de correos.

story:
Greetings and salutations! My name is Toby Johansen, I'm an independent artist, writer and filmmaker, and today I really need your help to get my heart-felt, horse-loving passion piece off the ground and to the rest of the world, that means you! I want you and everyone who would want to hold a copy of my work in their hands that can show them there are more great stories to tell, even ones about Horses!

This graphic novel I've been working on since last year, is really the most passionate and greatest labour of love I've ever had when doing comics in the past since ever. I've only got about 41 pages left to draw before I go back to draw in the final details and the rest of the backgrounds and put int some color to help with the black and white when it goes into printing, that's my estimation, could be less pages if the story is progressed well!



What is this graphic novel about? Allow me to narrate!

In a post-apocalyptic 2018, a man who wears a horse mask, Dawn Horse, is bent on protecting a herd of horses from savage flesh-eaters, called Scavers, while trying to make a meaningful life in a world that has stopped. As the herd of horses strive to understand what Dawn Horse teaches them and how they must learn from their surroundings amongst themselves. To survive without pride, to live with heart than with malice.

How things came to be from such a time while not perfect but very free and prosperous, turned grey and deathly silent, those who survive live on with the lives they have to survive, even if that means to turn to a dark place which you may never return from to do so, or maybe you do choose to be a guardian to protect those you care about even if there are always consequences.

If that plot doesn't make you scream "Holy crap! That sounds amazingly interesting, original, dark, emotional and awesome" then I don't know what will!

You'll find 20 unfinished pages here that I know will wet your appetite! Plus some scans of my character sketches (which are part of one of the Perks I have!). I'll definitely keep you updated!





 

What I Need & What You Get

I have estimated the amount to cover the printing costs and the cover artist will be $2390.

You see that I set the goal at $2570, that's because of the site fees. What I'll be getting is just a little bit over $2390, if we don't make the goal then the fees will be higher. Mainly the site's fees establish that if we succeed the goal they get 4%, if I don't reach my goal then they get 9%.

All $2020 of your awesome contributions will go straight into the printing costs for the book and $370 of it will go to pay a fellow artist to make the cover of the book and it's going to look beautiful as the story itself. I'll start with printing up to 370 books, it's a good start and what I'll make back from sales will go into more prints of this story, have to keep it going. :) Plus, I'll be writing a sequel book this Winter and get started on it late 2014.

If I get more than my estimated goal, I'll put that extra money into some lamination work and promotion for the book!

What do you get out of all this? How do these perks sound?

$1 This is enough to show you care about creative passion projects which means your name will go into the beautifully designed "Special Thanks" page.

$5 You get to own a PDF digital copy (or which ever your preferences are for digital copies please let me know) of the book when it's finished! Also with your name in the "Special Thanks" page.

$10 You get the SOLID BOOK when it's complete and printed by November 13, 2013, delivered to your own home! You also get your name in the "Special Thanks"! (Does NOT include digital copy)

$15 Want me to autograph your copy? Totally!

$50 You get the BOOK, both with your name and signed, with the addition of two beautiful posters of the front cover done by Emily Nguyen and the interior cover by KARNO! (Kjartan Arnorsson)

INTERIOR COVER:


Check out some of their stuff!:
Emily Nguyen: http://emilynguyenart.deviantart.com/
Karno: http://www.furaffinity.net/user/karno

$100 Donate this you get the book, posters...what could be better? Why, having your very own original Horse character drawn next to your name in the "Special Thanks" page curtasy of me! Just be sure to e-mail me your commission after purchasing this perk!

$200 You get all of the above...AND...3 of my original character sheets I drew and used for visual reference while drawing my book! Holding an authentic piece of comic book history!

"Dawn Horse"

"Rosie"


"Rikk"


"Scavers"


The Impact

You would be helping me reach my creativity out to the masses, letting me do what I love to draw and write whatever I want, because life is always about creativity. I would shed more details about the story, but trust me when I say this that if I do I'd be spoiling WAY too much for you, and this is a story that MUST be read in order to do it any justice and I HAVE to let my work speak for itself. However, I will engage you on a personal discussion about why I'm making this story and why it's important to me.

First, the Nice reasons!

As I said before, I love Horses. It was something that was living in the back of my mind for a long time and haven't really come to full grips with it until just a few years back. Coming to know these proud beasts, big or small, different kinds, different colors, different personalities, an animal that builds a trust and a loving friendship that can last longer than forever. I love their anatomy, I love how you can read them, I love how they're misunderstood by some people as being stupid when they're most definitely not, the long faces, fluffy ears, voluptuously-strong bodies, their cute but awesome hooves, their flowing manes and tails, their neighs are music to my ears...

...I told you I love them. I'm looking on down the road to learn more about how I can own my own regular or shetland pony as my companion pet.

Aside from that, Horses have been with us since the dawn of time...no seriously, look it up, they call it "the Dawn Horse" (Eh? See that? Getting some insight on my inspirations -wink-)...but seriously, they've been around since forever, when we came into their lives they rode us from place-to-place, they helped us build many things, they've went with us into battles and wars, they died with us, they race and become celebrities and they have also become great companion pets and have helped those disabled (physically, mentally, emotionally) to know there is more to life through a Horse than just cynicism, apathy, and ignorance.

When I go out to sell my books at comic book conventions and online to other readers, half of my profits will go into future issues of this story (being the sequel of course!) and half of the profits will go into donations for a Horse rescue, a good cause comes out of it for the good of creativity and for Horses!



 

Now, here comes the Not-So-Nice reason...

What could possibly crush the good parts that I love about this? Horse-Slaughter. Yes, it really exists, it's been around for a while, but seems to be more frequent these days. Some people are still doing it in several parts of the world, especially in America. They back up their arguments through varied lies about "over-population" (of course) but it's all about easy money for corporate industries, greedy land managers and some ranchers that would rather take more profits than doing their job at "being responsible". Horse meat is contaminated with the use of medications that can be lethal to humans if consumed. "Humanely Slaughtered"? Don't make me laugh.

Everyone, put some time aside and read up more about this issue here: http://www.humanesociety.org/issues/horse_slaughter/facts/facts_horse_slaughter.html

I personally object to it (along with many Horse Owners/Advocates/Lovers, etc.) being that we have cows, chickens, pigs and fish (to which I also love all animals in general and don't want them harmed even for consumption, but until "cultured meat" is more supported and hits the scene, it's unfortunate) to survive on and should not turn over to making more companion animals (both domestic or wild, yeah they slaughter both and sell them for food) into food for the sake of easy money let alone to take away our greatest discoveries and companions ever known to exist from grand ol' nature itself.

Doing this story I hope would help a great deal to stop this atrocity and to help keep Horses of all kinds, domesticated or wild or both, from meeting this terrible fate, especially because of the way things are in the economy. Because if I and many others (Yes, even yourself included!) can make a difference like saving and protecting this particular animal from extinction, just think of the inspirations this could do for others to make a better world for themselves, it's an incredible notion! That seems a little too optimistic, but rational people with great ideas can accomplish anything! But even if Fake Horse doesn't save the world or anything it can still account for good creativity in the arts of visual/written story-telling and can help shape others' opinions on subjects like this. If anything else it explains where I stand on the matter and will keep up a good fight!


After reading that you probably think this project is nothing more than just a pitiful piece of propaganda, for some maybe, but anyone who is super smart will tell you to NEVER judge a book by its cover!

I understand my personal love for my favorite animal and a pure undeniable hatred for their fate can only be taken so far as signing petitions, donating to Horse rescues and such, part of me felt that while I am an activist on this issue I felt that I HAVE to do more than that, and what better way than to use one, if not THE greatest, of individual expressions, the Artistic Expression! But why stop there? Writing does a great deal of expression as well! Put two-and-two together and vuala!

Now here's the thing, this graphic novel IS a big love letter to Horses and is most-definitely a big anti-horse-slaughter message, but it is also a character-driven narrative that debates the merits of humanity's survival over companionship, spoken from the point-of-views of both the human and the horse characters in the book, what it takes to be a hardcore survivalist and what you could turn into as well as it does talk about when becoming the "good guy" has consequences too when you go at great lengths to defend yourself and mostly those important to you when the world becomes violently unsafe.

The tolls it takes on one's emotions, Bad vs Good, or heck this book has conflicts that are more formed being Good vs Good, in the nature of survival, companionship and in nature itself. Life is not always pretty, nature is a great example and it's addressed, but it CAN be changed, because change and conflict is what life is all about, only then can you find the happiness in its shades of grey. Bizarre as it all may be, it's still heart-felt because of characters coming to know creativity is what keeps their lives going, and they can't do it without each other. Such is reality.

Pretty deep stuff, but that's what makes it so great and I love it!



Other Ways You Can Help

You can like the Fake Horse facebook page here: https://www.facebook.com/TheFakeHorse

Bookmark my website to help support it and it's creative projects: http://psychosentinel.tripod.com/

Subscribe to both my YouTube channels: https://www.youtube.com/user/DarkToboki & http://www.youtube.com/user/GoryPumpkin

Follow me on Twitter: https://twitter.com/GoryPumpkin

I understand that it's a tough economy and that not everyone is able to meet the demand, but if you can help out by:

SHARING THE HECK OUT OF THIS CAMPAIGN!
SHARE IT ON FACEBOOK!
POST IT ON TWITTER!
TELL YOUR FRIENDS!
TELL YOUR FAMILY!
TELL YOUR HORSES!
POST IT ON YOUR BLOG!
TELL EVERY COMIC BOOK FAN ABOUT IT!
TELL HORSE LOVERS/OWNERS/ADVOCATES ABOUT IT!

Please help my story come to you and to everyone all over!

Thank you so much! Let's make this baby gallop through the fields of freedom and into continuation! LONG LIVE HORSES!

story:
Stryde: Underworld

After a shocking discovery about his mentor Cobalt, Stryde retires from being a sidekick. However, years later Stryde gets pulled back into the game due to an organization of child traffickers called "The Underworld" emerge in Denver! Stryde and Cobalt have to set their differences aside if they have any hope to take this group down!

Hello, my name is Thomas Retzke and I am very determined to finish the story of Stryde. Like many others, I have had this dream to write comics for as long as I can remember. I am taking one step closer to that dream by taking the initiative to get my book out.  

Making a comic is very expensive, it is definitely a crazy investment. Your hard earned money will go straight to funding the artists behind the book. If this book makes a profit, it will go straight to the second issue of the book. This book is being made no matter what, if the funds are lower than anticipated, it will simply just take longer to make.

My perks are very simple:

-Physical Copy (cheap): this is the most basic copy with cheaper envelope shipping.

-Physical Copy (expensive): this basic copy will come with package shipping.

-Digital Copy: same as a physical copy but digital.

Every single backer will also get a digital copy of Stryde: Origin sent to their emails. This means you will receive Stryde content the moment you back the project.

Yes, you may be rolling your eyes at yet another superhero story. But if you give this story a chance, you will see it is a very different story than just simply another superhero. With my comic being a limited series, you will have be seeing Stryde's story beginning to end, unlike many comics that go on for hundreds of issues.

The biggest problem is money, I will do all I can to get this comic to you. This is not my first indie comic, so I have experience on Indiegogo and how to get people their comic. If you put a little faith in my project I can guarantee that you will enjoy this product.

Hello, my name is Thomas Retzke and I am very determined to finish the story of Stryde. Like many others, I have had this dream to write comics for as long as I can remember. I am taking one step closer to that dream by taking the initiative to get my book out.  

Making a comic is very expensive, it is definitely a crazy investment. Your hard earned money will go straight to funding the artists behind the book. If this book makes a profit, it will go straight to the second issue of the book. This book is being made no matter what, if the funds are lower than anticipated, it will simply just take longer to make.
My perks are very simple:
-Physical Copy (cheap): this is the most basic copy with cheaper envelope shipping.
-Physical Copy (expensive): this basic copy will come with package shipping.
-Digital Copy: same as a physical copy but digital.
Every single backer will also get a digital copy of Stryde: Origin sent to their emails. This means you will receive Stryde content the moment you back the project.
Yes, you may be rolling your eyes at yet another superhero story. But if you give this story a chance, you will see it is a very different story than just simply another superhero. With my comic being a limited series, you will have be seeing Stryde's story beginning to end, unlike many comics that go on for hundreds of issues.The biggest problem is money, I will do all I can to get this comic to you. This is not my first indie comic, so I have experience on Indiegogo and how to get people their comic. If you put a little faith in my project I can guarantee that you will enjoy this product.

story:
I was supposed to go to MICE this year... 

But at the last minute I needed to move halfway across the country.  This is increased my cost of travel, along with being down funds from moving.  I have been working and saving, but I will not be able to responsibly make the trip this year without your help.

What the Money will be used for...

Travel cost and lodging, along with money to print off and put together copies before the expo.  It will be about $325 for travel, and the rest for printing (so really only around $400, but Indiegogo requires a minimum of $500...)  

Why this is important to me... 

I'm not going to lie guys, I have had a rough year, and I think this is going to help me feel like I'm standing on solid ground again.  This will only be my second comic-con where I am selling and I am so excited.  MICE is a great fetival where I know a lot of people, have a great crowd and I think I will sell my book well there, alongside the support of my friends.  This is my element, this is my lifes-blood, and the begining of my future - help me get there!!! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not all of you can contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • Tell other people about this compain!  ESPECIALLY if they like awesome ladies making comics...
  • Tell anyone you know in Boston to comic to MICE on the 29th, and help support local artists! 
  • If you know someone driving TO Boston from the midwest, let me know, that will super cut costs for me! 
  • Let me crash at your place!

story:
Hello everyone! My name is Leila del Duca and I’m a comic book artist currently living in Denver, CO. Like most comic book artists I know, I’ve been trying to clraw my way into the comic/art industry for a while now. Within the last several months, I’ve honed my craft and finally feel I’m ready to begin creating professional artwork for the comic book industry!

However, I’ve not drawn very many sequential art pages that would allow me the best opportunity to break into the industry. Predominantly, I’ve only drawn pin-ups and one-page illustrations. Somehow they seem easier and faster to do on a tight schedule. So my goal is I would like to challenge and prepare myself for working on “regular” deadlines by drawing 60 pages of sequential comics in 5 months!

To hit this goal, I will need to draw AND ink 3 pages a week. This can only be made possible with YOUR HELP! Your donations will contribute to supplies, shipping, printing, and partial living costs, allowing me to treat this as a part-time job for the next five months.

In exchange for your generosity and assistance, by participating in my IndieGoGo program, you will receive mini comics, limited edition sketchbooks, the complete collection of short comics, original art, a chance to be one of the characters, and more! You will also have access to weekly updates and be the first to see the art produced for this project.

So, 60 pages in 5 months?

What will these pages consist of? Well, true believers, these pages will consist of no less than 5 short comic stories! The subject matter will range from adventure to science fiction, from science to philosophy, from stream-of-consciousness to plotted tales. I will have stories that provoke thought and stories that just entertain. It will all be slightly random, yet well executed.

When I complete each of the short comics, I will post them online for everyone to read. I will also print them each separately into a mini-comic format. When all of them are finished they will be collected into one volume with a full-color cover. When all of the visual idea generation is complete, I’ll take all of my sketches and ideas and print them for the limited edition sketchbook.

For the top 3 most-generous donors, you will receive a hand-painted, wood cover version of the finished book and sketchbook combined! And I’m actually a decent painter, too!!

Along with the comics and sketchbook for incentive, there will be original, inked pages available as well as large cover prints. OR if you’ve donated enough, you’ll be written into one of the stories as a character and will receive a page of original artwork from that comic!! FUN! Please see the incentive descriptions below for more information.

I would absolutely love it if I had the chance to create 60 pages in 5 months instead of the 6 pages a YEAR that I’ve been doing. Help me to continue to improve my drawing skills exponentially and at the same time, provide you with some entertaining comic goodness!

Enjoy financially encouraging one of the few female comic book artists trying to get into the mainstream comic book industry! Receive cool swag! High five and thanks for considering my project!

story:
What's the deal?!

My name's Rebecca, and I'm a British student turned cartoonist. I've been living the US this year and in September I brought myself and a hastily made zine to the Small Press Expo. It was my first comic con and I had a wonderful time getting fired up about art with lovely people!

 

As my time on this side of the Atlantic draws to a close, I want to do it again! This time, instead of a quick zine, I want to make a 15 page minicomic that looks nice and entertains.

It's going to be a selection of stories about two birds, because birds are great. (check out the picture section for a peek)

 

As well as paying for the creation of the mini, you'll also be helping me transport myself from North Carolina to Toronto for the Toronto Comic Arts Festival in May. I love comics and I love festivals and going would mean I could meet up with freinds and be part of the comics love.

Also, if you buy a mini here and you're attending, I'll hand it right to you and we can chat and hug and stuff! 

 

Costs and Perks

So, as far as costs go here's how things break down:

printing and shipping of the mini: $100

travel to and from Toronto: $200

hotel whilst at TCAF: $300

indiegogo fees: $50

As Toronto is far away, the biggest expense is travel, if I get money over my goal, it'll be used to make the comics more swanky! Fancy cover paper, nicer printing, cover it in glitter? Who knows!

If I don't reach my goal, I'll downsize to a PDF comic and scour the web for the chapest thing with wheels headed north and hope I get there somehow!

So what do you get out of this? Well! First off you'll get the minicomic either in PDF form or the full printed wonder, shipped to you or handed in person. Up the ladder of perks, you can get exclusive doodle prints, custom watercolours and other art from me! Sounds pretty good right?

 

Why?

I love telling stories, and comics are what I want to do. I'm at my happiest creating things to share with people! With your support I can make a tangible thing and spend time getting inspired and it'd mean the world to me.

If you can't donate, tweets, reblogs, telling your freinds are all very much appreciated! Spread the word and with you support I can do this thing!

story:
‘Windrush: Gratitude and Vengeance’ is a five issue mini-series written and illustrated by T’sao Wei, winner of the Adventures in Comics 2 competition earlier in the year. The first 10 unlettered pages of Windrush issue 1 can be found here, or in the gallery on this page.

What’s the story?

Helen Mu, aka Windrush, once the greatest protector of Lambeth, has been assassinated! Now, her daughter, Lauren, is forced to take up the “Windrush” mantle to prevent the South London boroughs of Lambeth and Southwark from going to war!

What’s it about?

‘Windrush’ is a superhero comic that doesn’t follow the generic superhero model. It’s a very special project for me, as this is my first ongoing series and the first time that I ever truly enjoyed the unrelenting isolation of working on a comic book project. That enjoyment shows, as ‘Windrush’ embodies everything I love about fiction. It’s my love letter to the Chinese “Wuxia” genre, but disguised as a superhero comic.

Wuxia is often translated as “Chivalrous Knight”, but I prefer the translation “Martial Hero”. The characters of the Martial Hero genre tend to embody two distinct features: those who operate within normal society, and those who work outside of society. Outsiders are often said to exist in the “Jianghu” world, where the laws of normal society are generally of no concern to them, much like the chivalrous knights of the European tradition, who lived by their own set of moral codes. Windrush is a modern-day Wuxia heroine, fighting crime in the contemporary “Jianghu” within South London.

What will I use the funding for?

For the past two months, I’ve printed and bound each copy of ‘Windrush’ by hand, but this leaves me with very little time to do much else (like actually drawing the thing!).  The money will go purely towards the printing costs and marketing of this five issue mini-series.

 

International Shipping.

For anyone who wants to contribute, but lives outside of the UK, please add an extra $5 to the contribution.

 

Reviews for Issue 1:-

http://forbiddenplanet.co.uk/blog/2012/windrush-issue-1/

http://www.comicsbulletin.com/main/reviews/windrush-1

http://www.brokenfrontier.com/columns/p/detail/wake-me-up-before-you-indiegogo-kickstarting-the-small-press

story:
Missed the Campaign? www.CloverPress.us

 

Let's Take a Vote!

Raise your hand if you think comic books are the most superlative medium of communication since the world began! (I’ll wait). 

*COMICS FOR THE WIN!*

Now another vote…

Raise your hand if you think we need to valiantly fight for Truth, Justice, and the American Way. Raise it high if you feel we need to end any and all voter suppression and you advocate for equality and civil rights for all no matter their races, ethnic background, sexual orientation or gender identity, or age. 

Good! Good! All good! And now reach to the sky if you realize that these victories can be obtained because VOTING IS YOUR SUPER POWER!

In this 104 page book are rare, cool, vintage, comics collection, you will find a timeless and compelling message of inspiration, motivation, and duty to exercise your right to cast your vote for progressive action so badly needed today. And when you finish and put down this book you will not only have been entertained and enlightened, but you will have realized voting IS your superpower, more formidable than a bat-a-rang, x-ray vision, spider-sense, and a magic-lasso assembled together!

Brief History of Comics and Politics!

The mid-1950s were a fascinating period in comic book history. It is well known that ham-fisted “do-gooders” like psychiatrist Dr. Fredric Wertham in his book Seduction of the Innocent condemned comics as a corrupting influence on children. Then, the Senate investigated them as a cause of juvenile delinquency. This resulted in publishers, to save their skins, adopting a self censoring contrivance called the Comics Code Authority. 

All this frenzy before and after the Code drew a lot of attention to the fact that comics were a powerful form of communication passionately devoured by the public!

This spotlight on comic books alerted corporations and their advertising agencies, civic groups, religious organizations, and even the U.S. government about how comics were attractive, easily understood, engaging, and could be cheaply produced to crow about products, propagate ideologies, or push initiatives. Comics then and now can be passed out in factories, shops, schools, houses of worship, at state fairs, in streets, or sent inexpensively through the mail.

Of the estimated 25,000 different promotional/giveaway comics of the ’50s and early ’60s, a little more than a handful were devoted to the subject of voting. Sadly, these comics are the most relevant of all the mid-century titles in today’s world. The comics reprinted in Voting Is Your Superpower that were done first in the Cold War period and then in the Civil Rights era contain essential messages for today’s public.

 

Introduction by Julie (Catwoman) Newmar

Ironically Voting is Your Super Power is introduced by Julie Newmar, infamously known as a super-villain! Here the Tony-winning star of stage and screen known for her role as Catwoman now heroically roars to get out the vote! 

 

Our new voting super hero General Election!

And this exciting  buzz-worthy book is hosted by a new super hero for our times... General Election! In her first appearance General Election is ablaze with voting power on our special cover by Eisner nominee Sanford Greene the fan-favorite artist of Bitter Root.

 

The Man with the Plan, Craig Yoe

Edited, designed, and with a forward by Craig Yoe, Multiple Eisner Award winner.

 

The RARE, entertaining, and motivating comic books that are collected in their entirety in this fascinating must-have book!

Some of the top creative people and publishers were behind the comics about the importance of registering and voting. Your Vote Is Vital was drawn by the major talents Walter Kremer and Al Alvison for Harvey Comics (Richie Rich, Casper). In Your Vote Is Vital, Spokestoon Uncle Sam warns (via his math skills) how a voting minority can sway an election over a non-voting majority. 

The next two comics in Voting Is Your Super Power were published in 1952 by the now-defunct National Research Bureau as part of their Good Government Series. The Man Who Stole Your Vote would be quite amusing—if it wasn’t so true! Who is the real villain in this story, the strange hooded character or Fred, the stay-at-home voter? Read the comic to find out!

The other National Research Bureau comic, If Your Kids Could Vote, features a Greta Thunberg and a David Hogg of the ’50s chiding adults for their lax attitude towards their rights to cast their ballots. Spoiler alert: The parental units get helped by the kids. “A little child shall lead them.” 

An American Family Gets Out The Vote was produced by the American Heritage Foundation (not to be confused with today’s Heritage Foundation, one of the most influential conservative public policy organizations in the United States) and has some celeb cameos including Honest Abe Lincoln; Patrick Henry; Suffragette superhero and feminist, Susan B. Anthony; and even Lady of Liberty herself, the statue “whose beacon welcomes those who seek the freedom that America affords.” 

The free giveaway comic The Price You Pay For Graft is priceless. Out of all the promotional comics about voting, it is the most hard-hitting about corrupt politicians. The art is retro, but the message is grievously relevant. The comic speaks loudly from the past to voters of today about lobbyists. Contemporary citizens who didn’t vote in the last election or didn’t study carefully and consider the candidates, can read it and weep: “You elected the man who fills government positions with his friends and relatives. If you elect a dishonest politician, you will get a graft-ridden government.” The concluding admonitions ring truer than ever: ”Pick a candidate who has a clean record, who is responsible to no one but the voters… Remember: voting is free—but careless voting or not voting at all COSTS YOU PLENTY!” 

The NAACP’s own published comic, The Street Where You Live And What You Can Do To Improve It was drawn in 1960 by Tom Feelings. Feelings went on to win the Newberry Award and a Caldecott Honor, and captured not one, not two, but three Coretta Scott King Awards. Besides its laudable cause of getting Blacks to the polls, this comic book brings great dignity to the Black citizens young and old who inhabited this street—and streets like it across the land.

Leading comics historians say that the NAACP’s Your Future Rests… In Your Hands! (1964) was a Marvel Comic’s production. Probably co-edited by Stan Lee with the NAACP, it was drawn by Larry Leiber, Lee’s younger brother. Leiber even autographed the copy we reproduce, taken from the collection of Marvel historian, Nick Caputo. Your Future was lettered by Marvel’s calligrapher of this period, Sam Rosen. According to Caputo, Leiber’s pencil work may have been inked by Sol Brodsky with a few touches by Marie Severin.

A Marvel writer of Sgt. Fury, Allan Kurzok, working with the League of Women Voters in New York City, wrote and drew Voteman, the first superhero of voting. The League touted Voteman: “The New York City League of Women Voters has devised a comic book technique to inform residents of 63 slum neighborhoods of a voter registration drive. The actions of Voteman, the Black superhero of the simply-stated comic, are designed to indicate changes that the residents’ votes could help bring about within their communities.”

What You Can Get to Show Your Voter Support!

The 104 page book collecting rare historical COMPLETE comic books
promoting voter awareness!

 

2.25" x 2.25" metal backed pin button.

 

 

4" x 4" magnet.

 

 

4" x 6" mailing postcards.

 

 

Women's cut t-shirt with "General Election" graphic. 
"General Election" graphic available in men's cut.

 

 

"Voting is Your Superpower!" graphic on men's cut t-shirt.
Also available in women's cut.

 

The Team

Craig Yoe
Vice magazine has called Yoe the "Indiana Jones of comics historians." Publishers Weekly says he's the "archivist of the ridiculous and the sublime" and calls his work "brilliant." The Onion calls him "the celebrated designer," The Library Journal, "a comics guru". BoingBoing hails him "a fine cartoonist and a comic book historian of the first water." Yoe was Creative Director/Vice President/General Manager of Jim Henson's Muppets, and a Creative Director at Nickelodeon and Disney. Craig has won an Eisner Award and the Gold Medal from the Society of Illustrators.

Clizia Gussoni
Yoe Books are produced with cartoonist and designer Clizia Gussoni, author of the best-selling title, The Awesome Book of Sharks, The Awesome Book of Dinosaurs, and The Awesome Book of Bugs. In the Kid Power! series, I Care for The Earth, which she wrote, was awarded the Dr. Toy Best Green Product Award.

 

Clover Press is a progressive, eclectic, boutique publisher made up of four industry veterans. Our goal is to work on projects we have a strong passion for.

 

Risks and challenges

Clover Press is made up by a team of publishing professionals. While delays are always possible and sometimes impossible to control, the members of Clover are committed to delivering the best quality products in as timely a manner as possible.

General Election! In her first appearance General Election is ablaze with voting power on our special cover by Eisner nominee Sanford Greene the fan-favorite artist of Bitter Root. The Man with the Plan, Craig YoeEdited, designed, and with a forward by Craig Yoe, Multiple Eisner Award winner. The RARE, entertaining, and motivating comic books that are collected in their entirety in this fascinating must-have book!Some of the top creative people and publishers were behind the comics about the importance of registering and voting. Your Vote Is Vital was drawn by the major talents Walter Kremer and Al Alvison for Harvey Comics (Richie Rich, Casper). In Your Vote Is Vital, Spokestoon Uncle Sam warns (via his math skills) how a voting minority can sway an election over a non-voting majority. The next two comics in Voting Is Your Super Power were published in 1952 by the now-defunct National Research Bureau as part of their Good Government Series. The Man Who Stole Your Vote would be quite amusing—if it wasn’t so true! Who is the real villain in this story, the strange hooded character or Fred, the stay-at-home voter? Read the comic to find out!The other National Research Bureau comic, If Your Kids Could Vote, features a Greta Thunberg and a David Hogg of the ’50s chiding adults for their lax attitude towards their rights to cast their ballots. Spoiler alert: The parental units get helped by the kids. “A little child shall lead them.” An American Family Gets Out The Vote was produced by the American Heritage Foundation (not to be confused with today’s Heritage Foundation, one of the most influential conservative public policy organizations in the United States) and has some celeb cameos including Honest Abe Lincoln; Patrick Henry; Suffragette superhero and feminist, Susan B. Anthony; and even Lady of Liberty herself, the statue “whose beacon welcomes those who seek the freedom that America affords.” The free giveaway comic The Price You Pay For Graft is priceless. Out of all the promotional comics about voting, it is the most hard-hitting about corrupt politicians. The art is retro, but the message is grievously relevant. The comic speaks loudly from the past to voters of today about lobbyists. Contemporary citizens who didn’t vote in the last election or didn’t study carefully and consider the candidates, can read it and weep: “You elected the man who fills government positions with his friends and relatives. If you elect a dishonest politician, you will get a graft-ridden government.” The concluding admonitions ring truer than ever: ”Pick a candidate who has a clean record, who is responsible to no one but the voters… Remember: voting is free—but careless voting or not voting at all COSTS YOU PLENTY!” The NAACP’s own published comic, The Street Where You Live And What You Can Do To Improve It was drawn in 1960 by Tom Feelings. Feelings went on to win the Newberry Award and a Caldecott Honor, and captured not one, not two, but three Coretta Scott King Awards. Besides its laudable cause of getting Blacks to the polls, this comic book brings great dignity to the Black citizens young and old who inhabited this street—and streets like it across the land.Leading comics historians say that the NAACP’s Your Future Rests… In Your Hands! (1964) was a Marvel Comic’s production. Probably co-edited by Stan Lee with the NAACP, it was drawn by Larry Leiber, Lee’s younger brother. Leiber even autographed the copy we reproduce, taken from the collection of Marvel historian, Nick Caputo. Your Future was lettered by Marvel’s calligrapher of this period, Sam Rosen. According to Caputo, Leiber’s pencil work may have been inked by Sol Brodsky with a few touches by Marie Severin.A Marvel writer of Sgt. Fury, Allan Kurzok, working with the League of Women Voters in New York City, wrote and drew Voteman, the first superhero of voting. The League touted Voteman: “The New York City League of Women Voters has devised a comic book technique to inform residents of 63 slum neighborhoods of a voter registration drive. The actions of Voteman, the Black superhero of the simply-stated comic, are designed to indicate changes that the residents’ votes could help bring about within their communities.”What You Can Get to Show Your Voter Support!The 104 page book collecting rare historical COMPLETE comic bookspromoting voter awareness! 2.25" x 2.25" metal backed pin button.  4" x 4" magnet.  4" x 6" mailing postcards.  Women's cut t-shirt with "General Election" graphic. "General Election" graphic available in men's cut.  "Voting is Your Superpower!" graphic on men's cut t-shirt.Also available in women's cut. The TeamCraig YoeVice magazine has called Yoe the "Indiana Jones of comics historians." Publishers Weekly says he's the "archivist of the ridiculous and the sublime" and calls his work "brilliant." The Onion calls him "the celebrated designer," The Library Journal, "a comics guru". BoingBoing hails him "a fine cartoonist and a comic book historian of the first water." Yoe was Creative Director/Vice President/General Manager of Jim Henson's Muppets, and a Creative Director at Nickelodeon and Disney. Craig has won an Eisner Award and the Gold Medal from the Society of Illustrators.Clizia GussoniYoe Books are produced with cartoonist and designer Clizia Gussoni, author of the best-selling title, The Awesome Book of Sharks, The Awesome Book of Dinosaurs, and The Awesome Book of Bugs. In the Kid Power! series, I Care for The Earth, which she wrote, was awarded the Dr. Toy Best Green Product Award. Clover Press is a progressive, eclectic, boutique publisher made up of four industry veterans. Our goal is to work on projects we have a strong passion for. Risks and challengesClover Press is made up by a team of publishing professionals. While delays are always possible and sometimes impossible to control, the members of Clover are committed to delivering the best quality products in as timely a manner as possible.

story:
A Lot of people ask for money  for a good reason. this isn't that. necessarily. 

My name is Dave Elvis Hixx.Long time roadie and assistant to Nashville stars... and ELVIS doppelganger .

Heres the deal....

I feel that it is my DESTINY to be a BON VIVANT. A lover of life .And I believe funding will help me achieve my dream. There is no college to become a Bon Vivant . A beginner has very few options . There are no entry level jobs, for a young Bon Vivant. This is like scholarship money...Bon Vivant lessons, if you will...

 I want to travel.I want to  party. i dont want to worry. i want to be a BON VIVANT. i want to taste everything. i want to go everywhere. I want to be surrounded by pretty women. I want to go to Graceland.

 I am just a humble guy with a DREAM . this is a way I can  start to have some fun.... I BELIEVE  partying will do it. I have an unshakable faith. This will work!

I don't even know how much this is gonna take , but thru extensive research , I've concluded  100,000 will get me started. 

i mean, they print it everyday, right?

 just a little bit from everybody........nothin too crazy.....

so lets all get serious  on this...LETS PARTY BALLS

bon vi·vant

 [bon vee-vahnt; French bawn vee-vahn] 

noun, plural bons vi·vants [bon vee-vahnts; French bawn vee-vahn] 

a person who lives luxuriously and enjoys good food and drink.

story:
A 99-page independent cyberpunk comic and the debut mini-series by co-creators, Peter Marshall Smith (writer, letters) and Sandy Brion Spreitz (artist, colors).

We need your help to reach our goal in this print drive for METAZOA, a new sci-fi adventure set on a parallel world where the vertebrate Animalia have evolved and developed an advanced civilization that is rich in honor, but unable to live in peace.

Metazoa is a comic cloaked in an allegory in the tradition of George Orwell's Animal Farm; an ideological critique of class inequity with anthropomorphic characters. In this modern society, where the Animalia are oppressed by corruption, threatened by environmental collapse, and seeped in cultural apathy, there is an escape hatch… cyberspace. Many Animalia retreat into that virtual realm and ignore the real world as it slides further into decline.

Among the many characters in Metazoa the central one is Ram, a grizzly bear and dangerous adept. But Ram is no hero. He's a street-wise survivor with a violent temper navigating a violent world as a hacker for hire.

Ram strolls the streets of the new ghetto camouflaged like any true hustler in his element. Reflexes cranked but pulse steady. Absolute concentration. Absolute control. But his edge is about to slip when he meets a beautiful cottontail rabbit and accepts a contract for a mysterious organization known as the 5C, a group of environmental activists fighting to preserve the natural world. They are revolutionary agents of change – modern day Robin Hoods who have been flagged as enemies of the state. The time of peace has ended and Ram, an ex-soldier with no cause left to fight for, has found himself in the middle of a new war.

THE CO-CREATORS

For illustrator, Sandy Brion Spreitz, Metazoa started when his childhood friend, Peter Marshall Smith, reached out to him. Peter remembered a comic character that Sandy had created back in 1984 named Ram. Here are a few old sketches:

Peter sent Sandy the script for Metazoa Book One and when Sandy read it he said: 
"A little voice inside of me said, 'Yes! Yes!' We plugged away through character development and storyboards... Once we finalized our look and refined our process, I was amazed and astounded at the results. And if I am not mistaken, so was Peter. Most of my career has been greeting cards and editorial illustration. It never occurred to me to do comics professionally. Now, I work 7 days a week on Metazoa. I wake up and get right to work. At night, I dream of Metazoa. This project has been an act of love. And it has renewed my interest in all things... This book is dedicated to that little voice in all of us! Long live Metazoa!"

METAZOA #1 AND #2 ARE NOW AVAILABLE HERE ON COMIXOLOGY SUBMIT, but if you contribute now you will receive an additional digital issue before it is released to the public! All 3 issues constitute volume one of an the mini-series entitled METAZOA: WILDLIFE. Although we're excited to share Ram's adventures with you digitally, we need your help to print paperback and hardcover editions of the 1st volume. Here are mockups of the planned printed editions of METAZOA Vol.1

BREAKDOWN

We need $6,000 to cover the following expenses:


2.5" x 3.5" 14 pt. Glossy Cardstock Full Color Front and Back Trading Cards

You get 5 trading cards printed from hand-painted art by Sandy Brion Spreitz and containing background on characters in METAZOA. Exclusive to INDIEGOGO only!

ORIGINAL PAINTINGS

 Sandy Spreitz is offering one original painting for the highest level of contribution.

DESKTOP WALLPAPER

HIGH RESOLUTION DIGITAL WALLPAPER painted by Sandy Brion Spreitz

PIN-UPS

5 HIGH RESOLUTION DIGITAL BUNNY PIN-UPS  painted by Sandy Brion Spreitz

T-SHIRTS

WITH 5C LOGO (IN RED OR GREEN)

CONTRIBUTE HERE

HELP SPREAD THE WORD

If you want this publishing project to happen as much as we do, help spread the word about METAZOA by linking to this page with the hashtag #METAZOA.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONSIDERED SUPPORT

1)  To complete all physical orders, please provide an address upon registration.

2)  Digital prize packages will be provided in PDF format.

SHIPPING AND TAXES

All international backers outside of the United States, please add :

  • $5 to cover the extra invoicing costs for every Perk, INCLUDING those containing only digital contents.
  • $10 to cover the extra invoicing costs for every Perk of $45 and over.
Or contact us at metazoacomic@gmail.com to define shipping and taxes costs.

story:
Who am I?  What do I need?

I am an intelligent, vivacious, female who strives to develop a production company that will produce comedy showcases for the Senior market. By developing the Cucchiani brand, I will be able to market the production company more effectively. Consequently, I am passionate about auditioning for America's Got Talent (AGT). And, AGT 2014 becomes a focal point for me because I need a kidney transplant and may be unable to travel extensively if I wait another season. 

As a graduate of various comedy classes, seminary and business school, I have reinvented myself into a Senior comic in the 3D age of social media. Youth see me as hip while the old, risqué`.  And, baby boomers just appreciate that I did not inhale (too much) during my wild years.   I only have one unpolished set on Youtube; as, I do not want my jokes stolen before the auditions. Remember, joke telling is more about cadence, stage presence and nuance than words. 

I am seeking $3,500 to finance airfare, lodging and food for at least 10 days in Los Angeles. The trip will allow me to audition with America's Got Talent in February 2014. I have chosen to audition for the final auditions because I want the opportunity to fine tune my material and build my confidence with a few more shows.

The Impact of Your Giving

Today, many venues and younger comics are not Senior friendly. Accordingly, the Senior market has been underserved. The audition experience will help promote Cucchiani & Friends Comedy Productions at various Senior facilities.  Producing comedy showcases for the Senior market,  inspires Seniors to laugh and barters stage time for comics of all ages who wish to write clean material even if some is risqué`.  Most shows only raise enough cash for a gas allotment; so, nobody is looking to get rich.

Our motto is never to use any word not found in the bible. It is such an old book with many translations that it makes for its own dictionary. Our material is clean even when risqué` with many jokes and puns crafted on biblical material and our vast life experiences.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, not everyone has money to share. So, what about your time, talent, and ideas?

If I make it to the televised rounds (I am allowed to dream), I will need your votes and prayers if you so indulge.

If you have an IDEA for an ORIGINAL joke, send it to me and I will try to work one up.

Please take the time to spread the word and like my page on Face Book, Cucchiani-The Preaching Comic. Rest assured that Cucchiani & Friends would love to entertain at your next event.

May God bless you for reading this proposal and bless you real good if you take some action.  

 

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
My name is HollisAnn, and I am the sole creator of "The Rogue Duchess" comic book series. In 2009, I was diagnosed with Bipolar 1, and have been struggling with this mental disorder for the majority of my 25 years. However, my skills as an artist have kept me motivated to maintain a positive lifestyle, and it is my personal goal to put my artwork into as many comic book stores as possible.

In order to get started, I will need money for production and distribution. 
-Production: The comic books are printed from a digital printing site, costing about $3 per copy. In other words, 50 copies costs about $150, and 100 copies costs $300, etc. 
-Distribution: I am currently the sole distributor of my work, and thus, shipping fees apply directly to me.  
If I obtain my goal of $1,000 or more, I will contribute a minimum of $750 toward production, and the remainder will be set aside for distribution.
If I obtain less than $1,000, I will contribute three quarters of whatever I receive toward production, and the remaining quarter toward distribution.
Thank you for your consideration and contribution!

story:
Introduction 

Hi there! My name is Hady A. Hamid. I've been reading comic books since I was 12, and ever since then, I've been fascinated by the world of superheroes, fantasy and sci-fi. Those elements immediately struck me as something I can hang on to, since as a kid, I needed to constantly escape to a world where good truly triumphs over evil.

I've been creating my own comic book characters since 12, but started refining them when I hit 20. And the dream just kept getting bigger and bigger, and more real as I began to realize that I could actually write many stories about my characters, and write them well. At present, Red Grade Comics has over 200 characters that will span over 300+ issues.

Professionally, I'm a TV writer with 7 years of experience, and I've recently graduated from Chapman University with a Bachelor in Creative Producing. It was there that I learned how to combine my comic book knowledge and writing skills with real-world media business strategies and know-how. 

"Be Part of a New Era, Be Part of Red Grade Comics" is my campaign to raise funds required to set up Red Grade Comics and its official site, redgradecomics.com, which will act as the main distribution platform for our digital comics.

As of now, we already have an official Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/redgradecomics) that contains many of our selected promotional images. We have an official blog called The Red Grade (http://redgrade.wordpress.com/) that features important updates regarding the progress of Red Grade-related matters, as well as links to new images. We have also recently completed the inaugural issue of Eras #0, and are looking towards finishing Eras #1-#20 to complete our first story arc, "Rebirth".

Who is "we" that I've been talking about? Well, it's just me and my best friend/artist, Muhammad Ali. We realize that we can no longer do this part-time. We need assemble a team that can commit full-time in order for us to achieve our 1 June 2016 launch date.

By contributing to our campaign, you'll help us get a step further to achieving our goal, and you will also be part of a new era of comic books!


What's in It for You?

We have actually worked out the math, and we need a total of $400,000 to run our operation for the first two years. My artist and I have agreed to contribute $60,000, and so we are seeking the remaining $340,000 through investors, grants and crowd-funding.

But for now, we are testing the waters with this campaign to see whether we can raise funds, while at the same time, market our brand. The $40,000 that we seek will go towards setting up the team, producing subsequent issues, developing the website and producing marketing materials.

Now, you may ask yourself, "What's in it for you?"

Since our comic books will mostly be distributed digitally, the top 500 contributors will be able to receive single-issue physical copies of Eras #0-#2! The top 50 contributors will be able to receive hardcover physical copies of Eras #0-#20, the entire story arc of "Rebirth"! And, the top 5 contributors will be able to have their names used as characters (hero or villain)!

Exciting, isn't it?

But what if we don't actually reach our targeted amount? Well, we'll still use whatever money we get to set up our team. Because this dream...it's never going to die. It's been with me since I was 12, and that was back in 1996. Now, you kinda have an idea why we plan to launch in 2016 - to mark the 20 years of developing our dream!


Our Conviction

I was raised with a lot of American pop culture, one of which was comic books. To this day, comic books are still considered one of the best exports of America, and I believe it's because of the values embedded within them.

Call me old-fashioned, but I believe in living life with certain values.

At Red Grade Comics, our mission statement is as such: To share great and inspiring stories with the rest of the world. Because I believe a story shouldn't just be about exciting twists and turns or exploitation. I believe a story should come with a potent, responsible message for society. It can be dark, fantastical and even whimsical, but what's the point of telling a story if people can't learn from it?

The aforementioned 300+ issues that we have planned...they will be spread across five major Books - Faith, Justice, Hope, Freedom and Peace. Through these five convictions, we aim to share stories that not only inspire on an aesthetic level, but also on a societal level.


Call-to-Action

Just 'cause you can't contribute financially, doesn't mean you can't contribute at all.

If this campaign really means something to you, you still can do us a solid by helping us get the word out, and make some noise about "Be Part of a New Era, Be Part of Red Grade Comics"!

You can either use the available Indiegogo share tools or head on down to our official Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/redgradecomics) and/or our official blog, The Red Grade (http://redgrade.wordpress.com/) to "Like", "Subscribe" and "Share" our campaign, latest news and updates on our lead up to the launch.
