"Be Part of a New Era, Be Part of Red Grade Comics" is my campaign to raise funds required to set up Red Grade Comics and its official site, redgradecomics.com, which will act as the main distribution platform for our digital comics.
As of now, we already have an official Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/redgradecomics) that contains many of our selected promotional images. We have an official blog called The Red Grade (http://redgrade.wordpress.com/) that features important updates regarding the progress of Red Grade-related matters, as well as links to new images. We have also recently completed the inaugural issue of Eras #0, and are looking towards finishing Eras #1-#20 to complete our first story arc, "Rebirth".
Who is "we" that I've been talking about? Well, it's just me and my best friend/artist, Muhammad Ali. We realize that we can no longer do this part-time. We need assemble a team that can commit full-time in order for us to achieve our 1 June 2016 launch date.
By contributing to our campaign, you'll help us get a step further to achieving our goal, and you will also be part of a new era of comic books!



What's in It for You?
We have actually worked out the math, and we need a total of $400,000 to run our operation for the first two years. My artist and I have agreed to contribute $60,000, and so we are seeking the remaining $340,000 through investors, grants and crowd-funding.
But for now, we are testing the waters with this campaign to see whether we can raise funds, while at the same time, market our brand. The $40,000 that we seek will go towards setting up the team, producing subsequent issues, developing the website and producing marketing materials.
Now, you may ask yourself, "What's in it for you?"
Since our comic books will mostly be distributed digitally, the top 500 contributors will be able to receive single-issue physical copies of Eras #0-#2! The top 50 contributors will be able to receive hardcover physical copies of Eras #0-#20, the entire story arc of "Rebirth"! And, the top 5 contributors will be able to have their names used as characters (hero or villain)!
Exciting, isn't it?
But what if we don't actually reach our targeted amount? Well, we'll still use whatever money we get to set up our team. Because this dream...it's never going to die. It's been with me since I was 12, and that was back in 1996. Now, you kinda have an idea why we plan to launch in 2016 - to mark the 20 years of developing our dream!



Our Conviction
I was raised with a lot of American pop culture, one of which was comic books. To this day, comic books are still considered one of the best exports of America, and I believe it's because of the values embedded within them.
Call me old-fashioned, but I believe in living life with certain values.
At Red Grade Comics, our mission statement is as such: To share great and inspiring stories with the rest of the world. Because I believe a story shouldn't just be about exciting twists and turns or exploitation. I believe a story should come with a potent, responsible message for society. It can be dark, fantastical and even whimsical, but what's the point of telling a story if people can't learn from it?
The aforementioned 300+ issues that we have planned...they will be spread across five major Books - Faith, Justice, Hope, Freedom and Peace. Through these five convictions, we aim to share stories that not only inspire on an aesthetic level, but also on a societal level.

Call-to-Action
Just 'cause you can't contribute financially, doesn't mean you can't contribute at all.
If this campaign really means something to you, you still can do us a solid by helping us get the word out, and make some noise about "Be Part of a New Era, Be Part of Red Grade Comics"!
You can either use the available Indiegogo share tools or head on down to our official Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/redgradecomics) and/or our official blog, The Red Grade (http://redgrade.wordpress.com/) to "Like", "Subscribe" and "Share" our campaign, latest news and updates on our lead up to the launch.

story:
Galaxafreaks will eat your brain!

Then chew it up and spit it out in a reconstructed mind-freak! Trust me, you'll feel better for it!

Exciting times! Thank you so much everyone! I hit my target within 48 hours! Please continue to order your copy or many of the other perks! This will be a limited run so get yours now before they run out!

My name is Andrew Pawley, I'm a pencil squeezer based on the South Coast of England. I draw freaky comics and illustrations. You might know me from my Captain Yeah! comics.

I've been working on a comic book called Galaxafreaks about galaxy sized weirdoes getting up to all sorts of shenanigans! I work using digital media and have been publishing web-comics for a while now. I love the ol'interweb but would also love to spread my cosmic funk-juice through the medium of printed 'zines.

Who are the Galaxafreaks?

Where to start? Basically the Galaxafreaks are a bunch of friends who happen to be the size of whole galaxies. However, the whole story takes place inside the brain of a cosmic universal baby who lives inside a Higgs Boson particle. Obviously!

Here's a glimpse of some of the action!


 

 

 

Galaxafreaks will be exclusively available in print as a 32 page, full colour comic book. None of the content will appear online (apart from the teaser story below). If you could help make this a reality (what is reality anyway?) then I'd be able to continue freaking people's mind for just that little bit longer!

You never know, if it's successful I might be able to make it a series and stop washing dishes!

 

I've finished over half the comic already and will be posting glimpses and exclusive updates here as the project progresses.

However, to get this freak-show on the road I need to raise funds to pay for the printing & distribution of the old beast. 

Galaxafreaks Test Pages

No support is too little or too much!

There are a full range of perks to suit all types of pockets including;

  • A copy of the final printed comic
  • Original artwork
  • Appearing as a Galaxafreak!! (cosmic!!)

I really hope you can help out and get freaky with these dudes!

How else can you help out?

If you're strapped for cash, don't worry none, you can still lend a hand:

  • Make as much noise as possible on social media

@drewdrewcito http://www.facebook.com/andrewpawleyillustration

  • Give those Indiegogo share tools a good ol'clicking!!

story:
October 2011: The "Annie MacCool" October Project began with a 10 page black and white excerpt published on Tumblr: http://anniemaccool.tumblr.com/page/2

October 2012: "Annie MacCool #1: Shadow of the Wolf" is released on Graphicly: http://graphicly.com/optimus-media-group/annie-maccool/1

CUT TO: Summer 2013 "Annie MacCool #2: Transmogrification" is near completion and this year a new release initiative is underway:

The "Annie MacCool IndieGoGo Campaign"

I'd like to offer the second issue of "Annie MacCool" direct to the audience as well as bolster production efforts on the Print Edition Graphic Novel, which, if properly supported, can be ready for release by the end of the year. 

Here's where you can help! DRM Free Digital Downloads will be available as the individual issues are released, and you can grab those for as little as $1. 

The Graphic Novel will be made available at the $50 donation level.

Check out the "Perks" section to learn how you can help and get cool bonuses such as Custom Wolfling Portraits and even your very own "Moment of Transmogrification" Customized Origin Story. 

Even if you can't directly contribute, spreading the word via your own social media platforms is just as valuable. 

From the bottom of my lycanthropic heart, I humbly thank you and look forward to bringing this project to the next level with your generous support. 

Slainte,

Joseph Walter White

story:
“[W]riter David Hedges and artist Jefferson Costa…perfectly blend steampunk and the supernatural.”—IndieBam [4.5/5]

 
ARCANE SALLY & MR. STEAM is an original supernatural steampunk mystery in the form of a ten issue comic book miniseries.

 

BE A PART OF SOMETHING BIG!

 

Sponsors get it all—all digital rewards and one copy of the digital & print versions of ALL TEN ISSUES, both standard and limited cover versions, as they are completed, EACH ISSUE SIGNED BY WRITER DAVID HEDGES + the official "Her Majesty's Inquiry into Peculiar Circumstance" Crest Sticker & Pin + all other stickers + Alice Key Necklace + Zombie Cameo Skeleton Key + the collected Artbook of Jeff's B/W original drawings + postcard set.

Every sponsor will be ACKNOWLEDGED in all subsequent digital and print editions, unless they choose to remain anonymous.

Sponsors will receive the 11.7×16.5 (A3) FULL COLOR PRINT of comic book artwork, SIGNED BY ARTIST JEFFERSON COSTA + the 11x17 full color poster.

And LAST BUT NOT LEAST—Sponsors will receive an ORIGINAL 11.7×16.5 (A3) BLACK & WHITE ARTIST SKETCH, SIGNED by Jefferson Costa!

 

PREVIEW

 

In Victorian England, Lord Percival Cawthorne, a rogue agent of the British Crown, and his faithful manservant Runnymede, must stop an elusive mastermind from unleashing Lewis Carroll’s most dangerous mathematical theories and altering the very nature of reality.

 

Teamed up with a mysterious and obstinate agent named Miss Sally, they set out on the trail of a murderer who has already been tried and executed. In short order, our intrepid gentlemen find themselves up to their cufflinks in saber duels, doomed locomotives, dire mathematical equations, homicidal reanimates, dueling airships, and—most terrifying of all—strong-willed women!

 

By the story’s end, one of these daring agents will meet with Death; the other will face something far worse: True Love.

 

 

 

 

 

The script is by David Alton Hedges, a screenwriter from Los Angeles, CA. In 2013 David was the winner of the prestigious Academy Nicholl Screenwriting Fellowship, and a PAGE International Screenwriting competition semi-finalist.

The art is by Jefferson Costa, a prolific, award-winning comic book artist and animator from São Paulo, Brazil.

 

 

In other words, we're two experienced, dedicated, and proven creators, and you can be sure Arcane Sally & Mr. Steam is going to be a great story and a beautiful book!

 

 

11X17 PRINT

 

11X17 POSTER

HANDMADE ZOMBIE CAMEO SKELETON KEYS (EACH UNIQUE)

ALICE IN WONDERLAND SKELETON KEY NECKLACE

 

ORIGINAL ART (EXAMPLES)

 

 

SKETCHBOOK (PDF)

An exclusive glimpse into Jeff's creative process—his original concept sketches and character designs.

ARTBOOK (PHYSICAL)

 

SALLY'S THEME (MP3)

Sally's Theme was composed by the super talented Little Heroes bandmembers James Lombardo and Sean Price, and comes with a secret bonus track!

CREST STICKER & ENAMEL PIN

 

 

HALLOWEEN STICKER SET

 

 

POSTCARD SET

 

WALLPAPER

story:
Newark Comic Con 2016  -  Bigger and Better


Newark Comic Con - 2015 was a huge success!

On Saturday, September 12th, over five thousand people from all over the country came out and participated in our inaugural pop cultural event. 

Everyone was awesome, from our hard working volunteers, amazing vendors,  talented artists, celebrity guests to of course all the wonderful attendees who spent their hard earned money. They all came to Newark, NJ and had a incredible time.

One of the main snags in the event was we needed more space. There were so many fun filled exciting things going on and so many people, but things got a little crowded.     We see the problem and we are ready to fix it.

Newark Comic Con 2016 will be held in a larger venue. We want a venue that is able to accommodate more celebrity guests, more interactive activities such as Anime / Cosplay / Panel Discussions / Short Films and more!  

 Partner with us to help make Newark Comic Con 2016 even Bigger and Better !

By contributing to this campaign you will make our goal of producing a top notch comic con a reality!  Your contribution will give us the ability to bring you the best.

Your contribution will go towards

Larger Venue -  Newark Comic Con is  hoping to secure either the Prudential Arena or the New Jersey Performing Arts Center. 

  • Your contribution will go towards = Venue Rental Fee

  • Celebrity Guests- We want to book your favorite A list celebrities and artists.
  •  Your contribution will go towards = Air Fare -Hotel- Appearance Fee

         

Planning  for 2016 has begun. Our team is meeting daily to discuss ways to improve our upcoming show.

Along with your contributions, send us your ideas and suggestions.

       Here are a few folks who were at Newark Comic Con.                                                            Lets hear what they have to say.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram !
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hey there, I'm Angela Klecker. I'm an amateur webcomic artist and online artist! I've been making webcomics since I was 16 years old. I'm here to show you my exciting new webcomic, Clam Punchers.

What is Clam punchers?



Clam Punchers(no pun intended) is a psychological horror involving our two protagonists, Lawrence and Basil. While making fun of a romantic comedy at a drive in movie theater, SPOOKY things begin to happen! Returning home, things just get exponentially worse...prepare for things to get messed up.

Are the disturbing sounds and eerie phenomena someone's sick prank, or is something else lurking in the shadows? Are the two in grave danger? Expect creepy crawlies, stupid jokes, unexpected twists, a few tears, and spilled snacks! Not to mention their favorite electronic dance legends, CLAM PUNCHERS!

Helping fund this campaign will make clam punchers a full time job for me for 6 months, which means several weekly updates! 6 months should be enough to finish the comic in its entirety, its no more than 75 pages long.

Here is a sample page(The first page)!


Funding and Perks

In order to work on clam punchers full-time, I will need my basic living expenses taken care of. I've broken it down to $1000 a month for 6 months($6000 total). This will be just enough to keep rent, bills, food, gas, etc. in check. We're currently not doing too well financially so this would be a godsend if I could do what I love and not worry about living expenses.

The extra $500 is to cover indiegogo's fees.

Here comes the fun part, right?

WHAT YOU'LL GET:

$1: My personal thanks!! Every dollar counts and you are helping make my dreams come true.

$15: Access to the exclusive mailing list! This includes access to secret livestreams, concept art, and easter eggs! I'll also answer any questions anyone has on the official email.

$30: A PDF of clam punchers and EARLY ACCESS TO THE EPILOGUE!

$75: A sketch of the boys, signed by me and sent to you! I'll write you a cute little note and hug the letter before sending it off. This is the only physical tier so its SPECIAL!

$100:  You get to be an extra, as in actually in the comic! hooray!

$500: You get to be a minor character! You do stuff and interact with the characters, NEAT!

$1000: You are AMAZING. You get an custom illustrated thank you page and a promo for your webpage or blog!!


What your contribution does

This will be my first independently funded webcomic and possibly the start of my art career. It will give me financial stability for me and my fiance, while doing what I genuinely love.

I'm incredibly passionate about this story and so are the people I've shared it with! Please, help me fund my future of webcomic making!


Can't fund? You can still help!

Signal boost, share with everyone! Use the indiegogo share buttons, tell your friends, post to tumblr and facebook!

MAKE CLAM PUNCHERS A REALITY!

story:
Let's Try This Again

This will be the second time through this campaign. Last time we raised $1500, but we're still $2000 short of our goal. We've got enough to get through colors on issue #4, but we still need extra funds in order to finish issue #5 and complete the letters for issues #2-5. 

We're still offering the same perks as last time, including getting drawn into the book as a demon, human or zombie. The only change is that now instead of our major perk being getting drawn into the book as the Devil, we are offering to be drawn into the book as GOD. 

Our Story

My Name is Russell Nohelty.  I've got one book, Ichabod Jones:  Monster Hunter, that will be published through Viper Comics later this year.  It's a great book but I want to keep moving forward with new comics as well. My next four issue mini-series will be KATRINA HATES DEAD SHIT. (http://www.katrinacomic.com/)


KATRINA HATES DEAD SHIT follows a badass chick who survives the Rapture and now lives in a small town full of demons, Hellspawn and a smattering of dreadful survivors. 


Things are about as terrible as one would imagine after the Rapture but given the circumstances Katrina is taking not being "blue-lighted" pretty well. Even though she's got a terrible job, horrible co-workers, a leeching ex-roommate and a miserable attitude to boot things could always get worse...somehow.  


Things become so dreadful for Katrina that she decides to fight back in a most extreme manner, by traveling to hell and forcing the Devil to end the Apocalypse once and for all.  


KATRINA HATES DEAD SHIT is a 4 issue mini-series that gives a tongue in cheek look at how surviving the Apocalypse will suck donkey balls but it's not the end of the world. 


Katrina is drawn by the uber talented Juan Frigeri (http://spadjm.deviantart.com/) colored by the amazing Thomas Bacon (http://thomasbacon.webs.com/) and lettered by the fantastic Bernie Lee (http://www.comicspace.com/blee/).  

What We Need & What You Get

I'm already in production on the first issue of Katrina, but I frankly need money to keep this project going through the first issue.  I'm currently in production on three books with a fourth to follow.  Because I use only top quality talent and never scrimp on hiring a fantastic artist it's become too costly to keep more than one book in production at any given time.  


You can see the fruits of hiring top tier talent by reading the first eleven pages of issue #1 athttp://www.katrinacomic.com/.


That's where you come in.  Without your help more issues of Katrina Hates Dead Shit might never happen and that would be a shame because it's a great story for any fans of Apocalyptic books, horror books, comedy books or any fan of comics young or old (though not too young).  I like to say that it's Left Behind told as a comedy.   


Take a look at the perks on the side and even if you can help with $1 it would be great.  If you can help more than you'll see some really cool perks including copies of the book all the way up to being drawn as the DEVIL in our final issue!  That's right Katrina travels into Hell to confront the Devil and that could be you!   


I know this is a pretty ambitious goal, but I'm a pretty ambitious guy and I know with your help we'll get there!  


DRAWN INTO THE BOOK


If you decide on a perk that included being drawn into the book, please email me with your choice at katrinahatesdeadshit@gmail.com



Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't get help financially, you can still help get the word out by friending us on facebook, following me on twitter and blasting your friends to help give money to the campaign.
story_txt:
Let's Try This Again
This will be the second time through this campaign. Last time we raised $1500, but we're still $2000 short of our goal. We've got enough to get through colors on issue #4, but we still need extra funds in order to finish issue #5 and complete the letters for issues #2-5. 

We're still offering the same perks as last time, including getting drawn into the book as a demon, human or zombie. The only change is that now instead of our major perk being getting drawn into the book as the Devil, we are offering to be drawn into the book as GOD. 
Our Story
My Name is Russell Nohelty.  I've got one book, Ichabod Jones:  Monster Hunter, that will be published through Viper Comics later this year.  It's a great book but I want to keep moving forward with new comics as well. My next four issue mini-series will be KATRINA HATES DEAD SHIT. (http://www.katrinacomic.com/)

KATRINA HATES DEAD SHIT follows a badass chick who survives the Rapture and now lives in a small town full of demons, Hellspawn and a smattering of dreadful survivors. 


Things are about as terrible as one would imagine after the Rapture but given the circumstances Katrina is taking not being "blue-lighted" pretty well. Even though she's got a terrible job, horrible co-workers, a leeching ex-roommate and a miserable attitude to boot things could always get worse...somehow.  

Things become so dreadful for Katrina that she decides to fight back in a most extreme manner, by traveling to hell and forcing the Devil to end the Apocalypse once and for all.  
KATRINA HATES DEAD SHIT is a 4 issue mini-series that gives a tongue in cheek look at how surviving the Apocalypse will suck donkey balls but it's not the end of the world. 

Katrina is drawn by the uber talented Juan Frigeri (http://spadjm.deviantart.com/) colored by the amazing Thomas Bacon (http://thomasbacon.webs.com/) and lettered by the fantastic Bernie Lee (http://www.comicspace.com/blee/).  




What We Need & What You Get
I'm already in production on the first issue of Katrina, but I frankly need money to keep this project going through the first issue.  I'm currently in production on three books with a fourth to follow.  Because I use only top quality talent and never scrimp on hiring a fantastic artist it's become too costly to keep more than one book in production at any given time.  

You can see the fruits of hiring top tier talent by reading the first eleven pages of issue #1 athttp://www.katrinacomic.com/.

That's where you come in.  Without your help more issues of Katrina Hates Dead Shit might never happen and that would be a shame because it's a great story for any fans of Apocalyptic books, horror books, comedy books or any fan of comics young or old (though not too young).  I like to say that it's Left Behind told as a comedy.   

Take a look at the perks on the side and even if you can help with $1 it would be great.  If you can help more than you'll see some really cool perks including copies of the book all the way up to being drawn as the DEVIL in our final issue!  That's right Katrina travels into Hell to confront the Devil and that could be you!   

I know this is a pretty ambitious goal, but I'm a pretty ambitious guy and I know with your help we'll get there!  

DRAWN INTO THE BOOK

If you decide on a perk that included being drawn into the book, please email me with your choice at katrinahatesdeadshit@gmail.com


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't get help financially, you can still help get the word out by friending us on facebook, following me on twitter and blasting your friends to help give money to the campaign.

story:
Danger Girls: A New World

The next production of Fotocomix: The Cinematic Graphic Novel

The story follows two women (Lily and Colette Dangerous) as they make their way through a post apocalyptic, steampunk society. Here's a brief synopsis:

Danger Girls: A New World

A small chapter in the tale of Lily and Colette Dangerous; a pair of post apocalyptic steampunk danger girls.

The setting is sun blasted desert. Lily and Colette Dangerous are going to a meeting in their beat up old suburban.

They have a skull and they turn it in to claim a reward from the Greasy Man. They collect the reward and then Kill the Greasy Man. Seems he has a reward out for him too.

But things are not as they seem. The Greasy Man can’t be killed. In fact he is an agent of an old, long slumbering evil. The Danger Girls don’t know it but this has been an audition. Their audition. The Greasy Man is sending them on an errand.

Refusal to go or failure to complete the Greasy Man’s errand could rend the souls of the Danger Girls and everyone they care about.

Lily and Colette have no story from before. They are a team or a couple or maybe both. They take what they can find and use what they need. They may be lovers. Maybe out of convenience, maybe out of romance. They may take a man individually, together or they may lure him in to letting his guard down with sex and then kill him and take his possessions. Either way they are committed to each other first and foremost. They are outlaws and bounty hunter as prone to generosity as they are prone to atrocity, it all depends on their need and their mood.

Danger Girls: A New World is an action adventure graphic novel. Instead of drawn art, Danger Girls: A New World will use cinematic quality photographs presented in the classic comic style.

We are shooting the first in the saga of Danger Girls: A New World near Kingman, AZ the weekend of May 17,18 and 19th. Our campaign through indigogo.com is working to raise $1000. This figure completely covers fuel, food  lodging wardrobe and other unforeseen expenses.

We have a number of perks available for donors at all levels of support. You can donate anonymously or we will gladly shout our thanks from the proverbial rooftops.

My name is Dan Gruen, my friends call me 'Dano'. I'm a creative individual from Flagstaff, Arizona. I've been a writer and a photographer for as long as I can remember. I just never found a way to truly blend the two mediums for myself.

A year ago that changed. A group of photographers I shoot with set up a challenge: create a 10 image portfolio of new work. Any subject was ok however, all the images had to be linked together. I had been watching Dr Who on netflix and one morning woke up from a dream that was all Dr Who, Frank Miller and Sucker Punch. A concept was right there in my mind: Seela. I produced Seela, shot it and entered it into the contest........it bombed. If they were giving medals, Seela would have taken Talc for sure.

 

The idea hasn't left me. Tell stories using the graphic novel format with live actors and cinematic quality photos.

 

Danger Girls: A New World is the next level and I can't do it alone.

 

I'm currently working with two amazing models a crew of believers and one Welsh cinematographer who is a long way away.


Developing a new genre of art is no small endeavor, that's why I need help. To say that this is going to be a groundbreaking leap into new expressive forms of art is....disingenuous. Danger Girls is a small step. Danger Girls is a strong, relatable short story that puts stereotypes, archetypes and paradigms all in question. It's also a potential vehicle to use for giving this medium a life of it's own.

Here's what I need from you:


I'm looking to raise $1000.00. I'm going to use your money to take care of my cast and crew and print 1st edition copies of "Danger Girls: A New World." for everyone who can contribute more than $50 bucks (more on that later).

We'll be shooting in the Arizona desert near Kingman and Lake Havasu in mid may. It's going to be HOT. If I self fund this I can pull it off. We will be camping, eating mac and cheese but we can pull it off. With your help, I can let these people sleep in air-conditioned motoel rooms (3 rooms x 2 nights), feed them right (3 meals a day x 2 models and 4 crew) and fuel the beastly suburban (550 miles x 10mpg) and believe me they will deserve it!

If we don't meet our goal of a full $1000, we are going anyway. The first priority with your funds will be motel rooms. If we need to we will bunk up so that we can get out of the heat overnight. Beyond that I'm covering expenses out of my pocket to keep them as comfortable as I can. These folks are hearty adventurers so, they will be up to the challenge.


Art Is Vital!

Fiction also allows us to explore topics that might be taboo under other circumstances. In the synopsis above you can get the idea that Lily and Colette are not you average female sci fi characters. There is an ambiguous nature to their relationshp, they are strong, fierce characters full of integrity. They challenge sterotypes of women and make no apologies, they are who they are.
 

I need you to get on board with me!

I need your input as I finish prep for this. I'm outfitting the shoot as I start this campaign. I'll be looking for your thoughts on wardrobe, props and fine points of the story line. I'm going to need some logo design work too.
 
I guess that means that this isn't just about money. If you can help with a contribution, that's great. If you can't you can still be involved. It's all going to be on my tumblr:
 
fotocomix.tumblr.com

story:
The Legend of Monkeyronin

A self published comic series.

Help support this fundraising event to print.

Story:

This is about the title character, his sidekick Kusanagi, a ghost floating head who gives snarky advise, Bato a mixed martial arts fighter looking for fame, Bing-Bing, a royal escort messenger imp who can teleport to anywhere, and Yoon Kaguali, the High Priestess of the North who is feverishly bridging the world of the 5 Kingdoms together in harmony through political means. Monkey and his friends travel across the realms to help those in need. Even if the solutions are ridiculous!

But there is a terrible shadow eclipsing the horizion. Whispers of the demon lord Noburakou has returned from the grave and raising an army to storm the lost Gates of Heaven.

Rumors also tell that the demon lord can only be defeated by a monkey.

It's just a rumor.

 

Who am I?

My name’s Scotty Clayton and for the past several years I’ve been writing & illustrating  the legend of  monkeyronin. A fantasy adventure comic book series for all ages.

I’ve been doodling for as long back as I can remember.  But for the last several years I’ve been working in professional  illustration.
One of my biggest passions was to publish my own comic series. And it’s in that passion that helped me create  The Legend of Monkeyronin”.

But there’s just one problem, Monkeyronin needs your help getting printed.

This Indiegogo  project is to help raise funds to get this series printed. We would love to sell it in stores as well as it’s digital counterparts.

I wanted to make something that was visually appealing fantasy adventure, tied with elements of comedy and drama. I wanted to make a comic that would grab the reader and take them on a escapade of imagination and creative storytelling. I wanted to make the comic books that I wanted to see.

I had to find the style of the comic from my brain and put it into book form. A style that speaks its own tune.

 

But the cost of printing a comic series is expensive. Raising the funds to print copies and have them in stores and/or at convention shows is really expensive.

But that's also why Monkeyronin is asking for help.

Your support makes this comic possible. It makes it possible to get it into the hands of readers.

You're not just help printing the books, you are helping a series launch, for years and years to come.

And hopefully with your support , this series can reach your local comic store too.
You can help by pledging your support on the column to the right.
Not only is this something I would like to see printed but also the comic loving community as well.

The best thing about this Indiegogo project is that I’m making something that speaks from the heart. The same reason we fell in love with comics in the first place. The feeling of wonder & awe.


Hopefully you readers will love it as much as I do.

Step up and support this project so everyone can have issues with a monkey.

Thanks for your support.

Prizes and perks will begin distribution 15 days after event has ended.

story:
What’s the story?

Welcome to Movie Men: Crowded Theater. If you love monster movies or the Ghostbusters or stories about kids being tossed into crazy situations that they have to find some way out of, this is your jam.

Picture this: You’re an usher at a movie theater. You take that glow wand in to make sure that the exit is closed and you spot… A BOMB! You freak out and alert everyone in the theater that they’re in grave danger and get trampled for your trouble. You come to just in time to watch it go off.

But then you notice several odd things: 1) You are still alive. 2) The theater is still standing. 3) The monster has gone missing from the screen. 4) In time, you learn that the blast has changed you as well.

What do I get?

You get the Movie Men comic book, crowdfunding edition, which will never be mass distributed. (We will bring out a non-crowdfunded edition at some point.) You can also get two pin-ups (one of them, by Ibai Canales, pictured below), a T-shirt, and a sketch of one of the Movie Men or Women. You can even be drawn into the story, or sponsor a 4-page backup story featuring you.

How do I KNOW I’ll get it?

See that fundraising bar over there? It says, “fixed goal.” What that means is that if we don’t get funded, you get your money back. Indiegogo will simply return the funds to you a week after the campaign ends. Easy peasy refund squeezy.

When we DO get funded, however, we have partnered with Wikid. Wikid is an actual publisher with an actual track record of fulfilling crowd funding campaigns, including Jack Irons.

Oh and one more thing. THE BOOK WAS 100 PERCENT FINISHED the day the campaign launched. All 20 pages and the cover are DONE. Now, we may manipulate a few faces if two backers want to join the police in the Movie Men’s world. We may even add a 4-page backup story. These things will be done by the time the campaign is finished and will not delay it in any way.

Stretch goals?

Yep, we got 'em. At 200 backers, all individual physical backers (IPBs) get a free fake movie ticket to Movie Men. At 500 backers, all IPBs get a trading card. And at 1000 backers we'll have a special surprise.

Who are you?

I am former journalist Jeremy Lott. That was a crazy life. I covered the world's chillest armed standoff; interviewed Jerry Falwell in my boxer shorts; and was once derisively referred to as “McVeigh” by former London mayor Boris Johnson, that kidder. Over a close to 20-year period, I published a few books and thousands of articles. (Go ahead, Google me.)

More to the point, my lifelong passion has been comic books. Ever since I watched the movie Condorman as a kid, I’ve been smitten. And over the last year or so I have cheered as plenty of diehard fellow fans decided to do the hard work to create their own comics and sell them on Indiegogo.

I partnered with a great artist to bring this story to you. Doug Curtis is a veteran webcomic artist, of Flying Ferret and Slammer. His style on Movie Men is a mix of realism, caricature, and a dash of the macabre. Doug has brought his own passion to the art side of this project that you can see clearly in these preview pages.

story:
Galaxafreaks will eat your brain!

Then chew it up and spit it out in a reconstructed mind-freak! Trust me, you'll feel better for it!

Back once again our favourite Trans-dimensional Space heroes are up to freaky fun and psychedelic hi-jinx!!! Come and join the fun and melt through to another dimension!

My name is Andrew Pawley, I'm a pencil squeezer based on the South Coast of England. I draw freaky comics and illustrations.  You might know me from my first three editions of Galaxafreaks.

I've been working on a comic book called Galaxafreaks about galaxy sized weirdoes getting up to all sorts of shenanigans! I work using digital media and have been publishing web-comics for a while now. I love the ol'interweb but would also love to spread my cosmic funk-juice through the medium of printed 'zines. Over the last few months I've successfully funded the publications of Galaxafreaks. All thanks to you lovely freakzoids! I'd love to do the same again. Hopefully, with your support I can!

Who are the Galaxafreaks?

Where to start? Basically the Galaxafreaks are a bunch of friends who happen to be the size of whole galaxies. However, the whole story takes place inside the brain of a cosmic universal baby who lives inside a Higgs Boson particle. Obviously!



No support is too little or too much!

There are a full range of perks to suit all types of pockets including;

  • A copy of the final printed comic
  • Original artwork
  • Original comic pages from my sketchbook
  • Screen printed T-shirts
  • Limited edition posters
  • Appearing as a Galaxafreak!! (cosmic!!)

I really hope you can help out and get freaky with these dudes!

New T-shirt Design

Fancy some new togs? Why not snap up a freaky GalaXafreaks t-shirt featuring Optik? Here's a sneak peak! Shipping in time for Xmas!

Awesome Print Quality!

Galaxafreaks will be exclusively available in print as a 32 page, full colour comic book. None of the content will appear online (apart from the teaser story above). I was amazed at the print quality of the previous issues. High quality gloss in full glorious freak-out colour. It really is an awesome item! If you could help make this a reality (what is reality anyway?) then I'd be able to continue freaking people's minds for just that little bit longer!

You never know, if it's successful I might be able to make it a series and stop washing dishes!

I've finished over half the comic already and will be posting glimpses and exclusive updates here as the project progresses.

However, to get this freak-show on the road I need to raise funds to pay for the printing & distribution of the old beast. 

Meet The GalaXafreaks

Deep inside a higgs boson particle lives a freak. It has been asleep since the dawn of existence. At utter peace within itself, it is held together with love.
Whilst it rests and snoozes vast and cosmic happenings pass within it’s sub-atomic brain. Yes! This Spaceface creature is home to a whole cosmic universe within it’s particle-noggin! Galaxies are born and die within a blink of a human eye….So let’s melt away and reform inside this cosmic arena and see what’s up! For inside the tiny dude whole epic adventures await the brave! Dreams come and go, reality is in flux and anything is possible. C’mon, come with me and join the…..GALAXAFREAKS

Fearless and Freaky! Optic is our claw handed risk taker! Always at the fore front of new experiences, he doesn’t mind jumping in to any  situation! Optik is totally far-out! He likes to let go and disintegrate into the cosmic void, spreading his presence throughout all dimensions!

Optic likes nothing more than playing a good game of Freakball, sometimes he even gives it a lick! (see issue 1)

The weird, mysterious one. No one knows where Ringzola came from. One day reality just flipped and he had been their since forever! His third eye is all knowing. With it he can span all of existence to see the deeper truth in all events.

Ringzola is the most musical of all Galaxafreaks (save of course the Rocktopus! (coming soon!)) When he’s got a free moment you’ll find him down The Particle Club chilling and mixing.

Definitely the brains of the outfit. Captain Yeah! is as old as time itself and wider than reality. Spanning all levels of reality, Captain Yeah! is beyond 4th dimensional scale.

Captain Yeah! first appeared in his own web comics featured at The Future Heart where he did battle with all sorts of weird and badass dudes including his own twin brother ‘Dark Despair!


How else can you help out?

If you're strapped for cash, don't worry none, you can still lend a hand:

  • Make as much noise as possible on social media

@drewdrewcito (Twitter & Instagram)

 http://www.facebook.com/andrewpawleyillustration

  • Give those Indiegogo share tools a good ol'clicking!!
story_txt:
Galaxafreaks will eat your brain!Then chew it up and spit it out in a reconstructed mind-freak! Trust me, you'll feel better for it!Back once again our favourite Trans-dimensional Space heroes are up to freaky fun and psychedelic hi-jinx!!! Come and join the fun and melt through to another dimension!My name is Andrew Pawley, I'm a pencil squeezer based on the South Coast of England. I draw freaky comics and illustrations.  You might know me from my first three editions of Galaxafreaks.I've been working on a comic book called Galaxafreaks about galaxy sized weirdoes getting up to all sorts of shenanigans! I work using digital media and have been publishing web-comics for a while now. I love the ol'interweb but would also love to spread my cosmic funk-juice through the medium of printed 'zines. Over the last few months I've successfully funded the publications of Galaxafreaks. All thanks to you lovely freakzoids! I'd love to do the same again. Hopefully, with your support I can!Who are the Galaxafreaks?Where to start? Basically the Galaxafreaks are a bunch of friends who happen to be the size of whole galaxies. However, the whole story takes place inside the brain of a cosmic universal baby who lives inside a Higgs Boson particle. Obviously!No support is too little or too much!There are a full range of perks to suit all types of pockets including;
A copy of the final printed comic
Original artwork
Original comic pages from my sketchbook
Screen printed T-shirts
Limited edition posters
Appearing as a Galaxafreak!! (cosmic!!)
I really hope you can help out and get freaky with these dudes!New T-shirt DesignFancy some new togs? Why not snap up a freaky GalaXafreaks t-shirt featuring Optik? Here's a sneak peak! Shipping in time for Xmas!

Awesome Print Quality!Galaxafreaks will be exclusively available in print as a 32 page, full colour comic book. None of the content will appear online (apart from the teaser story above). I was amazed at the print quality of the previous issues. High quality gloss in full glorious freak-out colour. It really is an awesome item! If you could help make this a reality (what is reality anyway?) then I'd be able to continue freaking people's minds for just that little bit longer!You never know, if it's successful I might be able to make it a series and stop washing dishes!I've finished over half the comic already and will be posting glimpses and exclusive updates here as the project progresses.However, to get this freak-show on the road I need to raise funds to pay for the printing & distribution of the old beast. Meet The GalaXafreaksDeep inside a higgs boson particle lives a freak. It has been asleep since the dawn of existence. At utter peace within itself, it is held together with love.Whilst it rests and snoozes vast and cosmic happenings pass within it’s sub-atomic brain. Yes! This Spaceface creature is home to a whole cosmic universe within it’s particle-noggin! Galaxies are born and die within a blink of a human eye….So let’s melt away and reform inside this cosmic arena and see what’s up! For inside the tiny dude whole epic adventures await the brave! Dreams come and go, reality is in flux and anything is possible. C’mon, come with me and join the…..GALAXAFREAKSFearless and Freaky! Optic is our claw handed risk taker! Always at the fore front of new experiences, he doesn’t mind jumping in to any  situation! Optik is totally far-out! He likes to let go and disintegrate into the cosmic void, spreading his presence throughout all dimensions!Optic likes nothing more than playing a good game of Freakball, sometimes he even gives it a lick! (see issue 1)The weird, mysterious one. No one knows where Ringzola came from. One day reality just flipped and he had been their since forever! His third eye is all knowing. With it he can span all of existence to see the deeper truth in all events.Ringzola is the most musical of all Galaxafreaks (save of course the Rocktopus! (coming soon!)) When he’s got a free moment you’ll find him down The Particle Club chilling and mixing.Definitely the brains of the outfit. Captain Yeah! is as old as time itself and wider than reality. Spanning all levels of reality, Captain Yeah! is beyond 4th dimensional scale.Captain Yeah! first appeared in his own web comics featured at The Future Heart where he did battle with all sorts of weird and badass dudes including his own twin brother ‘Dark Despair!How else can you help out?If you're strapped for cash, don't worry none, you can still lend a hand:Make as much noise as possible on social media@drewdrewcito (Twitter & Instagram) http://www.facebook.com/andrewpawleyillustrationGive those Indiegogo share tools a good ol'clicking!!

story:
Detective Loki #1 Main Cover

 

Detective Loki #1 Variant 

 

“Main Plot”

 

The Main Plot will focus on Detective William Loki of the Philadelphia PD.

Loki will start off the story with the murder investigation witch will lead him deep into the criminal underworld. Because of this Loki will cross paths with The Cover Society and its charter cast.
Not long after Loki will begin to unravel the plot against the city's Vigilantes by Damon Ize.
Ize himself will be the main antagonist however he will be mostly in the shadows at first.
As his plans will not come to light just yet. 

At its core this is a Noir Detective story. However, the main plot will also dive into the positives and negatives of vigilantism in a real-world setting, how it affects the people being protected by the masks and the people wearing them. The plot will explore the psychology of its main character cast and showcase the trauma these people might be going through as they put their lives on the line each day.
All of this will be complicated by the ever-increasing presence of cybernetics in our daily lives.
Side plots will include the development of The Covert Society with its current members as well
the hacker group PHOBIA. 

Do not let the Noir Detective story fool you…. We know how to have FUN!
The series will also explore the implementation of true character driven humor into the world and vibe of Noir. Allowing a world to be fantastic yet oddly real and relatable at the same time.

 

 

“Setting”

 

“Detective Loki” is set in a cyberpunk aesthetic Philadelphia of the year 2044.
Where the world is slowly starting to embrace cybernetics not only into the streets and city infrastructure but into the lives of people via cybernetic augmentation.
The City of Philadelphia became known as “Cyber City” due to the leading development and manufacturing company in cybernetics known as “Ize Tech”.
The private company that was started and still operates out of the city.

- Ize Tower standing at 1900 feet tall.

 

 

Back Story:

Vigilantes have been in the city of Philadelphia for 24 years, almost a quarter of a century and have become as symbolic with the city and culture as much as the city’s football team The Birds. 

In 2020 when the city was struggling to battle crime, drug and gang wars due to the very limited funds and resources available to the Police, the very first Vigilante known as Phoenix rose from the streets of Philadelphia to mainstream attraction as his heroics including crime fighting, drug busts, neighborhood patrolling and citizen arrests were documented and uploaded to his VidWorld channel in the hopes of scaring the rest of the criminal organizations in the city. This however led to the criminals aligning themselves with one another to stop him from taking any more money and control away from them.

What Phoenix didn't expect was that he would also inspire others to take up vigilante alter egos and fight crime alongside him in the streets. Not too long after Phoenix became an internet sensation more and more vigilantes started popping up around the city.
This is commonly referred to as the “Phoenix Phenomenon” by psychologists around the world as they believe the people of Philadelphia in such desperate times needed a Hero that was one of them, truly one of them, one that had felt their pain and suffering, someone that they could look up to in their most desperate time of need and be inspired to do the same.

Phoenix was very open to the public and media and still remains the so called “Extended Hand” of the masked world to the open one. He revealed many things including his extreme love for football, to his daily hobbies as well as informing the public that he had a PhD in Computer Science. 

Phoenix was able to fund this life type of lifestyle thanks to his smart financial investments at an early age. Unknown to the public he became a Multi-Millionaire worth over 700 million dollars. Owning a multitude of businesses around the world including his main asset which was a Computer software company.

By the end of 2023 there were two dozen Masked heroes in the city and together they formed a group known as “The Covert Society” with Phoenix voted as the Leader.
After this he decided to fully fund this operation and purchased a huge underground shipping warehouse right outside of Downtown Philadelphia that he converted into the group Headquarters and training facilitate. Here there was shelter for those would join their cause and abandoned their past lives. Phoenix went as far as paying people salaries for their work.
TCS as they were referred to would not only be recognized by the city and its officials but would also work shoulder to shoulder with the Philadelphia PD to help secure the safety and well being of its citizens. TCS would also do secret missions. These covert missions varied from small crime busts to large scale corruption take-downs all around the city’s metro area.

In 2036 Ize Tech opened its wallet to the city of Philadelphia as they provided millions of dollars in funding to the city’s police force. Thanks to this partnership Ize Tech was also able to arm the city’s finest with new and improved vehicles, equipment as well as firearms all which implemented the cyber technologies developed by the company themselves.
Year by year the city's allegiance grew thinner towards the masked hero’s that kept it safe for nearly two decades and thicker towards Doman Ize’s wallet.

In the year 2041 Phoenix tragically died from a fatal gunshot to the neck that he sustained during a pursuit of a Grand Theft Auto. His identity was concealed from the public due to the amount of respect the city and all its citizens had for him.
He was built a Memorial in Downtown Philadelphia where he was buried.
Not too long after the help of the TCS was deemed unnecessary by the city as they believed after Phoenixes death there would be no true leadership within the group.
The long lasting partnership between the city and the hero’s ended. Many masked hero’s hung up their alter egos in the closet to never be seen again. But not all left the fight, a few still remained. But the number of masked people in the city has fallen every year, and now less than ten Vigilantes remain in Philadelphia.

 

 

Here are the first 3 pages of issue #1:

 

Page #1

Page #2

Page #3

“Character Cast”

 



William Loki (age 41, 6’4, 215 lbs.) main protagonist.

The City's notorious and prolific detective who is famous for cracking unsolvable cases.
William has been a detective for 16 years and has built a reputation not only in the force but also in the criminal underworld as a man not to be pondered with. Loki has been known to get to the bottom of a case by any means necessary. He also is one of the last few remaining supporters of the vigilantes within the police force. Loki is still rumored to have been working with “masks” even after the police force deemed it “unnecessary”.

 

 

Damon Ize (age 46, 6’0, 185 lbs.) main antagonist.

Born and raised in Philadelphia, his early years were spent moving from one house to another as his family was of lower class and was always fighting to have food on the table and a roof over their heads. This did not stop him from graduating high school at the age of 11 and at the age of 16 he graduated MIT with a Doctorate in computer science.
Damon also recorded the highest IQ ever recorded with a score of 240. By age 20 Damon was one of the 100 richest people on earth thanks to his tech company known as "Ize Tech" that focused on computer engineering and software innovations. Due to all this extra income Damon started exploring the world of cybernetic enhancements not just to ease our daily lives but to make them better in every way. Thanks to this vision he grew his company to be worth over 15 trillion dollars and earned himself the titled "World's Richest Man".

 

 

Matthew Blinker (age 44, (6’0, 210 lbs.) AKA Griffin. Supporting character.

Personally trained and groomed by Phoenix.
A former Olympic competitor in gymnastics, Matt complements his strength and endurance whit his flexibility. He trained well and become a fierce opponent in any fight… even when he is outnumbered six to one. Complimented by his straighten is his critical thinking skills under extreme high pressure situations.  Due to his loyalty to the cause and the mission of The Covert Society, Phoenix named him second in command in late 2038.
After the tragic and unexpected death of the groups leader in 2041, Griffin was voted in as the leader of the Society and has since then made some notable changes.

 

 

Xander Collins (Age 40, 6’0, 200 lbs.) AKA “Mirror Face”. Supporting character.

Known as the ‘outsider’ of the group.

In college Xander studied psychology and even graduated with a master’s however in the year he graduated (2026) the great African War had started, and he deiced to join the US Navy. After a few years of service, he was able to move up into the Navy Seals Unit.
He spent over 7 years fighting the war until its conclusion in 2034.
He came back a home a different man… he went to work as a PTSD psychologist but as a few years went on he couldn’t just sit buy and talk to people about their problems. Xander knew he wanted to help people by protecting them before they ever experienced any type of mental trauma. He knew about The Covert Society and wanted to join their fight against injustice and crime, but had no clue how to get in contact with the group. 
He decided to get eye augmentation surgery in order to allow himself to read peoples pulses and see their body temperatures. He developed a mask from scratch that would enhance and protect his newly augmented eyes. On the outside its shaped like a curved mirror.
Xander did this on purpose as he believed people are most afraid of what they see looking back at them. He started doing vigilante work not there long after.
Every night for almost 6 months. Having his own way of doing things, he would implement intimidation tactics he learned in the Navy Seals and use his newly augments eyes as well as his knowledge of psychology to be able to tell if someone is speaking the truth or if someone was lying... and have mercy on anyone who lied.
He quickly become known as “Mirror Face” around the city. One night he was confronted by Phoenix and General Freedom while he was out looking for a suspect. They both expressed their interest in him but disapproved of some of his methods but both men believed with the right training he could become an unbelievable asset to the team and city.
Not there long after Mirror Face joined The Covert Society in 2039.
 

 

 

Gabe Crawler (age 43, 6’0, 205 lbs.) AKA “General Freedom”.  Supporting character.

Supporting character.

Gabe is an old school by the book’s kind of guy. A true patriotic American through and through.
He was a simple construction worker until one fateful night in 2031 when his brother was accused of a violent crime he did not commit. 
Because of this his brother was imprisoned, but Gabe did not give up.
Knowing his brother was innocent he started his own private investigation. Little by little, without noticing it he become very good at spying and gathering information, combine that with his incredible physic due to heavy work load on the construction site and his background in boxing as an amateur all through college, he was becoming a vigilante without even know it.
After months of hard work, he was able to prove his bothers innocents and all charges were dropped and the rightful criminal was brought to justice.
Phoenix had caught this on the news and found him not there long after.
He recruited him to be part of The Covert Society!
Gabe took the name “General Freedom” because he wanted to do for everyone what he did for his brother and be a symbol of freedom for all.
 


Vlad Varakossov (age 36, 6’5, 265 lbs) AKA "Bruiser Rhino". Supporting character.

Born and raised in Mother Russia, Vlad was brought up to be a hard-working family man. However he wanted to do something more with his life. He always dreamed about being an actor in Hollywood, even going as far as doing theater all throughout his school years. When his father died Vlad had to become the man of the house at the age of 19.
In order to provide for his family Vlad knew he had to make money and fast. The only way to do that where he was from was to fight in the underground fight club knows “Blood Merry” where men would beat the piss out each other in a cage. He knew he was not ready and dedicated all his free time to wight lifting and training in the martial art of Sambo. All while working 12 hours days at a factory.
A little over 3 years later Vlad made his debut in the cage and made a huge impression.
He dominated one fight after another, not because he was the best, but because of sheer will running through his veins. He knew that every fight he would win get him closer to getting his family out of the dumb they were in. After being undefeated for 8 years straight in the cage, he was able to save enough money to move his family to America where he knew they had a better chance at life then anywhere else. Little did he know he himself would be more lost then ever. After so many years of fighting he knew little else in this world.
He found work as a bouncer for huge night club in Philadelphia.
One night while working he beat up seven guys known  as“the death bunch” due to them causing a problem at the club. The gang was feared even by the club owner but not by Vlad.
After being humiliated they promised him he would regret it. A few weeks later he came home to find his little sister murdered and mutilated.
Vlad snapped and went on a spree of beatings unseen by anyone in the city.
Trying to find the gang and get his revenge. Doing so attracted a lot of attention. Thankfully for him he was approached by Griffin who promised to help him and bring the people that killed his sister to justice. Together they did just that, but a there was more to that story then either of them have lead others to believe.
Griffin slowly recruited Vlad to join The Covert Society and by mid-2042 he did just that.
Vlad was trained personally by Griffin who become his friend and mentor.
He took the name Bruiser Rhino because he knew that by one look at him and his name people would know who they were dealing with.

 

Gina Estrada (age 25, 5’10, 148 lbs.) AKA “WHITE FOX”. Supporting character.

Currently youngest member of The Cover Society.

What Gina lacks in age experience she makes in her god given athleticism.
In her ‘past life’ as she refers it to, she was an Olympic golden medalist in figure skating at the age of 18. Not to mention countless world titles. She finished figure skating at 21 because she wanted to finish her master’s in Business Analytics. Her second passion was the martial art known as Capoeira. She devoted all her free time to practicing it, even going as far as winning some major national and international titles.
a year after graduating Gina had discovered her family’s secret. Their near billion-dollar company was built on the back of her father’s criminal organization. She found out about all the crimes and horrors that were committed by her family and decided then and there that she never wanted to be a part of it. Dropped everything she moved to Philadelphia in order to find The Covert Society and devote herself to vigilante work so that she could create a new legacy for her family. It took her a few months to find them but in mid-2043 she joined the team after being recruited by Shadow Blade when he saw her saving a girl from getting raped by 4 men one night. 

 

 

Masaru Higashi ( age 27, 5’9, 170 lbs.) AKA “Shadow Blade”. Supporting character.

Masaru was born and raised in Osaka Japan. He comes from an ancient clan of Shinobis that have kept their family tradition of training all its generations in the art of Ninja. 
Even at an early age Masaru was far better at everything then rest of the children training with him.  He excelled in solving difficult problems and was undoubtedly the best fighter his clan has seen in ages. Near the completion of his training Masaru failed at one task that would set his life spinning into a spiral he could not predict. He was told to assassinate a man that was a danger to the clan. As Masaru arrived at the man’s house in the middle of the night, he saw him hold 2 infinite children in his hands and sing to them… that’s more then his father ever did for him...
He did not execute the mission and was exiled because of this.  To get a fresh start he moved to the US and started look for work, mostly privet investigator as his training allowed him to follow people and never be seen or heard. He made a decent living do.
In 2042 he crossed paths with The Covert Society while working a case, turned both him and the group were looking for the same person. Only Maseru had gathered much more accurate and highly detailed info in less time than the Society did. 
While seeing him in action Griffin was impressed and taking back by his ability to move in a fight, he saw huge potential in him and asked Masaru to join the team. Seeing this as an opportunity to use his skills for good he accepted the offer and has been known as the “eyes and ears” of the group in their most desperate time.
 

 

STRETCH GOALS!

Detective Loki is not made to be just 1 issue, we have plans to be a full 12 issue story!
If we get more funding the following stretch goal will make a few things a reality:

At $6,500 Issue #2 gets fully funded!
At $9,000 Issue #3 gets fully funded!
At $11,000 Issue #4 gets fully funded! This will also allow us to make an over 100 page Graphic Novel and in doing so publish the entire first Volume in one go.

Gabe is an old school by the book’s kind of guy. A true patriotic American through and through.He was a simple construction worker until one fateful night in 2031 when his brother was accused of a violent crime he did not commit. Because of this his brother was imprisoned, but Gabe did not give up.Knowing his brother was innocent he started his own private investigation. Little by little, without noticing it he become very good at spying and gathering information, combine that with his incredible physic due to heavy work load on the construction site and his background in boxing as an amateur all through college, he was becoming a vigilante without even know it.After months of hard work, he was able to prove his bothers innocents and all charges were dropped and the rightful criminal was brought to justice.Phoenix had caught this on the news and found him not there long after.He recruited him to be part of The Covert Society!Gabe took the name “General Freedom” because he wanted to do for everyone what he did for his brother and be a symbol of freedom for all. 

Vlad Varakossov (age 36, 6’5, 265 lbs) AKA "Bruiser Rhino". Supporting character.Born and raised in Mother Russia, Vlad was brought up to be a hard-working family man. However he wanted to do something more with his life. He always dreamed about being an actor in Hollywood, even going as far as doing theater all throughout his school years. When his father died Vlad had to become the man of the house at the age of 19.In order to provide for his family Vlad knew he had to make money and fast. The only way to do that where he was from was to fight in the underground fight club knows “Blood Merry” where men would beat the piss out each other in a cage. He knew he was not ready and dedicated all his free time to wight lifting and training in the martial art of Sambo. All while working 12 hours days at a factory.A little over 3 years later Vlad made his debut in the cage and made a huge impression.He dominated one fight after another, not because he was the best, but because of sheer will running through his veins. He knew that every fight he would win get him closer to getting his family out of the dumb they were in. After being undefeated for 8 years straight in the cage, he was able to save enough money to move his family to America where he knew they had a better chance at life then anywhere else. Little did he know he himself would be more lost then ever. After so many years of fighting he knew little else in this world.He found work as a bouncer for huge night club in Philadelphia.One night while working he beat up seven guys known  as“the death bunch” due to them causing a problem at the club. The gang was feared even by the club owner but not by Vlad.After being humiliated they promised him he would regret it. A few weeks later he came home to find his little sister murdered and mutilated.Vlad snapped and went on a spree of beatings unseen by anyone in the city.Trying to find the gang and get his revenge. Doing so attracted a lot of attention. Thankfully for him he was approached by Griffin who promised to help him and bring the people that killed his sister to justice. Together they did just that, but a there was more to that story then either of them have lead others to believe.Griffin slowly recruited Vlad to join The Covert Society and by mid-2042 he did just that.Vlad was trained personally by Griffin who become his friend and mentor.He took the name Bruiser Rhino because he knew that by one look at him and his name people would know who they were dealing with.
 

Gina Estrada (age 25, 5’10, 148 lbs.) AKA “WHITE FOX”. Supporting character.
Currently youngest member of The Cover Society.
What Gina lacks in age experience she makes in her god given athleticism.In her ‘past life’ as she refers it to, she was an Olympic golden medalist in figure skating at the age of 18. Not to mention countless world titles. She finished figure skating at 21 because she wanted to finish her master’s in Business Analytics. Her second passion was the martial art known as Capoeira. She devoted all her free time to practicing it, even going as far as winning some major national and international titles.a year after graduating Gina had discovered her family’s secret. Their near billion-dollar company was built on the back of her father’s criminal organization. She found out about all the crimes and horrors that were committed by her family and decided then and there that she never wanted to be a part of it. Dropped everything she moved to Philadelphia in order to find The Covert Society and devote herself to vigilante work so that she could create a new legacy for her family. It took her a few months to find them but in mid-2043 she joined the team after being recruited by Shadow Blade when he saw her saving a girl from getting raped by 4 men one night. 
 

 
Masaru Higashi ( age 27, 5’9, 170 lbs.) AKA “Shadow Blade”. Supporting character.
Masaru was born and raised in Osaka Japan. He comes from an ancient clan of Shinobis that have kept their family tradition of training all its generations in the art of Ninja. Even at an early age Masaru was far better at everything then rest of the children training with him.  He excelled in solving difficult problems and was undoubtedly the best fighter his clan has seen in ages. Near the completion of his training Masaru failed at one task that would set his life spinning into a spiral he could not predict. He was told to assassinate a man that was a danger to the clan. As Masaru arrived at the man’s house in the middle of the night, he saw him hold 2 infinite children in his hands and sing to them… that’s more then his father ever did for him...He did not execute the mission and was exiled because of this.  To get a fresh start he moved to the US and started look for work, mostly privet investigator as his training allowed him to follow people and never be seen or heard. He made a decent living do.In 2042 he crossed paths with The Covert Society while working a case, turned both him and the group were looking for the same person. Only Maseru had gathered much more accurate and highly detailed info in less time than the Society did. While seeing him in action Griffin was impressed and taking back by his ability to move in a fight, he saw huge potential in him and asked Masaru to join the team. Seeing this as an opportunity to use his skills for good he accepted the offer and has been known as the “eyes and ears” of the group in their most desperate time. 
 
STRETCH GOALS!Detective Loki is not made to be just 1 issue, we have plans to be a full 12 issue story!If we get more funding the following stretch goal will make a few things a reality:At $6,500 Issue #2 gets fully funded!At $9,000 Issue #3 gets fully funded!At $11,000 Issue #4 gets fully funded! This will also allow us to make an over 100 page Graphic Novel and in doing so publish the entire first Volume in one go.

story:
G’day and welcome to the Caravan of Comics, a metaphorical Winnebago of six Australian comics creators heading – we hope – to Canada and the USA this May. We want to bring North America some of the best comics produced Down Under. We want to spend over 48 hours in planes and airports, and we need your help!

Happily we’ve already secured a grant from the Australia Council to support this trip, but it comes nowhere close to covering the total cost of flights, accommodation, shipping our books over and so on. No one makes much money from comics in Australia, so we are appealing to you – readers, comics lovers, patrons of the arts, fans and friends who might like to meet us: help us get to North America. (And get some great rewards as thanks for your generosity.)

WHO ARE WE?

On board the Caravan of Comics 2013 are six cartoonists, and one filmmaker:

  • Scarlette Baccini (Zombolette, Jesus Reloadeth’d)
  • Mirranda Burton (Hidden)
  • Marijka Gooding (Strange Behaviour)
  • Gregory Mackay (Francis Bear, Turkey Comix (France))
  • Daniel Hayward (Graphic Novels! Melbourne!, This Is Roller Derby)
  • Bruce Mutard (The Sacrifice, The Silence, A Mind of Love)

Think of us as the Magnificent Seven, except with pens and paper instead of guns.

You can learn more about us at the Caravan of Comics 2013 website.

PLEASE NOTE: Unfortunately, Patrick Alexander has had to withdraw from the 2013 Caravan. However, this does not change the donor perks; Patrick is still offering art prints and original art to donors, and will still contribute to the Caravan 2013 Comic Book. Please see his update (by clicking the 'Updates' tab above) for more information.

WHAT’S IT FOR?

Naturally the six of us have various reasons for joining the Caravan, but broadly speaking, this will be a great opportunity to promote Australian comics overseas and network with cartooning peers and comics publishers – as well as a chance to meet readers and fans from the other side of the planet. We’re looking forward to meeting some of the world’s finest cartoonists, and sharing our own unique creations with the international comics community.

We are also bringing a feature length documentary – Graphic Novels! Melbourne! – which investigates the strange water we have in Melbourne, such that it should produce so many cracking good cartoonists. The film focuses on four in specific: Pat Grant, Mandy Ord, Nicki Greenberg, and member of this tour, Bruce Mutard. Visit our website and Facebook for screening venues and times.

WHERE ARE WE GOING?

First, there'll be a screening of Graphic Novels! Melbourne!, with a special presentation by Dan and Bruce, on May 8 at the Carlton Cinema, Toronto.

Then we attend the Toronto Comics Arts Festival (TCAF), May 11-12, where we are featured guests. We will be selling and signing our books and doing a range of panels and presentations. Check the expo site for details.

An in-store presentation and book signing at Librairie Drawn & Quarterly in Montreal on May 15. We will also be screening an extended trailer of Graphic Novels! Melbourne! in lieu of an actual screening (which we hope we can still do).

An in-store presentation, book signing and screening of Graphic Novels! Melbourne! at Fantagraphics Bookshop in Seattle on May 18.

Bruce will then go to the International Comic Arts Forum in Portland, OR, on May 23-25, to present his paper: Out Of The Gutter And Into The Panel: Comics closure as qualia of art imitating life. The conference is open to the public and free to register. Head to their site.

There may be smaller drawing jams, in-stores and other things we can fit in on the road as they come to hand. Like most Australian mammals, we are friendly, furry types.

AND ABOUT THE MONEY…

In gratitude for your donations we are offering some special gifts, from DVDs to limited edition prints and original art works. Check out the rewards list to the right for more details.

But what’s the money for? We’ve set an initial campaign goal of $10,000 – here’s our estimate of how that will break down:

$8000 – International transport and accommodation for the Caravaneers: flights, trains, hotels/hostels.

$1400 – Printing, manufacturing and postage costs for your donor rewards!

$600 – Indiegogo’s cut: 4% plus 3% of any credit card payments.

Stretch goals:

If we exceed our initial goal, all the better! We have an Ultimate Super-Goal of $20,000, which will cover additional costs such as domestic travel, meals, and nasty surprises. If we reach this goal, we’ll come up with some additional rewards for our wonderful backers. Stay tuned to our Facebook and website for updates.

THANK YOU SO MUCH

...and see you soon!

If we reach this goal, we’ll come up with some additional rewards for our wonderful backers. Stay tuned to our Facebook and website for updates.

story:
Rockabilly Roadtrip #1 is a 22-page full color comic that introduces a brand-new type of heroic duo. Also, available the 155-page perfect bound trade paper back. Which chronicles the first 6 issues of the original Rockabilly Roadtrip series from 2006 to 2014. Presented in its original B/W indie format.

What's This All About?

Rockabilly Roadtrip is a cross-country love story of a man, his car and his homemade bride. On the roadtrip, we follow our hero, Nicky "The Pipe" who has just completed work on his long time project "The Devil Driver", his dream automobile.

Nicky is an average guy with one special talent, he can build ANYTHING! He often refers to his special talent as his superpower and rightfully so. After completing work on his amazing, custom car he used his talents to build himself a driving companion to compliment the look of his newest creation.

When his bombshell of a passenger dummy whom he lovingly refers to as Patches, mysteriously comes to life he decides there would be no better way to educate her on the ways of the world than with a road trip across the U.S. of A. Doing so would also let him break in his new ride and possibly win Patches' heart.

However, this "Rockabilly RoadTrip" is anything but typical! Chainsaw wielding psychos in Texas and a Voodoo, Swamp-Zombie infestation at a roadside stop in Louisiana are just the start of the problems our heroes run into on the road. So come along for the trip! And don't miss a single issue of the cross-country, love-story adventure that is Rockabilly RoadTrip!

This new exciting tail is created by artist Preston Asevedo & writer Jesse Wroblewski. Rockabilly Roadtrip is the perfect series for fans of shows such as stranger things, supernatural and all thoughs that follow the Kustom Kulture movement.

 

Cover Art!

This is the cover art offered in the "This will cover it tier"!

 

The Itunes Special!

The art from the Roadtrip Itunes Release!

 

Here's a few pages from the trade!

What makes this trade unique? The 6th issue of the original run can only be found in the pages of the trade. Issue #6 was never made into a floppy!

 

 

 

 

YEP! We're that kind of CRAZY!

Here's the actual car from the comic series made for the trailer.
