story:
Short Summary

Growing up, I was raised on the works of Jack Kirby, who created Captain America as a reaction to the Holocaust. World War 2 has cast a long shadow over the comic book industry as the war affected the families of people like Joe Kubert, Art Spiegelman, and Lily Renee. Creators like them form my comics DNA. It is comics creators like this which have inspired me to create works of visual activism such as my comic Right About Now that was centered around the Wisconsin Uprising and contribute to APB: Artists against Police Brutality. Now, I am focusing my attention on the human rights abuses happening at the Mexican border and I'm planning a trip to El Paso to meet with activists and immigrants on the frontlines and hear their stories and share them through the medium of comics. With your support, I can bring these voices to a wider audience which is yearning for such stories.

Show Don't Tell

Any creative in a visual arts field will tell you, "Show don't tell." I've been working hard, finding this project a home while creating as much art as possible, you should have a taste of what you are in for. So here is what some of the book will look like:

What will I do in El Paso

While I'm in El Paso I hope to meet with a variety of activists, migrants, and institutions. Plans include seeing where there are people held in a tent in an underpass, the ICE tent city concentration camp, visiting the Holocaust and Border Patrol museums, and meeting people and learning how the city has changed in the past 20 years. I hope I can get a chance to see what it's like in the unforgiving desert where people are crossing.

I was born in El Paso. I only briefly returned twice in my life, once at the airport for a layover in the mid-80s and once for a day while on a cross country car ride in the early-90s. I remember stories my parents told me growing up and I want to contrast these stories with people's lived experience being in El Paso.

What We Need & What You Get

I was surprised at the number I came to when I sat down and did the math. I think it will cost me about $5,000 to do this. The biggest expense is what I need to go out to the desert. If I am to understand what is happening, I need to see the desert for myself. See the trails migrants go on. But I just can't show up like it's a day on the beach. The desert gets up as high as 114 degrees. To survive out there, even if it's a short trip, you need the right clothes. Doing the math, it looks like I need about $500, this includes proper hiking boots, a cooler hat (My current one is black. Looks awesome, but isn't going to help me stay cool in the heat.) and a water backpack.

Here is the break down:
$2,000 for transportation, this is for the train ride down, a bus pass in El Paso, bike rental to get around downtown (El Paso has a public bike rental. I hope to get a room near the Holocaust Museum of El Paso it would be an easy bike ride from the hotel I'm looking at.), and, if needed, taxi fare. 

$1000 for a room. It floors me how much these things add up.

$500 for meals. Part of it I will be on a train, so I imagine some of the meals will be pricey. 

$500 for clothes for the desert. Also, the backpack water will come in handy for the bike rental.

$1000 for making the physical rewards for you! This also includes the all-important shipping supplies and postage.

I can't imagine not making this goal. However, the stretch goals, which I do have, could be a challenge.  I do have some exciting plans for this trip, which I'll announce when it's appropriate.

The Impact

The end goal of this project is to give the reader an understanding of and the tools to fix the broken immigration system.

The concept around this came in evaluating the success and failures of Right About Now. This was a webcomic I wrote around the protests of Wisconsin. I tried to have a set of characters tell a broad story but it was too broad and I should have focused on how uniquely horrible Scott Walker's policies were. I knew that he was the harbinger of something worse. Instead of having a set of POV characters, I should have had them introduce other's stories. Overall, though, the experience of doing over 500 pages in two and a half years was a good one which taught me a lot.

This gave me the opportunity to be a part of APB Artists against Police Brutality. I was one of nearly 75 contributors and I worked with Aaron Rand Freeman (Formerly of The Week in Blackness and now Unreasonable Fridays podcasts.) on a six-page story for the book. I was super proud of the work I produced but the book was vague in bigger actions beyond what you as an individual can do. It's still an impressive book and I am proud that I worked on something that won the Pioneer Award at the 2016 Glyph Awards.

I hope that this project will surpass both of them in what I can learn as an artist and in finding an audience of both activists and comic book readers. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk of any of these things is not getting funded. I am worried that Trump supporters and those who support the wall will attack this page. But I think that over the years of working on projects like this, I feel I have built up a good community to combat any such attacks.

Other Ways You Can Help

Those who have donated and those who financially can't help me, thank you for reading this far, but there is more you can do. The first thing that everyone should do is to reach out to your member of Congress about S. 662: Fair Day in Court for Kids Act of 2019,

If you have a podcast, news show, local paper or whatever, please invite me on to discuss this project and why the issues around the border. "An artist," as Dwayne Boothe, or Mr. Fish as he signs his work, says, "has less reason to lie for the power structure." I feel my work for the past 8-years has shown a light on the power structure and this is a great way to promote the project. Plus I'd like to think I'm a good guest.

Of course, share this on all your social media channels. Any signal boosting can help and Indiegogo has made it easier for with the share tools. Plus, you can follow me on Twitter.

I hope to get a special website for some previews with a special contributor's only blog where you can see art as well as the progress of the trip and art I make while I'm out there. So stay tuned for that.

And most importantly, thank you.

"An artist," as Dwayne Boothe, or Mr. Fish as he signs his work, says, "has less reason to lie for the power structure." I feel my work for the past 8-years has shown a light on the power structure and this is a great way to promote the project. Plus I'd like to think I'm a good guest.
Of course, share this on all your social media channels. Any signal boosting can help and Indiegogo has made it easier for with the share tools. Plus, you can follow me on Twitter.
I hope to get a special website for some previews with a special contributor's only blog where you can see art as well as the progress of the trip and art I make while I'm out there. So stay tuned for that.
And most importantly, thank you.

story: I love to make people laugh and feel good and do it through music and humor. I teach yoga and do yoga therapy all about healing. Life is short and I know it first hand after growing up in foster homes in Houston, Texas and surviving the remnants of racism after civil rights movement I decided to study Social Work and in yoga I teach and emphasize how important it is to LOVE everyone! If you really believe in love that is for all you will feel my vibes. I am a survivor of heart attack and partial paralyzation on left side of body but through lots of mantra and good friends and lots of laughter with creative flow I rehabilitated myself and I know volunteer my time with the Veterans Hospital and give the same stream of love and happiness to the Soldiers of the United States Army. Funny thing is that the first day of class they were introducing me to the soldiers/patients and when they said: my name and that I am the Yoga Teacher  and I stood up a Vietnam vet sitting next to me says: " You gotta be sh#ttin me, I thought you was one of us" and I said:" in a way sir I am. I laughed and the other soldiers laughed so my nickname is the Pissed Off Hindu. LMAO but yeah I love what I do and I do it for happiness for us all. Will you please help me on my way to keep my message of love and happiness and practical spirituality which incorporates everyone by tipping me with what you feel will help me to accomplish my goals. I myself am looking for real work as I complete my bachelors in Social Work at 43yrs old wooohooooo I am doin it. ok

story:
Our Story

Imagine a world where everyone is treated equally and the punishment fits the crime. No more, no less.

Regardless of age, race, or gender, social responsibility is the enforced norm rather than an ideal for a privileged few.

Aequitas follows one woman's hellish journey through the justice system. Join her on her trek.

Starring Emily Schooley (The Dark Knight Rises, One Week in Windchocombe) this is an epic evolution you won't soon forget.


The Impact

Aequitas is a moving, in-your-face social commentary about the current state of our justice system. How many crimes go unreported because of fear of police inaction?


How many false reports are acted on, causing physical and emotional damage to innocent people?


How many people have been beaten - or worse - by police, often unnecessarily?


Aequitas is a call to action. A call for society to open its eyes and push for change.


What We Need & What You Get

We need a total of $10 000 to see this through from start to finish. We have some gear, we have our script, and we have generous donations of space to build our set on and craft services from a great local establishment.

We're chomping at the bit to get started, but this is what we still need help with:


$4000 - covers the cost of remaining sound, lighting, and camera equipment we'll need

$1750 - building of the unique set we need

$1250 - to give to our performers, many of whom are using special skills including weeks of gruelling combat choreography training. We wish we could give them more, but it's a start until the film starts making money.

$1500 - rental of special vehicles needed for this production

$500 - wardrobe rental and special makeup effects

$1000 - post-production costs


Any donation helps us out, seriously. We want to prompt change, and we'd love for you to be along for the ride.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our link with others and help spread the word! 

Our Facebook Fan Page link: http://www.facebook.com/AequitasTheFilm

story:
Welcome!

My name is Ryan, and I would like to share with you a short comic book project I've been working on over the last year. It's based on the Inuit legend Sedna, or alternatively named Sanna: Goddess of the Sea. The story is a coming-of-age tale about a young Inuit woman who refuses to marry a mysterious suitor and her journey of personal and physical transformation.

This project is important to me because it is my first serious attempt at crafting a story through the medium of comics. I think it is especially important to Canada and the world that this aboriginal story be shared. My art directors have helped me through the hardest part of the process; visual development, layout, pacing, and penciling. Now I hope that you will back me for adding the inks, colors, and text. If you can help meet our financial goal you will help in bringing this project full-circle. Please check out the comic in the gallery.

What We Need & The Impact

The money raised will allow me to focus on the project full-time. I feel a project like this deserves a focused momentum that will allow for my attention to detail. Every backer who contributes $5 and above will recieve a PDF digital copy of the 6 page full-color comic. Plus, for those that dig a bit deeper there is another side project that will add to the campaign to showcase the characters outside of their panels; a digital painting of each of the main characters as wallpapers, greeting cards, and prints would really illustrate how mythic they are! These 6 double-page spreads will also be featured in the comic. Overall I think the impact of the project will be positive and will encourage learning about the Inuit culture, reading, drawing, and making comics.

Stretch Goals:

I don't want to get too far ahead of myself, but I have to be open to the possibility of raising more than I am asking for. A couple of ideas floating around my head are enhancing the printed goods with holographic foil stamping to highlight the supernatural aspects of these characters. I am also interested in animating this comic book so that the panels move and provide an interactive experience.

  • $2000 - Holographic Foil Stamping on Printed Goods

  • $3000 - Interactive Motion Comic

Other Ways You Can Help

Help getting the word out is as easy as hitting the share buttons and liking our Facebook Page. Don't forget to invite all of your friends too! I'm sure they would love to hear about it. Thank you for visiting our campaign and we appreciate your support.

story:
RB White - Poison Heart Art Book


Poison Heart is the title of my 3rd collection of illustrations done for various publishing houses , magazines ,comic book covers ,private collections and for my personal fun .There isn't a lot to say about this book . Those who are familiar with my work are going for a cool ride flipping trough the pages full of digital paintings , pencil renderings  and  step-by-step illustrations . For my new fans this campaign will be a perfect way to get all my three books with some special perks that are only available here .

                            Why do I need help to raise money ?

Artists are doing what they love  to do but in order to share that excitement and joy with fans we need to overcome some obstacles -financial . Art is labor of love but printing , binding , shipping , packaging is not .All money raised  after fees and taxes will go towards covering all those costs .No matter how much money will be raised all of the funders will receive their packages !

I appreciate any help that I can get and remember that sharing this campaign on all social networks is just as valuable to me as a donation .

 


                        How the book is going to look like ?

                     

Since I already  made 2 books this time I decided to go with more pages and less cost so the books are going to be more affordable to my fans .It will be soft cover , 8.5x11 inches big ,60 pages , full color book  . Estimated shipping is Sep/Oct 2015 .I received a few advanced copies and they look pretty darn good !!!

            

And this is what you get in return for your support!

story:
Metaphors-Passarola: A Comic Book EP

Thanks for checking out the campaign for my comic book EP, forged in the fires of Austin, Texas with Anissa Bryant and Ruthie Junto! I make music, and Anissa and Ruthie make art! Together, we're making Metaphors-Passarola: A Comic Book EP!

What's a Comic Book EP?

We're releasing a digital EP with two songs, and each song corresponds to a story in a print comic book. Digital music + Physical art = Comic Book EP!

The A-Side is Metaphors, an industrial hip hop anthem in which I explore the outer reaches of my braggadocio by asserting that I am bigger than even my own metaphors. I wrote the song when I worked on an oil rig, and Ruthie Junto's comic shares vignettes of my time working offshore. 

The B-Side is Passarola, an electro-ambient song that uses images of flight to convey the challenges of committing to change. In the Passarola comic, Anissa Bryant illustrates stories from my childhood in which I visit my family by plane.

Why Do You Want My Money?

Two reasons! 

  • First, printing costs: The comic is going to be professionally printed by PrintNinja, and I want to ensure that everyone gets a quality product. 
  • Second, artist pay: Ruthie and Anissa are incredible artists who have done so much for this project, and they deserve to be compensated for their amazing work.

What Are the Perks?

Yes, there are perks! 

  • If you donate anything, you'll get a digital download of the music and the art. 
  • If you donate five dollars, you'll get a digital download of the music and the art, AND you get a professionally printed copy of Metaphors-Passarola ANNNND you get my finite love and gratitude in print in the comic! Wow, what a steal! 

What Are the Risks?

Risks are for the weak. 

But seriously: the music has already been produced and the art has been commissioned. If we fail to meet our funding goal, I will personally ensure that the artists get paid and that the comics get printed. But I will be sad that nobody loves me for me.

What if I Can't Contribute?

If you can't contribute, but are still interested in supporting our multi-genre ambitions, please consider sharing the campaign with others! 

Anything Else?

Nope! Thanks for your time, and thanks for your support!

story:
The Nitty-Gritty

Most comic books in South Africa and Australia are passion projects - work done after hours. The artists give everything they can to their work, pay for the production out of their own pockets and often drive or fly for hours to various conventions to attempt to sell their products to a niche audience because retailers don't see the value in taking the risk of selling locally-produced (and thus unknown) books.

           A VERY Small Selection of South African & Australian Comics 


The unfortunate thing though, is that although both countries produce hundreds of original-content comics a year, it’s such a niche market that most people do not even know that these comics exist.

So how would one find a way to add value and support to the artists and creators? Short of paying them for the blood, sweat, tears and other bodily fluids they pour into their work?

Why not take the comics of the southern hemisphere to the greatest comic event in the world, the San Diego Comic Convention? The international exposure alone is worth it, but the networking even more so.

That was the thinking in 2012 when Ray Whitcher, Moray Rhoda and Neville Howard sent an application to SDCC to do a panel on Southern Hemisphere comics. Pretty insane, right?

One quiet morning months later, an email arrived. THE email arrived. We'd done it, we'd been accepted! We were going to SDCC!

If only we could raise the cash...

It was a mad scramble, but with the massive kindness of people from two countries and two different continents, we made it. We presented to a fantastic audience, got rousing applause and most importantly, got southern hemisphere comics into the hands of the American market.

                           Ah, the Heady Days of SDCC 2013


We came back home, filled with pride and excitement that we had contributed to the rise of South African and Australian comics…

But we soon realized that achieving the appropriate level of visibility for our small, yet vibrant industry won’t be achieved in a sprint. This is a marathon and it will take repeated rides on the merry-go-round and consistent work over time to build the international contacts that will enable our artists to achieve the next level. We say “industry” but what we mean is a comic scene - it will take a lot more work before it’s a comic industry. But right now, the momentum is there and NOW is the time to take the next step.

With that in mind, we made it our mission to make lightning strike twice, and return to SDCC! (Guess we made a really good impression the first time around).

We now have the opportunity to go back to SDCC to spread the word about South African & Australian comics. With a prime panel slot on Saturday the 26th of July 2014 and a bigger room, now there's an even BETTER avenue for exposure.

This is where we now reach out to you. We believe in the abilities of the artists and creators from our countries, and if we could, we would take them all along. There’s only so much space in our suitcases though and US Customs is notoriously tough, so best we do this the proper way… which means finding more funds to bring artists from both South Africa and Australia along to gain the experience of networking with industry professionals at the biggest comic showcase in the world. Artists such as these guys:


                                      Daniël Hugo and Chris Beukes

Daniël Hugo is a Cape Town based artist and is a mainstay of the South African comic scene. He is the author of The Oneironaut & Other Tales  and The Souvenir. He has contributed to every Velocity to date.

Chris Beukes is a freelance illustrator and erstwhile art director at South Africa's biggest commercial comic company. He is the author of Wrath.

Last year we presented South African & Australian comics in a broader context, this year we are focusing on specific comics and how local creators are bringing in our local mythology, legends and culture into fantasy tales. As Neil Blomkamp did with District9 and Elysium except with a non-existent budget :) 

These are SOME of the fantastic books we’ll be talking about:


The Impact

Our goal is to get our wonderful stories out into the world, and to do that, we need to hit the international market HARD. We will spam, nag and beg every possible avenue we can find to get your work into the hands of the  international market.

What We Need & What You Get

We can't expect you to fork out your hard-earned cash and not give anything back, so check our many incentives for donating! 

Here are samples of work by the artists you can commission if you support our top tier perk.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word in any way that you can! We are all more than happy to appear on TV and radio interviews, dress up or to do tricks. We are also doing this via an NPO, so if you run a business and would like a tax break, we can hook you up. :)

story:
[This is a campaign to fund a Greek language edition of the comic "Manifesto". At the moment there are no plans for an english language edition. So the text and the video are all in greek. It will be mailed internationally though]


[UPDATE-

Παρακαλω αν θελετε να με ρωτησετε κατι, για να τσεκαρετε για την αποστολη του Perk σας ή οτιδηποτε ΜΗΝ μου στελνετε μεσω Indiegogo.

Προτιμηστε email στο info@iliaskyriazis.com

Ευχαριστω πολυ.]


Γεια σας και καλωσήρθατε στην καμπάνια μας!

Το MANIFESTO anniversary edition θα είναι ένας πολυτελής, σκληρόδετος τόμος 200 και έγχρωμων σελίδων. Θα συλλέγει ολόκληρη την ομώνυμη σειρά κόμικς του Ηλία Κυριαζή και θα περιλαμβάνει μια ολοκαίνουργια ιστορία καθώς και αδημοσίευτο υλικό.

Η σειρά ΜANIFESTO δημοσιεύθηκε σε δύο κύκλους στο ένθετο "9" της εφημερίδας Ελευθεροτυπία από το 2003 εώς το 2008. Οι ιστορίες συλλέχθηκαν σε δύο τόμους ("MANIFESTO" και "ΜΑΝΙFESTO ΔΥΟ") που έχουν πια εξαντληθεί.
Στο πρώτο κύκλο γνωρίζουμε το Βίκτωρα, έναν 20άρη που αγαπά τις ταινίες, αγαπά τα κόμικς και πολύ θα ήθελε να αγαπά και κάποια κοπέλα. Παρακολουθούμε τις καθημερινές περιπέτειες αυτού και της παρέας του, του Άλκη, του Λόγκαν και της Τιτίκας, γεμάτες μαστουρωμένους διαφημιστές, σπαθοφόρους λάτρεις του Άρχοντα των Δαχτυλιδιών, αιματηρούς κουκουναροπόλεμους και τη νεαρή γκοθού Δάφνη.
Στο δεύτερο κύκλο ο Βίκτωρας αγαπά ακόμη τα κόμικς -αν και ζώντας πια ως επαγγελματίας δημιουργος τον βασανίζουν κιόλας- και γνωρίζει την Έυα. Και ανάμεσα σε αφίξεις και αναχωρήσεις φίλων, το πανταχού παρόν πνεύμα του Spider-man και μπαρ αρκούδων θα δουν αν μπορούν να είναι μαζι.

Το MANIFESTO έτυχε πολύ θετικής υποδοχής από κοινό και κριτικούς. Κέρδισε πρώτο βραβείο σεναρίου και short story στα Comicdom Awards και πρώτο βραβείο σεναρίου στο Διαβαλκανικό Φεστιβάλ Κόμικς του Βελιγραδίου.

Για τον δημιουργό

Ο Ηλίας Κυριαζής εργάζεται ως δημιουργός κόμικς από το 2001. Πέρα από το ΜΑΝΙFESTO, για την ελληνική γλώσσα δημιούργησε τις σειρές Blood Opera (Comicdom Award - Best Artist), Βlockbuster, Σε Βλέπω και τα άλμπουμ Toύρτα, Blast Comics και ήταν ιδρυτικό μέλος της ομάδας Subart.
Από το 2008 και μετά εργάζεται για την Αμερικάνικη αγορά. Σχεδίασε τις σειρές Galaxy Quest: Global Warning και Ghostbusters: Displaced Aggression για την IDW, το Vampirella Annual 2 και το graphic novel Grave Surprise για την Dynamite Entertainment. Δημιούργησε τα κόμικς Falling For Lionheart για την IDW (κυκλοφόρησε στα ελληνικά από Jemma Press), Melody για την DC Comics (κυκλοφόρησε στα ελληνικά από Giganto Books) και Jared για την Dark Horse.
Το 2013, μετά απο επιτυχημένη καμπάνια στο Indiegogo κυκλοφόρησε το graphic novel Elysium Online που στην πορεία κέρδισε τον αριθμό ρεκόρ των τεσσάρων Comicdom Awards (Best Comic, Best Writer, Best Artist, Best Self-Published Comic).
Aυτό τον καιρό δουλεύει τη νέα του σειρά, SECRET IDENTITIES, σε σενάριο Jay Faerber & Brian Joines που κυκλοφορεί το Φεβρουάριο του 2015 από την Image Comics.

Για την anniversary edition του MANIFESTO

Το βιβλίο που σκοπεύουμε να κυκλοφορήσουμε μέσω αυτής της καμπάνιας θα είναι μια πολυτελής έκδοση 220 έγχρωμων σελίδων. Θα έχει διαστάσεις 17x24εκ και σκληρό εξώφυλλο. Αναλυτικότερα, θα περιλαμβάνει:
-Τους δύο κύκλους MANIFESTO με νέο lettering.
-Μια ολοκαίνουργια ιστορία που θα βλέπουμε τι συνέβει στους ήρωες από το τέλος του MANIFESTO ΔΥΟ και μετά.
-Τις εκτός αρίθμησης ιστορίες MANIFESTO που κυκλοφόρησαν στο "9" αλλά δε βρίσκονταν στους τόμους: "Crossover" και "Μanifesto #400".
-Πρόλογο από το δημοσιογράφο Θοδωρή Δημητρόπουλο
-Πρώιμα σκίτσα των χαρακτήρων και των εξωφύλλων
-Αναλυτικό σχολιασμό όλων των ιστοριών με behind-the-scenes πληροφορίες, ανέκδοτα στοιχεία κτλ.


Τι χρειαζόμαστε και τι σας προσφέρουμε

Για να γίνει πραγματικότητα η MANIFESTO anniversary edition χρειαζόμαστε τη βοήθεια σας. Έχουμε ορίσει ως στόχο τα 5000 Ευρώ. Αυτά (μετά τις κρατήσεις) θα καλύψουν το τυπογραφείο και τα ταχυδρομικά έξοδα. Σε αντάλαγμα για τις συνεισφορές σας, σας προσφέρουμε μια σειρά από perks. Παρακάτω θα δείτε μια αναλυτική περιγραφή τους ενώ στο sidebar δεξιά θα μπορέσετε να επιλέξετε ποιά προτιμάτε.
(Αν θέλετε ένα συνδιασμό αντικειμένων που δεν έχουμε προβλέψει στη δεξιά στηλη επικοινωνήστε μαζί μας και θα το φροντίσουμε).

(Να επιστήσουμε πρώτα την προσοχή σας στο perk ΠΡΟΣΦΟΡΑ που είναι μόνο για τους 25 που θα προλάβουν. Πέρα από τη συμφέρουσα τιμή δίνει και τη δυνατότητα να αποκτήσετε αυθεντικές σελίδες από το ΜΑΝΙFESTO ΔΥΟ και σχέδια που δε θα τα βρείτε σε άλλο perk.)

-To βιβλίο

Η επετειακή έκδοση MANIFESTO όπως περιγράφεται παραπάνω. Αναμένουμε να είναι έτοιμη σε έξι με οχτώ βδομάδες από τη στιγμή που συμπληρωθεί το ποσό που έχουμε ως στόχο. (Που μπορεί βέβαια να συμβεί πριν τη λήξη της καμπάνιας).

-To βιβλίο υπογεγραμμένο

Σε συγκεκριμένα perks το βιβλίο θα συνοδεύεται από ένα σκίτσο (με μελάνι) του δημιουργού στην πρώτη σελίδα.

-Το Previews Works Digital Pack

Eπαναφέρουμε το δημοφιλές perk από την καμπάνια του Elysium Online. ΕΔΩ μπορείτε να δείτε αναλυτικά ποια κόμικς περιλάμβανε. Σ'αυτά προστίθεται πια και το Twin Army.

-To Elysium Online

 To πολυβραβευμένο graphic novel που κυκλοφόρησε χάρη στην προηγούμενη καμπάνια του δημιουργού.

-Commission

Με το αντίστοιχο perk θα έχετε τη δυνατότητα να παραγγείλετε από το δημιουργό να σχεδιάσει κάτι ειδικά για σας.  Θα απεικονίζει έναν ή δύο χαρακτήρες σε χοντρό χαρτί Schoeller paper μεγέθους Α4 (29.5x21 cm) κατάλληλο για καδράρισμα.

-Αυθεντικές σελίδες

Θα έχετε τη δυνατότητα να αποκτήσετε κάποιες από τις συλλεκτικές, αυθεντικές σελίδες που σχεδιάστηκε το MANIFESTO! Aσπρόμαυρες, σε μέγεθος Α3. Επιλέγετε έσεις ποια θέλετε με σειρά που καθορίζεται από το πότε έγινε η εισφορά σας.
Μέσω του αντίστοιχου perk μπορείτε να αποκτήσετε σελίδες μόνο από τον πρώτο κύκλο, για σελίδες από το δεύτερο δείτε την ΠΡΟΣΦΟΡΑ στα perks.

-Εσείς ή το αγαπημένο σας πρόσωπο μέσα στο κόμικ

Με το αντίστοιχο perk, το άτομο που θα ορίστε θα σχεδιαστεί ως χαρακτήρας στην καινούργια ιστορία που θα βρίσκεται στο βιβλίο. Και θα αποκτήσετε και την σελίδα που εμφανίζεται φυσικά.


Πως αλλιώς μπορείτε να βοηθήσετε

Αν αυτή τη στιγμή αδυνατείτε να στηρίξετε οικονομικά το ΜΑΝΙFESTO, μπορείτε να μας βοηθήσετε λέγοντας σε όσους περισσότερους μπορείτε για  αυτή την καμπάνια. Βοηθήστε να φτάσει η πληροφορία σε όλους όσους αγάπησαν τη σειρά και σε όσους πιστεύετε οτι θα την αγαπήσουν τώρα. Κάντε Follow στο Ιndiegogo και αφήστε comment. Μοιραστείτε το στο Facebook, στο Tumblr, στο Twitter... βοηθήστε μας να το διαδώσουμε!

Και μην ξεχνάτε να χρησιμοποιήτε το hashtag #manifestocomic

Ευχαριστούμε!

Credits:
Layout design έκδοσης Τάσος Παπαιωάννου / One Man Show studio
Video shot by sergio ko and constantin pilavios WITHIN
cut by Nickos Myrtou

story:
Ive been performing cabaret/comedy for the past 11 years funding my shows myself. I am now performing sell out shows in londons hottest cabaret venues in London such as Pizza On The Park, St James Studio Theatre, Leicester Square Theatre & The Pheasantry.

To advance to the next level is a slightly bigger step. My agent/booker say's im good enough but i need a high quality showreel which i plan to film on 25th April 2015 at St James Studio. I will be accompanied by my partner in crime musical director Richard Bates Richard Bates Music and musicians.  

The film will be a professionaly shot video on three cameras, two static and one robotic, which will then be edited into a show reel. It will allow me to retake sketches and a couple of songs that i need for the film and to make sure they are to my best ability. I am hoping to get a good dog, dalek and wonder woman plus a couple of the songs such as the powerful What Makes A Man A Man and my self penned tribute to my dad. The performace will include projection so it should be a great day.

The showreel will be an major tool for forwarding our performing career and will be  used when approaching bigger, more exclusive venues and also for corporate gigs and events, thus allowing us to build a stronger career,widen our audience and create a sustainable income. With the musicians and all the work that has gone into creating our show over the past 11 years, we have gone as far as we can at this level, but as i said earlier, the next step up is quite a big one. It's a very exciting project for me and i really want to create an amazing product.


If I hit the target figure within 14 days I will give all the profit from my next show to charity. If I exceed target then I will donate excess funds to charity. So, by helping my project you will also be helping out a needing charity..how great is that?

Come along and be a part of it on the filming day, in fact, i hope you will! It's a free afternoon in a great setting.


Thanks you


James x x x x

story:
Hooves thundering across dusty plains by a posse seeking justice from a man who cannot be killed by the hangman’s noose, alien cattle drives for human flesh, mutant subterranean hybrids disrupting the progress of the railway west and demon slaying bounty hunters are all tales found in the pages of Horror in the West.

Hi! My name is Phil McClorey, editor and chief of Horror in the West. Along with myself, twenty five other indie hombres have put together this terror filled western, horror anthology. The graphic novel captures the mystic of the Old West and the perils that await those who brave the untamed western frontier with the fear of unknown horrors stalking the dusty trails at night.

 The graphic novel comprises eleven stand alone short stories from some of indie comic’s finest talents. The book is finished; all the stories have been corralled into one volume. Alterna Press has agreed to distribute Horror in the West to comic stores across North America. What we need is your help paying for the print run. In return for your fist full of dollars we’re offering various books, prints, original artwork from the anthology and our thanks for your gracious support.

What We Need and What We’re Offering?

We’re looking to rise $2500 dollars towards the print run of the book. Once accomplished, Alterna will get Horror in the West in comic and book stores across North America. To help us meet that goal we’re offering you a number of pledge options including prints based on artwork from the book and original artwork. A number of the guys who contributed to Horror in the West have produced graphic novel which are also being offered so not only is it possibly for you to support them in this book but also with their previous projects.

 

Contributors to Horror in the West

Cover  – Tony Taylor

Star Calf – Sam Agro

Under the Mountain – Phil McClorey, Jeff McComsey, Jason Copland

The Devil’s Promenade – Ben Truman, Kurt Belcher

Brother’s Keeper – AG Pasquella, Brian Evinou

Lawson – Dan Simon

The Hunters – Chris McQuaid, Chris McFann

Pinkerton Express – Phil McClorey, Adam Christopher

Sacred Heart of Hell – Mike Gagnon, Jason Ho, Kris Johnson

The Amulet – Fred Kennedy, Andre Fernandes

El Tigre – Courtney Joyner, Ron Gravelle

Captured in a Flash – Phil McClorey, Antonio Bandao

Pin-Ups – Shane Heron, Adam Gorham, Marvin Law

Back Cover – Adam Christopher

Foreword – Jeff Moss

Title Page Designs – Brian Evinou

Hooves thundering across dusty plains by a posse seeking justice from a man who cannot be killed by the hangman’s noose, alien cattle drives for human flesh, mutant subterranean hybrids disrupting the progress of the railway west and demon slaying bounty hunters are all tales found in the pages of Horror in the West.
Hi! My name is Phil McClorey, editor and chief of Horror in the West. Along with myself, twenty five other indie hombres have put together this terror filled western, horror anthology. The graphic novel captures the mystic of the Old West and the perils that await those who brave the untamed western frontier with the fear of unknown horrors stalking the dusty trails at night.
 The graphic novel comprises eleven stand alone short stories from some of indie comic’s finest talents. The book is finished; all the stories have been corralled into one volume. Alterna Press has agreed to distribute Horror in the West to comic stores across North America. What we need is your help paying for the print run. In return for your fist full of dollars we’re offering various books, prints, original artwork from the anthology and our thanks for your gracious support.
What We Need and What We’re Offering?
We’re looking to rise $2500 dollars towards the print run of the book. Once accomplished, Alterna will get Horror in the West in comic and book stores across North America. To help us meet that goal we’re offering you a number of pledge options including prints based on artwork from the book and original artwork. A number of the guys who contributed to Horror in the West have produced graphic novel which are also being offered so not only is it possibly for you to support them in this book but also with their previous projects.
 
Contributors to Horror in the West
Cover  – Tony Taylor
Star Calf – Sam Agro
Under the Mountain – Phil McClorey, Jeff McComsey, Jason Copland
The Devil’s Promenade – Ben Truman, Kurt Belcher
Brother’s Keeper – AG Pasquella, Brian Evinou
Lawson – Dan Simon
The Hunters – Chris McQuaid, Chris McFann
Pinkerton Express – Phil McClorey, Adam Christopher
Sacred Heart of Hell – Mike Gagnon, Jason Ho, Kris Johnson
The Amulet – Fred Kennedy, Andre Fernandes
El Tigre – Courtney Joyner, Ron Gravelle
Captured in a Flash – Phil McClorey, Antonio Bandao
Pin-Ups – Shane Heron, Adam Gorham, Marvin Law
Back Cover – Adam Christopher
Foreword – Jeff Moss
Title Page Designs – Brian Evinou

story:
About us and our Anthologies

Gurukitty Studios is proud to announce that our second anthology is almost ready to be printed!

Our first anthology was called "Ghost Tales" and it has  over 200 copies distributed already in its short little life. woo hoo! The anthology has been at Calgary Expo, FanExpo Vancouver, Vancaf and countless other conventions over the last few months. Because the artists distribute and sell their own copies as well, the book has gotten sent all over the world, Hong Kong, Australia, United States, UK and Canada!
Ghost Tales has 16 ghost stories from 20 artists and the books reader age is about... young teen. 

When we first published Ghost Tales, we were not doing it for profit, and indeed no profit was made really, but thats okay; our goal with these anthologies is to give artists a chance to have some work published so they can make a little money doing what they love! :D

How the anthology projects we do work is that the artists are given a couple free copies and are able to order more at wholesale to earn money from their work. Gurukitty studios publishes and prints the books at our own expense.

Our money is mostly earned from convention and online shop sales as well as some random commissions. The rest we make up with our own personal money.This year's convention earnings were not as good as last years and we are going to need some help to raise the money to send out the artists copies and pre-orders this year.

 

 Once Upon a time is a collection of 20 stories, all fairy / folk tale based! We will be posting sample pages Daily(ish) in the updates so you can get an idea of the variety and quality of the works in this volume!

Also I am trying to put some interviews with some of the artists about their work and their stories in this anthology!

We have several returning artists from Ghost Tales as well as some amazing new faces!


This time we have barcodes, ISBN#'s and everything to make this book POS ready.

We've tried to step up our game, and make sure this time round is even better than the first!

 

What we need

Our total number of free issues we need to give out is approx 50 to give to the artists, the cover artists, the logo designer and a couple special thanks (approx $400-$500). Aside from that expense, we also need to ship these issues to the artists, some live international, some in the US, and some in Canada, believe it or not, that cost us MORE than paying for the copies to be printed ($500-$600).

So, we need money to help raise the cost of printing and shipping the payment copies to the artists and other people that helped make this book happen, as well as a few extra copies for in case situations and  to keep in stock to help us earn some money to buy stock for Calgary Expo 2013.

All totalled we've figured out that we need approx $900 ($400 printing, $500 shipping), the rest we could probably make up in our last few conventions this year.

**An added note, this time round we are going to have a standard cover and a Variant cover! Previews are in the gallery on the tabs above! The variant is not going to be as readily available, it's a special edition and only available through this indigogo campaign and wont be available to order at any time like the standard! So if you are a fan of Jason Harts work, this is your last chance for a while to get the special cover!

***We will add updates with previews of some of the pages and other information periodically so you can see more of this project! Also, check out Gurukitty.com for more information!

 

Also, wether we recieve all our funding or not, this book WILL be printed and completed. Theres no doubt about that. Without extra funding, it just may take a little longer than we hoped.  Our goal was to have it out before October.

 Other things you can do to help

If you cant contribute financially to this project, thats okay! :D

You can help us by spreading the word about our project and this campaign on your google+, facebooks and twitters and all those other social media sites you might be a part of. 

Theres little "share" and "like" buttons under the title image of this campaign, you can use those, and the short URL there to spread the word!

Thank you so much for your help!

0u0

story:
Brielle and Loaded Barrel Studios


Hi! Jared Barel here from Loaded Barrel Studios and the artist and writer from our forthcoming graphic novel, BRIELLE AND THE HORROR, VOLUME 1. Brielle and the Horror first came about a long time ago in a galaxy far far-- okay, it was in New York in 2007 at the New York Comic Con where we first debuted our very first comic book Brielle and the Horror #1 about a 16 year old girl who must learn to control the demon inside of her before it brings about the end of the world. Here's what some folks thought about it:

The Haven awarded BRIELLE AND THE HORROR the honor of Best Book You've Never Heard Of in 2007 in its annual Top Comics awards.

"Now onto the book itself. It's frigging impressive. You could put it on the shelves beside most of the output from the big two, and this book, just production wise, will take em. Absolutely gorgeous book, and possibly the future of comics." - Heroic Times

"'Brielle and the Horror' [is] the find of the last couple of years!... Heartwarming and haunting, this book introduces a talented new trio to the world of comics!" - AmishOtaku.com

"'Brielle and the Horror' was our favorite book from the con, no doubt. It's just such a cool-looking book and great story, we absolutely loved it." - N3RDCast

"What's interesting is just how well these guys have meshed making a movie and making a comic." - Omnicomic

After debuting BRIELLE and releasing the first couple chapters we tried our hand at making a full length graphic novel - GREY - about a city cop who moves to the country only to find out he's got trouble from an alien tormenting his town. GREY was the winner of the Silver Medal for Best Graphic Novel from the Independent Publishers Book Awards.

"Visually I instantly fell in love with Grey and found each turn of the page to be more awe-inspiring than the last... This is a must read graphic novel that will leave you attempting to sleep with one eye open for weeks to come." - Comics Forge

What We Need & What You Get

So we're wrapping up production on Brielle and the Horror Volume 1 right this very instant (seriously, even if it's 4 in the morning I'm still probably up working on it). All we are looking for now is help to cover the cost of printing. We just need a little help making this final push to get GREY to the New York Comic Con in October and on shelves in comic stores everywhere. 

Obviously, it would be nice to raise the complete funds to cover all of the printing costs, but truthfully, every dollar will help. One way or another, this book is getting printed, so rest assured that every dollar you pledge will go directly toward that goal, even if we don't raise all of the funding that we're looking for here - this book will be printed.

More important than any of that is all the cool stuff we're offering. Signed merch, limited edition and out of print items, hoodies, skateboards - really cool stuff... and if you look closely, you'll notice we've even taken out the big guns to offer you an original comic book of your very own to be published by Loaded Barrel Studios... oh, and there's that whole Loaded Barrel Studios producing your short film perk on the bottom... man, we're gonna have some fun.

The Impact

Our last graphic novel, GREY was an international hit having been translated into other languages, distributed overseas, and digitized for a number of different distributors. Brielle and the Horror is the story that launched our studio - it's time her whole story is told to the world. We're so excited to bring Brielle and the Horror to you. The fans that have supported us through the years have given us a tremendous push to keep moving forward. This is for you guys and for all the new fans we're about to meet. Thanks for your help and support!

Other Ways You Can Help

Remember, if you can't contribute there are still other ways you can help us, most importantly byspreading the word! Tell your friend who loves sci-fi movies or your brother who likes horror movies, share a link to this page on Facebook or Twitter. Every little bit helps and we appreciate it all! Thanks!

story:
What's This All About?

Hello! I'm Bonny Lee Hardgrove- artist, writer, and all-around nerd in various forms. I am delving into the fantastical world of comics with a brand new series with  entitled "The Karvalas Brothers"- a duo team of paranormal Investigators. I have a unique artistic style and voice in the genre, and this is an excellent chance to be heard. The number one thing that any artist needs is also one of the hardest to obtain- a fan base. To build a fan base, one must go where the fans are, and that is at comic conventions. I need your help to get there. I want to get my work out there in the world, and comic con is where to do it.

What We Need & What You Get

Preparing for a comic con involves some heavy fundage. Booth rentals, promotional items such as posters, buttons, t-shirts, and of course, the comics themselves, runs high on the income of the typical starving artist. That's where you, the contributor, come in. With your help, I can raise the funds needed to attend the next Chicago Wizard World convention and get my artwork out to the people who will enjoy it the most. These are my people, and they deserve the best I can offer them. To acheive the absolute best requires more capital that is usually available to me. 

Your contributions will also be used to update the equipment that I use to create the artwork. My outdated, opensource software and elderly computer work just fine for the small web comics available on my website (which can be seen at www.bonnyleehardgrove.com), but I want to offer the fans something much more polished. Basically, for an endeavor such as this, I need to up my game. 

The Impact

Let's be frank...there aren't a whole lot of female comic artists out there. If this series becomes successful, wouldn't it be grand to add a female voice to the comic book canon? Your contributions will help make that happen, as well as add to the pop culture and fantasy worlds that we have all grown to love from our childhood and well into our adulthood.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are more ways you can help even if you can't contribute financially. Spread the word! Follow the campaign on Twitter and Facebook. Tell your friends. Tell your loved ones and your loved ones' friends and your friends' loved ones.

story:
CHECK OUT A 10 PAGE PREVIEW HERE.

Or an exclusive, spoiler free preview here from further along in the story. 

WHAT IS KATRINA HATES DEAD S*%T?

Katrina Hates Dead S*%T (KHDS) Is a 116 page single volume graphic novel. It's a complete story told in five issues. Katrina Hates Dead S*%T is a tongue and cheek look at how crappy it would be to live in the Apocalypse. 

Almost every story about the Apocalypse starts immediately after the Apocalypse begins, showing the horror and terror that follows the first days of living in "Hell on Earth".

 

KHDS isn't that. 

In Katrina, the Apocalypse is already old news. It happened years ago. Everything has settled down, and the Hellspawn have taken up residence on Earth. They are next door neighbors to the humans they slaughtered. They take hard working humans jobs. 

It's a downright sucky row to hoe, but it's everyday life. 

Katrina, our heroine, is a little sick of fighting monsters, waiting on monsters, and buying her groceries from monsters. She wants her old life back. So she sets out to do something about it. 

She sets out on a journey to Hell to kill the Devil and end the Apocalypse once and for all. 

 

 

We took that trope as old as time, the Apocalypse, put a new spin on it, and added a ton of comedy elements. This isn't a heavy handed book at all. It's a monster filled, sarcastic, satirical good time. 

But don't just take it from me, here's what FANBOY COMICS had to say about Katrina: 

"Take it from this Comic Book Slayer, fans of edgy horror comics like Hack/Slash or tongue-in-cheek horror tales like Shaun of the Dead or Zombieland will devour this book like starving zombies devour fresh brains. The creative team behind Katrina Hates Dead S*%T is an impressive one. Artist Juan Frigeri’s work is expressive, exciting, and sets a fun, yet thrilling, tone throughout the story."

 

 

THAT'S FINE AND ALL, HOW DO I KNOW THIS BOOK WILL GET DONE?

It's really simple. It's already done. We've got copies sitting in my garage right now. 

 

 

 

IS THE BOOK A COMPLETE ARC THOUGH?

Yes. This is the complete book. It fully tells the story I wanted to tell and I have no intention of going back into this world. 

Of course, I thought Fight Club would never have a sequel too and now there's a graphic novel, so I can't guarantee anything. 

I only can say this is everything I've ever wanted to say with Katrina. 

 

 

LET'S TALK ABOUT THE ARTIST FOR A SECOND, OKAY? 

Yes, let's. 

The story is great, and I'm not biased at all, but what would my words be without Juan Frigeri's amazing work.

This was Juan's FIRST full length comic book. Yes, even though it's coming out so much later than some of his other work, this was his FIRST. 

Since then he's gone on to draw for Dark Horse and Avatar, among others. 

He even drew the DARTH MAUL: SON OF DATHOMIR series for Dark Horse

 

 

. That's right. Star Wars y'all. Geek Cred leveled up! 

 

 

KATRINA HARD COVER  

Tell me this dope cover isn't worth upping your pledge to the $75 level. Not only do you get a hard cover, but you also get the amazing cover we used @ SDCC, one of my favorite images ever.

 

 

Thanks for looking at this! Hope you pledge because the book is awesome!

story:
$10,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED*- Square-bound Cardstock Cover!

$60,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED*- Exclusive Cover by Ethan Van Sciver!

$70,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED*- The 50-page JAWBREAKERS- LOST SOULS will be accompanied by a Brand-New 25-Page story titled JAWBREAKERS- Book Two!

$90,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED*- the 32-page JAWBREAKERS- Book One RE-MASTERED will be included!

$110,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED* ($50 perk backers only)- in addition to the Jon Malin High-Quality Print Poster, there will also be a High-Quality Print Poster of the Ethan Van Sciver exclusive cover!

$130,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED* ($50 perk backers only)- in addition to the Jon Malin and Ethan Van Sciver High-Quality Print Posters, there will also be a Good Girl Art pin-up poster of Xaxi by Sashi Pergidao!

$150,000 STRETCH GOAL  *UNLOCKED* - Richard Meyer, Jon Malin and Brett Smith (the creative team of JAWBREAKERS- LOST SOULS) will have a store/convention appearance together somewhere in 2018 in the Continental United States (location to be voted on by fans)!

 

The Jawbreakers are a group of ex-superheroes turned mercenaries. After burning bridges with the CIA while operating in the Mid-East and losing their lucrative security contracts in Europe, they find themselves in Africa working as monster hunters. 

Written by Richard C. Meyer ("Zack" from DIVERSITY & COMICS) 

Drawn by Marvel Comics Artist Jon Malin (CABLE, NEW WARRIORS, THUNDERBOLTS)

Colored by Brett Smith (GI.JOE, WOLVERINE, BATMAN, JUSTICE LEAGUE, HARLEY QUINN)

This comic book has already started production. New pages are being created every few days. 

Each new page will be added here as well as shown in Updates for the campaign. By the time the campaign ends, the book should be halfway completed.
story_txt: $10,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED*- Square-bound Cardstock Cover!$60,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED*- Exclusive Cover by Ethan Van Sciver!$70,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED*- The 50-page JAWBREAKERS- LOST SOULS will be accompanied by a Brand-New 25-Page story titled JAWBREAKERS- Book Two!$90,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED*- the 32-page JAWBREAKERS- Book One RE-MASTERED will be included!$110,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED* ($50 perk backers only)- in addition to the Jon Malin High-Quality Print Poster, there will also be a High-Quality Print Poster of the Ethan Van Sciver exclusive cover!$130,000 STRETCH GOAL *UNLOCKED* ($50 perk backers only)- in addition to the Jon Malin and Ethan Van Sciver High-Quality Print Posters, there will also be a Good Girl Art pin-up poster of Xaxi by Sashi Pergidao!$150,000 STRETCH GOAL  *UNLOCKED* - Richard Meyer, Jon Malin and Brett Smith (the creative team of JAWBREAKERS- LOST SOULS) will have a store/convention appearance together somewhere in 2018 in the Continental United States (location to be voted on by fans)! The Jawbreakers are a group of ex-superheroes turned mercenaries. After burning bridges with the CIA while operating in the Mid-East and losing their lucrative security contracts in Europe, they find themselves in Africa working as monster hunters. Written by Richard C. Meyer ("Zack" from DIVERSITY & COMICS) Drawn by Marvel Comics Artist Jon Malin (CABLE, NEW WARRIORS, THUNDERBOLTS)Colored by Brett Smith (GI.JOE, WOLVERINE, BATMAN, JUSTICE LEAGUE, HARLEY QUINN)This comic book has already started production. New pages are being created every few days. Each new page will be added here as well as shown in Updates for the campaign. By the time the campaign ends, the book should be halfway completed.

story:
*FUNDING GOAL REACHED*

Thank you everybody for your support!
Now, we'd like to announce some stretch goals to look forward to:

STRETCH GOALS

If we can manage to raise enough money, we would like to reward all of our backers with free bonus content!

$7,000 Trading Card
All backers receiving physical books will recieve a trading card featuring the cybernetic warlord Amar Ahmadi!

$9,000 Alternate Cover for Issue #1
All backers who include issue #1 in their order will receive it with a new cover drawn by the artist Dennis Tirona!

$11,000 Issue #1 Remaster & Bookmark
Issue #1 will receive a visual upgrade as SOMNI the FERRYMAN 2 letterer & designer will provide new lettering and visual tweaks to the issue. Also, a new bookmark will be unlocked for ALL backers receiving physical books!
 

 

In a future where the afterlife has been hijacked by technology,
the dead, like secrets, don't stay buried forever.

The Ferryman #2 is the second in a five-part science-fiction/noir comic book series set in a world where the dead, uploaded to a virtual paradise, have discovered a way to escape and wreak havoc on the living.

issue 2 cover art

The Story So Far...

In 2051, new technology has given rise to mankind's greatest invention, the afterlife. All it takes is a simple implant and upon your death, if you can afford it, your consciousness can be recovered and uploaded to Glory, a user-created paradise where any indulgence is possible. Miles Armstrong is a Recovery Agent, downloading the dead on the graveyard shift when he suddenly finds himself the target of a vast conspiracy that threatens to destroy Glory from within and without when one of the inventors of Glory is murdered on his shift.

In This Issue...

Miles, haunted by the trauma of his attack, begins to question everything he thought he understood about Glory and the loss of his brother. As he begins the long road to recovery, he seeks out answers to the mystery he's been thrown into.

Meanwhile, in Damascus, Journalist Tara Mitnick and her bodyguard Nakoa have to join forces with the cybernetic terrorist Amar Ahmadi to escape the city and the technological abominations that are pursuing them.

 

 

THE FERRYMAN
Issue 2 Sample Pages

Here are a few samples of the pages currently in production.

1

2

3

4

You can read the preview here:
FERRYMAN 2 PREVIEW

 

What We Need & What You Get

The requested funds are to cover production, printing, and shipping costs.

In addition to a physical copy of this issue, we are also offering reprints of issue one, digital PDF versions as well as higher tiers that will include high-quality poster prints and original art pages drawn by Dennis Tirona.

 

Poster Prints For this Campaign

 

Risks & Challenges

The main risk with a project in this stage would be unforeseen delays in production and printing. These things can happen and will be dealt with accordingly. This is our second campaign and we have a solid reputation for fulfillment.

Reader pics from our previous campaign for The Ferryman #1

The biggest concern to be aware of is for those who wish to buy original art pages. As Dennis is based outside of the U.S., there is always a chance that the pages may be lost or damaged in shipping. While unlikely, in the case that something should happen, refunds will be offered to those backers for the cost of the pages and they will receive all other purchased items in their tier.

Actual production  page for Ferryman #2 - traditional inks on 11x17" bristol board

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If it's not possible for you to contribute to the comic but you still want to help, it would be fantastic if you could share this link wherever you can. It really helps us out when you do that.

Thank you,

Team Ferryman

 

THE FERRYMAN 2
Creative Team

  • Sean Campbell - Writer/Editor
  • Dennis Tirona - Artist
  • Ester Salguero - Colorist
  • SOMNI - Letterer/Design

story:
Armor-I is an all ages sci-fi adventure comic created by Marcel Dupree, Carlos Trigo, and Andrea Celestini. We want to use the fund the printing of Armor-I #3 and wrap up production on the 36 page issue. The 36 page issue consist of 24 pages of Armor-I, 8 pages of Baranzu, and 4 pages of ads. 

So far...Lord Novaden has sent Malgor's ship to head to Earth in order to retrieve what is said to be the greatest weapon in the universe. Unfortunately, the weapon is the new friend of Jason King. As the bond between the weapon and Jason gets stronger the harder it is to retrieve it. 

The Back Up Story 

Baranzu is about two young children visit Japan to get in touch with their Japanese heritage. The children unwittingly unleash a family curse that has been locked away for hundreds of years. 

 

Why You Should Get This 

Instead of begging other people, creators, companies to create sci-fi that I like, I decided to make my own. I blended some of my own influences to make Armor-I. I was fortunate to meet Carlos on the Digital Webbing platform and we immediately hit it off. We discussed my goals for the series and then went straight to work. The team wanted to come in with familiar storytelling and Sci Fi elements and then add our own twist to give readers a level of comfort and excitement. We knocked out the first two issues with ease then took a hiatus. We started back up again with Issue 3 in 2016. We slowly churned out three more issues(yes, up to Issue 5 is drawn and colored) and now we are currently planning the second arc in hopes of the first arc being well received by all comic book enthusiasts and Sci Fi fans alike. 

REVIEWS FOR ISSUES 1 AND 2

"This comic is a good one."-Fanbase Press

"Across both stories, there are some strong writing and striking, if different, art styles." Comic Crusaders

"It’s a story with incredibly solid characterization a premise that promotes intrigue and action and adventure that will excite readers of all ages."-Reading With A Flight Ring

"...snatch this title up and any future titles that may be coming from this team of creators and you will be glad you did." Outright Geekery

"If you are looking for that great new something, Armor-I is perfect for you. Out of all the comics I’ve read in the past week, the only books that rival Armor-I may be the latest issues of Doomsday Clock and X-O Manowar." 2G1 Reviews

"I’m giving this one an 8/10 – well worth checking out, don’t miss it!" TM Stash

story:
The Creator

Being a long time fan of comic books, Comic Art, and comic book movies; it was only a matter of time before Ray Zepeda would eventually turn his love for comics into a career choice. For the last decade Ray has been moving forward trying to make his dream a reality by pushing boundaries and launching Tragic Hero Comics in 2012! We have been building a story that means the world to us and hopefully to you guys too, but Tragic Hero Comics Publishing needs YOU now!

That's right! You can be heroes in your own right, simply by contributing to the campaign and collecting some awesome swag in the process! By helping the THC team bring the next epic chapter of AntiHero 113 to print, you can help us reach a wider audience, generate more interest in our content, and brake barriers that we never thought possible! 

So from all of us, thanks in advance. We can't express what your loyalty and support mean to the team, the comic and Ray.

-THC Team.

Our Story

An arcane society known as The Department of Advanced Research and Knowledge (D.A.R.K.), attempt to create the perfect army by secretly testing on American youth. The project was to usher the United States into a new era of superiority, technology, and most importantly...power.

As the project proceeded, things went from bad to worse -- most of the test subjects became increasingly unstable and violent thus steps were taken resulting in their immediate extermination and eventual shut down of the project...or so they thought.

In an unimaginable stroke of fate, 113 of the test subjects are discarded from the project due to an egregious oversight that ultimately saved them from the merciless massacre.

Now: A small group of the ill-fated 113 have been thrown together by a series of events out of their control.  What happens when all these kids have, are each other, and the abilities that manifested in them after being cruelly experimented on by D.A.R.K.?

Get ready to find out how it all goes down in this explosive new chapter of AntiHero: 113!

 

AntiHero 113's Reviews...

So a lot of folks like to Post reviews from Pod Casts and Comic Book Reviewers, etc... but we take the opinions of our fans and supporters just seriously. Here's a few:

"Well personally I thought it was good and fantastic even with the characters development and with their powers based on their minds and not some chemical mishap and the art was good along with the plot hope you continue with it."  -Damian D. ( Fan met at Stan Lee's Comikaze)

"Holy crap! I read the comics and love everything about it. The story's amazing and is driving me crazy that I don't know what's going to happen next so when you come out with more please tell me because I want to read more!"  -Joseph S. (First time comic book reader met at The Latino Comics Expo)

"Antihero has the right amount of suspense to keep you wanting more! At the end, it leaves you with the cliff hanger affect. The illustrations are great too! As a woman, you're not left feeling objectified, Kuddos!  -Alicia E (Fourth Grade Teacher)

Our Goal:

THC Publishing's goal is to raise enough money to publish this exciting next step into the Tragic Hero Comic-verse lore. The momentum gained from this campaign will help us to successfully launch Antihero 113 beyond our current state in order to reach vaster audience the world over!

What We Need:

This is where you wonderful people come in we need to raise $3,000 dollars for this campaign!

I know you're thinking why so much? Where is it going?

Both good questions… 2/3 of it  is going to pay for the art, Here at THC Publishing we work with the best in order to bring you the best. The rest of the funding will cover Coloring and Printing costs, it’s as simple as that. If we make more than our goal we have some fun stretch goals in mind too!

What You Get…

THC Publishing has a lot in store for you guys! We have several awesome perk packages for you guys to choose from (*some are limited) so just take a look to the right, there are tiers for everyone from new readers to super fans! go ahead take a look, we'll wait.

*** Remember please include your full address to have your swag shipped to you!***

Remember you can also support us by simply making a contribution to the cause we have a few options for you to choose from.

 

What IF We Don’t Meet Our Goal?

 

Man, you guys are asking some good questions! Like a famous star ship captain once said, ”We don’t believe in no-win scenarios”. That being said, if for some reason we come up short, we will produce as much as we can with what funding we are fortunate enough to receive, and will do our damnedest to get the rest somehow. Either way, our supporters and contributors are our number one priority and will be taken care of asap for their trust and loyalty as you mean the world to the THC Publishing team because without you, there is no us.

                                     ***All perks/swag will be delivered upon printing***

Production

The THC Publishing team are hard at work getting every part of this comic book finalized and print ready! So stay tuned for possible sneak peeks of the script or early art work!

 

YOUR IMPACT ON US...

First, your impact on us is beyond measure, every time we get to meet a fan or a new reader that connects to us through the story that we are telling, we know that the path we are on is the right one.

Second,by asking when the next chapter is coming or traveling to see us at comic cons you are motivating us to dig deep and work harder for you so we can get those stories into your hands. So thank you for being the catalyst and the motivation that fuels our fire!

Third, you all are helping everyone involved in this project get a little closer to realizing their dreams of working in comics. For us this is not a hobby or a job, its a way of life and a labor of love. Again, thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

 

When Will The New Issue Be Ready?

The book will be ready a short time after we reach our goal. Most of you know this, but for those that don't people who work in comics are strong believers in getting paid for your work, THC Publishing supports this and makes sure artists get paid for their work asap. That being said, will will give constant updates on the progression of the art as it comes in so all of our supporters know where we are. 

Here are a few things to note- The supporters of the campaign will be receiving their copies of the new issue + their swag (depending on the tier level you opted for) as soon as we are in print.

For those who can’t donate but would like to buy a copy later, info for where and when we will be selling them will be available soon, so keep your eyes peeled.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

If you can’t help us financially, we totally understand! Here’s the good news, you can still help us get the word out about the campaign for the new issue! All you have to do is share our campaign with your friends and family on social media! We appreciate all of the support that comes our way whether you can donate or not, we love you all!

story:
DAVE SIM! CARSON GRUBAUGH! JACK VANDYKE! 

You Don't Know Jack: Two-Fisted Comic Store Manager!

THE MOST INCLUSIVE COMIC EVER!

 You Don't Know Jack: Two-Fisted Comic-Store Manager is a 48-page comic-book collaboration between legendary Cerebus creator Dave Sim, real-life (now, former) comic-store manager Jack VanDyke, and artist Carson Grubaugh.  

To best represent the stunning brushwork by Grubaugh, the book will printed by one of North America's finest offset printers, on premium paper that reveals every nuance of the line work. 

You'll also receive a holographic YDKJ sticker, included with every package we send out!

WHAT ELSE CAN I GET?

Also available, exclusively to this campaign:

1. HERMITAGE AWESOMES Physical Edition -- $20

The Hermitage Awesomes auction catalog parody, now available as a physical edition, or a digital download. The physical edition will be signed by Carson Grubaugh, and will be exclusive to this campaign. This 72-page book presents a number of things--

an eight-page “movie trailer” preview of the Strange Death of Alex Raymond

a long-form parody of the Heritage Auctions catalog, featuring closeups of the original artwork for the entirety of You Don't Know Jack, and more, and long, dense humorous descriptive “essays” on the various pieces in question

detailed essays by Sim jumping off of key Alex Raymond original artwork sold through Heritage Auctions, along with closeups of the discussed work  

For an additional $20 above the pledge for the physical book, your catalog will be signed and numbered by Dave Sim and Carson Grubaugh! (Limited quantities available).

2. SIX MACRO CONS—THE COLLECTED GRUBAUGH -- $20

 Created especially for the YDKJ Kickstarter, in a signed and numbered edition, this 76-page, full-color, perfect-bound book presents select short comics by Carson Grubaugh, including "Take On Me", his 5-page collaboration with Cerebus co-artist Gerhard! 

 Here are some images from the book.

C. Carson Grubaugh's nine-page Artist's Commentary, in which he discusses how You Don't Know Jack came to be, the process of working on the project, and further thoughts regarding some of the specific illustrations produced for the book.

D. The Strange Death of Alex Raymond Fundraiser Edition! Signed by Carson Grubaugh - - $100

For the past four years Dave Sim and Carson Grubaugh have been working together to create a long form graphic novel, The Strange Death of Alex Raymond. Earlier this year, a 132-page sampler of this longer work was announced, to be sold to promote a larger run of the book. While that promotion and plan fell through, the book was still printed, and we have access to 100 of the 400 promotional copies that were produced! (60 currently available).

Promo edition or not, this is a stunning book, lovingly-produced and printed.

This however is NOT the full Strange Death of Alex Raymond. This is not a book we are publishing! We are simply selling the 100 copies kindly gifted to us by Eddie Khanna, who paid for the promotional printing. As such, availability is very limited.

We hope that one day you'll be able to read Strange Death of Alex Raymond in full. But if you're curious now, and you want to get to read the 2/5s of the book THIS year instead of, say, next, well, we've got you covered.

PLEASE NOTE: SDOAR V1 can be added to ANY shipping tier via ADD ON.

E. Original YDKJ Artwork!

All of the artwork for the comic is available for sale, but you'll have to visit Carson's website to take a look. The original art is on view, with pricing at http://hodtech.net/ydkj.html Contact Carson at clubgrubbug@gmail.com with a list of all of the works you want and he will create a custom tier just for you!

F. Google-Image Grab-Bag Sketches -- $70 per

For every $70 you pledge above your chosen tier you will get one Google-Image Grab-Bag sketch by Carson Grubaugh.

You will be asked to provide a word or phrase. Carson will search that on Google images and do a straight-to-ink sketch of the first photographic image that comes up. Time-plase videos of you art being made will be posted to Carson's Instagram account https://www.instagram.com/carsongrubaugh/

and real-time videos will be posted to his You-Tube channel https://www.youtube.com/user/clubgrubbug

PLEASE NOTE: these can be added to any normally-shipped tier via "ADD ON"!

OKAY, I'm Ready to Give You My Money Now For Your Cool Stuff.

Great! 

Thank you so much for your support. We look forward to getting these works into your hands.

Best,

Carson Grubaugh, Jack VanDyke, Sean Robinson
story_txt: DAVE SIM! CARSON GRUBAUGH! JACK VANDYKE! You Don't Know Jack: Two-Fisted Comic Store Manager!THE MOST INCLUSIVE COMIC EVER! You Don't Know Jack: Two-Fisted Comic-Store Manager is a 48-page comic-book collaboration between legendary Cerebus creator Dave Sim, real-life (now, former) comic-store manager Jack VanDyke, and artist Carson Grubaugh.  To best represent the stunning brushwork by Grubaugh, the book will printed by one of North America's finest offset printers, on premium paper that reveals every nuance of the line work. You'll also receive a holographic YDKJ sticker, included with every package we send out!WHAT ELSE CAN I GET?Also available, exclusively to this campaign:1. HERMITAGE AWESOMES Physical Edition -- $20The Hermitage Awesomes auction catalog parody, now available as a physical edition, or a digital download. The physical edition will be signed by Carson Grubaugh, and will be exclusive to this campaign. This 72-page book presents a number of things--an eight-page “movie trailer” preview of the Strange Death of Alex Raymonda long-form parody of the Heritage Auctions catalog, featuring closeups of the original artwork for the entirety of You Don't Know Jack, and more, and long, dense humorous descriptive “essays” on the various pieces in questiondetailed essays by Sim jumping off of key Alex Raymond original artwork sold through Heritage Auctions, along with closeups of the discussed work  For an additional $20 above the pledge for the physical book, your catalog will be signed and numbered by Dave Sim and Carson Grubaugh! (Limited quantities available).2. SIX MACRO CONS—THE COLLECTED GRUBAUGH -- $20 Created especially for the YDKJ Kickstarter, in a signed and numbered edition, this 76-page, full-color, perfect-bound book presents select short comics by Carson Grubaugh, including "Take On Me", his 5-page collaboration with Cerebus co-artist Gerhard!  Here are some images from the book.C. Carson Grubaugh's nine-page Artist's Commentary, in which he discusses how You Don't Know Jack came to be, the process of working on the project, and further thoughts regarding some of the specific illustrations produced for the book.D. The Strange Death of Alex Raymond Fundraiser Edition! Signed by Carson Grubaugh - - $100For the past four years Dave Sim and Carson Grubaugh have been working together to create a long form graphic novel, The Strange Death of Alex Raymond. Earlier this year, a 132-page sampler of this longer work was announced, to be sold to promote a larger run of the book. While that promotion and plan fell through, the book was still printed, and we have access to 100 of the 400 promotional copies that were produced! (60 currently available).Promo edition or not, this is a stunning book, lovingly-produced and printed.This however is NOT the full Strange Death of Alex Raymond. This is not a book we are publishing! We are simply selling the 100 copies kindly gifted to us by Eddie Khanna, who paid for the promotional printing. As such, availability is very limited.We hope that one day you'll be able to read Strange Death of Alex Raymond in full. But if you're curious now, and you want to get to read the 2/5s of the book THIS year instead of, say, next, well, we've got you covered.PLEASE NOTE: SDOAR V1 can be added to ANY shipping tier via ADD ON.E. Original YDKJ Artwork!All of the artwork for the comic is available for sale, but you'll have to visit Carson's website to take a look. The original art is on view, with pricing at http://hodtech.net/ydkj.html Contact Carson at clubgrubbug@gmail.com with a list of all of the works you want and he will create a custom tier just for you!F. story:
True Patriot is a comic book by Canadian creators with strong ties to the publishing community in New York City, with professional and personal contacts in New Jersey, as well as friends in other areas affected by Hurricane Sandy.

True Patriot is a comic book about fictional heroes saving the day. We can be heroes too. Or at least help the real heroes on the frontlines like the Red Cross do their jobs for those in need.

With this campaign we're trying to reach out to our True Patriot funders, the Canadian comic book community, and other comic book creators and fans out there. 

Please take a look at our perks to see if anything we're offering interests you. Give comics for Christmas while giving to charity! "No perk donations" are also welcome. You can give as little as $1. Every bit helps!

Thank you for your attention.

story:
After fighting so hard to get myself a table at New York Comic Con, it turns out that I cannot afford to actually get the table. The cost of the table is $500. Add to that gas, tolls, food and the train in each day, and we are looking at a weekend trip of over $1,000.

I've never missed a comic con, and while I usually don't make money from the weekend, it's a great for promotion of my stuff. And this year, I actually have a few new books/comics out to sell, including The Poe Murders, which has been killing at all the cons I've been at this year.

So, I really need your help. I don't have much to offer. So, I figured I would put my books up as the prizes for helping me out.

My new books are The Poe Murders Graphic Novel, High School Heroes Graphic Novel, and New York Jungle Zombies. If you contribute $10, you can get any one of those books. Or if you want all three, that would be $25.

I appreciate any help you can send my way guys. I have only until September 18th to pay for the table, so that's when this will end. Thanks.

story:
Summary

Discover the dark origins of Redorik! Crystal Fractal Comics presents the origin story of Justin Henderson, a high school senior struggling to juggle the stresses of his social life with his blossoming dark, mystical powers. While leading a normal life on the surface, what dwells deep within him threatens to push him over the edge. Will Justin succeed and become the hero he can be, or will the dark voices in his head push him past salvation?

The Project

Redorik is a comic book project years in the making, set within the Crystal Fractal Comics universe(CFU). Tying directly into our other titles, Redorik is an essential piece of our greater vision for our comic book world.  Series writer Howard Wong describes the title as not being the traditional superhero tale, one that’s filled with surprises around every corner as the main character, Justin Henderson, does his best to deal with the struggles of adolescent life while coming to terms with his emerging powers. Justin’s world is defined by shades of grey as he deals with being bullied at school, death, love and power. With that comes a moral greyness Justin must overcome, ultimately being faced with decisions that will either shape his world for the better, or drown it in darkness.

The Campaign

The first issue of the book is completed and was actually released as Redorik #1 in 2011. The book is also plotted through the fourth issue. Where we need that extra push is finishing the artwork. Series artist Pedro Maia provided his amazing talents in the first installment and we’d love to bring him back to finish our story. The trade as a whole is about 50 per cent done, we just need that “home stretch" push to get this great story that we’re all very passionate about finished and in your hands.

Because we appreciate every donation, no matter if it’s $1 or $1,001,  a single contribution of any dollar amount will guarantee you a spot on our contributors list of donors on the inside pages of the finished trade.  While any amount can be contributed, we do have a number of great perks (or benchmarks) available to you as an extra “thank you” for your help.

The Impact

The economics of the comics business don’t necessarily allow for much success, no matter how dedicated a following a creator has. The Redorik series was such a casualty.  We originally had to put the book on the backburner, but after some soul searching it's one of the books we feel most strongly about and wanted to finish. We have the first issue completed, and the following three issues are completely scripted. Any contributions to the campaign will go toward:

-Finishing the final three issues worth of artwork

-Publishing and printing costs for the new graphic novel

 

Thanks for checking us out, we appreciate it!
