story:
Get ready for the next installment of Richard Boom's instant Kickstarter success, "SISTERHOOD"! Questions answered, secrets revealed! Love, betrayal, Mummies and Monsters and an epic battle - all in ONE intense issue. No nudity, No gore... just loads of fun, amazing art and a story spanning the centuries!

 

INTENTION: SISTERHOOD is a series of one-shot, stand-alone stories. Each  comicbook will feature different artists, to ensure not only a high quality but also creating a platform for outstanding artists. 

ISSUE ONE: the origin issue in which we saw the rising of the Sisterhood, the introduction of the Khepri god/computer and during a new adventure in which the Sisterhoods leader Rand is discovering he is not the only one residing in his own head! You can order this one as an Add-On.

ISSUE TWO: 28 story-pages in a 32-page book, 90 (or 115) grams paper stock! TWO stories, FOUR writers, TWO artists and ONE madman trying to make it into ONE comic!

Synopsis Main Story: Upon returning to his mansion, high-priest Dymonos makes a heart-wrenching discovery that not only lets him question his loyalty towards his master, the mighty god Khepri, but also sets him on a path of righteous revenge and destruction. Then again - sometimes, not all is at it seems. Brace yourselves for love, heartbreak, daddy-issues and all-out mayhem as we dive deeply into the Sisterhood's ancient past and learn how Dymonos became the man/spirit he is today in a yarn we like to call "The Fall of Dymonos: Whom Gods Destroy"!

Synopsis Backup Story: Talah is hunting a human trafficker and taking a stance, like only Talah can. 

Regular by Markus von Renthe-Fink and the variant by Greg Capullo and the variant PENCIL version by Greg Capullo.

 Art from the first 21 page story, by German artist Markus von Renthe-Fink. 

Synopsis: High-Priest Dymonos and his master-god Khepri are tricked in a full-out war, and love is both the cause as well as the key.

21-page story "Fall Of Dymonos", art by Markus v. Renthe-Fink. The art will be fully colored by the end of the project.

Art from the second 7 page back-up story, by Dutch artist Renee Rienties. The art will be grayscaled as seen here.

Synopsis: Talah is hunting a human trafficker.

An overview of all possible rewards, beyond the Regular Cover and the Variant Cover, shown above!

Regular items:

  • Sisterhood #2, digital version
  • Sisterhood #2, cover A Markus von Renthe-Fink
  • Sisterhood #2, cover B Capullo
  • Sisterhood #2, cover C Capullo pencil variant
  • Memorial Trading Card McCaffrey *free*
  • Print by Art Grafunkel
  • Print by Paul McCaffrey
  • Sisterhood #1 > also via Add On available!

You did not get #1 yet? Just ADD-ON the cover you want. Check FAQ about this procedure... it is very easy :)

Unique or limited stuff:

  • Wooden HARD Prints by Adam Brown, Markus von Renthe-Fink
  • Acrylic Glass HARD Print by Paul McCaffrey
  • Canvas HARD Print by Greg Capullo
  • Puzzle with art by Eric Basaldua
  • Calendar 2020
  • Wall Scroll (big!!) by Lucio Parrillo

Artsy Fartsy items: 

  • Artsy-Fartsy: Sisterhood #1 power-covers > Gold, Silver and Lace variant.
  • Original Art: Sketch Cards by Kevin Enhart
  • Original Art NOW by Ralf vd Hoeven > limited spots
  • Original Art NOW by Art Grafunkel > limited spots
  • Original Art NOW by Robin Mies > limited spots
  • Original Art: Cover to #1 by Yonami
  • Original Art: Interior Pages from #1 by Diego Loiola 
  • Original Art: Interior Pages from #2 by Markus von Renthe-Fink

Original Art NOW! Get your personal commission of yuor choice, by (left to right) Art Grafunkel, Robin Mies and/or Ralf van der Hoeven.

Pledge first, then check via Facebook or BAD-website which you want. DIBS via PM :) 

Pledge first, then check via Facebook or BAD-website which you want. DIBS via PM :) 

See pledge level on the right, to see all it entails. And you can be sure I will add even more :) . PS profit of this level will directly go to artist.

RICHARD BOOM: Project Leader/Creator

Richard Boom  started out in the comic industry as your regular fanboy, just reading  comics and enjoying it even more due to the internet and making contact  with creators. As his contact list grew, so did his interest in the  complete field of comic. Starting up a Bad Grrl Comics Fan club in 2001  was the first step to go further then his own living room. Soon  thereafter he began setting up websites for Arthur Suydam, Eric  Basaldua, Broadsword Comics and focussing on titles like Vampirella,  Cavewoman, Hack/Slash and more... He even started working with the FACTS comicon organization where he also met the founder of Broken Frontier and  shortly thereafter began doing headlines for this news site. Later he  founded the website COMICSFORSINNERS which more resembles his prior BadGrrl fanclub. Nowadays Richard  dabbles in Art Agency, sending out comic Press Releases and since 2019 publishing various comic books.

Markus von Renthe-Fink: Story Editor / story 1 penciller

Markus has loved comics and creating art since childhood. His road to creating comic books, though, took several detours. After graduation he had to admit to himself that it would be next to impossible to make a living by drawing comics in Germany, and relocating to the US wasn't really an option, even though at this point his drawing abilities were quite good. So he spent the next 20 years in the dreary profession of a graphics deisgner. It took a pep talk from fan-favorite artist Greg Capullo during a book signing in Frankfurt to get Markus back on track; after being told that in the meantime, the "bullpens" at the publishers had ceased to exist: all you needed nowadays to break into comics were talent, a scanner and an internet connection. With newfound enthusiasm, determined to take the comic book world by storm (or, failing that, a gentle breeze), Markus set out to find a partner-in-crime - enter Richard Boom, who was happy to take Markus aboard. Initially (and rather inadvertently) he took on the role of story editor, trying to bring some sort of order and continuity to she sprawling wealth of material that represented the "Sisterhood" universe. Hungry to get his teeth into the actual creation of art, he took the script for a 10-page story apart at the seams (with the blessing of original author Viktor Kruithof) and hammered it into a full-length comic book story. These pages will see print as Sisterhood #2 sometime in the spring of 2020, and, as life sometimes comes full-circle, will feature a variant cover by none other than Greg Capullo.

Renee Rienties: story 2 penciller

Renee Rienties is an independent comic artist from the Netherlands.                She made her start in the world of comics in 2016 with her smallpress book “My Daily Life Comics” which was received well by her readers online and at comic conventions.                In 2017 her art took a dark turn, from funny cute gag comics to creepy bloody horror. Here she worked on a story in “Oyasumi” A manga collaboration she started with two fellow artists. Where she drew her comic “Distortia”  Her creepy art will leave a chilling impression for you to remember.                In 2018 she worked on a chilling short story in the “Hollandsch Manga” anthology series made by various Dutch artists.                If mystery, thriller and horror are your thing, then you have something to look forward to. Right now Renee is working on a new chilling book that will come out end of 2019.               

GUEST ARTISTS:

RALF VAN DER HOEVEN is an autodidact if you ever seen one. Hailing from the Netherlands, he is a well-received artist in the fantasy- and comic-community.

After doing illustration work for Valkyrie and Artvlam he started a company with the Belgian Dominiek Vermandere called Lakoro. With Dominiek he's co-owner and creator of the new comicbook series for all ages named: Troltrol. (www.troltrol.be)

The first dutch book was recently published and is available.

Besides that Ralf fills his time making several variant covers for Dark Dragon Books (The dutch-translated Deadpool and Lady Mechanika).

His dream of creating an original comicbook of his own is taking shape in his free time and besides that he's putting together his first ever fantasy artbook via Dutch Publisher Dark Dragon Books Art Collection.

ART GRAFUNKEL is designer by day, doodlemonkey by night, Belgian Waffle by birth, and nerdy by nature.

His  geeky artwork has been featured in VISIONS FROM THE UPSIDE DOWN: A  STRANGER THINGS ARTBOOK (Del Rey), TRANSMETROPOLITAN: ALL AROUND THE  WORLD (CBLDF), WORMWOOD: GENTLEMAN CORPSE (IDW) and he's doodled  sketchcards for STAR WARS GALAXY and MARS ATTACKS (Topps). He is a comicon-regular and brings smiles to folks he knows as well as folks he does not...          He also thinks it's pretty pretentious, writing all of this third person.

ROBIN MIES is a Dutch illustrator, sketch card and comic artist.

In recent years he has made various sketch card sets under his own management, but he has also been able to draw for, among others, Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy vol. 2 and Thor: Ragnarok. Partly because of this, his illustrated blank covers are becoming increasingly popular.

Hungry to get his teeth into the actual creation of art, he took the script for a 10-page story apart at the seams (with the blessing of original author Viktor Kruithof) and hammered it into a full-length comic book story. These pages will see print as Sisterhood #2 sometime in the spring of 2020, and, as life sometimes comes full-circle, will feature a variant cover by none other than Greg Capullo.Renee Rienties: story 2 pencillerRenee Rienties is an independent comic artist from the Netherlands.                She made her start in the world of comics in 2016 with her smallpress book “My Daily Life Comics” which was received well by her readers online and at comic conventions.                In 2017 her art took a dark turn, from funny cute gag comics to creepy bloody horror. Here she worked on a story in “Oyasumi” A manga collaboration she started with two fellow artists. Where she drew her comic “Distortia”  Her creepy art will leave a chilling impression for you to remember.                In 2018 she worked on a chilling short story in the “Hollandsch Manga” anthology series made by various Dutch artists.                If mystery, thriller and horror are your thing, then you have something to look forward to. Right now Renee is working on a new chilling book that will come out end of 2019.               GUEST ARTISTS:RALF VAN DER HOEVEN is an autodidact if you ever seen one. Hailing from the Netherlands, he is a well-received artist in the fantasy- and comic-community.After doing illustration work for Valkyrie and Artvlam he started a company with the Belgian Dominiek Vermandere called Lakoro. With Dominiek he's co-owner and creator of the new comicbook series for all ages named: Troltrol. (www.troltrol.be)The first dutch book was recently published and is available.Besides that Ralf fills his time making several variant covers for Dark Dragon Books (The dutch-translated Deadpool and Lady Mechanika).His dream of creating an original comicbook of his own is taking shape in his free time and besides that he's putting together his first ever fantasy artbook via Dutch Publisher Dark Dragon Books Art Collection.ART GRAFUNKEL is designer by day, doodlemonkey by night, Belgian Waffle by birth, and nerdy by nature.His  geeky artwork has been featured in VISIONS FROM THE UPSIDE DOWN: A  STRANGER THINGS ARTBOOK (Del Rey), TRANSMETROPOLITAN: ALL AROUND THE  WORLD (CBLDF), WORMWOOD: GENTLEMAN CORPSE (IDW) and he's doodled  sketchcards for STAR WARS GALAXY and MARS ATTACKS (Topps). He is a comicon-regular and brings smiles to folks he knows as well as folks he does not...          He also thinks it's pretty pretentious, writing all of this third person.ROBIN MIES is a Dutch illustrator, sketch card and comic artist.In recent years he has made various sketch card sets under his own management, but he has also been able to draw for, among others, Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy vol. 2 and Thor: Ragnarok. Partly because of this, his illustrated blank covers are becoming increasingly popular.

story:
Replicator #2

All Physical Backers Get 2 Prints And Wax Sealed Packaging FREE.

 

 

 

New Reward!!

  • REPLICATOR 1 Standard and Variant Comics
  • REPLICATOR 2 Standard and Variant Comics
  • REPLICATOR 2- Limited Art Edition Comic (no text, wraparound cover 15 only.)
  • 10 Art Prints(A4, 8.27 × 11.69inches)
  • 1 Giant "River of Corpses" print (A3, 11.69 x 16.53inches)
  • All the Digital

5 comics, 11 art prints, delivered in wax-sealed packaging.

 

 

 

 

REPLICATOR IS NOT a story for kids, it's violent, gory and has nudity and adult themes, people die often and horrifically.  If you are looking for a comic for your kids this is not it.

Replicator is a post-apocalyptic sci-fi comic series set in England 10 years from now after a virus has killed tens of millions and as the country crumbles two companies fight for power using futuristic mechs and soldiers battle against super-powered mutants...

This series has been created from someone who has been raised on Judge Dredd, Japanese anime and X-men cartoons and with Replicator, we blend them all together in a violent and unforgiving and twisted way.

Issue 1 and 2 of Replicator was successfully funded through Kickstarter. With over 500 backers we were able to print beautiful high-quality comics. 

Variant Wrap Around Cover #2

 

  • REPLICATOR 1 AND 2 ARE A COMBINED 60 PAGES.-You will get both copies with this project. We currently have 5 different covers.
  • REPLICATOR #1 IS A GIGANTIC 32 PAGES. Printed on high-quality paper.
  • REPLICATOR #2 IS A MASSIVE 28 PAGES. Printed on high-quality paper.
  • REPLICATOR 1 AND 2 HAVE BEEN PRINTED AND SHIPPED which means that when this project gets funded we will be able to send out your copy straight away.

  • http://sodaandtelepaths.com/comic-review-replicator-2/

story:
CHROMOSOME 96

A group of scientists give hunt to an anthropomorphic virus, that mutated and escaped from one of their bold experiments. Aided by an array of exotic and lethal beings the clock is ticking not only for the geneticists, but as the virus becomes ever more powerful, for the whole of Mankind.

But there's much more behind all this. It's no mere cat & mouse chase.

The action is relentless. The fun unparalleled. The drama with twists and turns you'll never see coming. 

Characters you will love.

A story you'll never forget!

 

BUT WHAT EXACTLY IS IT? 

CHROMOSOME 96 is a comic. A mini-series of six issues. The sci-fi movies of the 50's and pulp comix from the 60's have inspired this narrative. There's the brainy scientists, each with a particular agenda. The army, with their constant internal battles. And cannon fodder warrior creatures that pack a lot of heat and might surprise you as to what they actually are and do.

This campaign goes straight to the point: it offers the first 3 issues, in full colors with premium paper and print quality.

All together you get 75 pages of adventure. Bagged and back boarded. 

There will also be a fun sticker sheet, amazing bookmarks and 3 beautiful prints from covers art.

To make it simple there's only one perk. 

The books are pratically finished and copies will print in January 2020, to be shipped and arrive at your home by February.

 

 

My name is Miguel Ferreira. Also known as Lewis Michael. I've been working in indie comics for almost three decades. Writting, creating the art, and self-publishing. Maybe you had a chance to check out some of my previous work (if you were an avid reader of ashcans and fanzines back in the 90's) in titles such as El Chupa-Cabras and Tough Guys. I've remained fiercely independent throughout, with my books reflecting that. No editorial/corporate control of any kind. 

With CHROMOSOME 96 I really wanted to go all out and bring you a homage to the world of comics itself. Each issue stands on its own, with its own pacing, stylistic approach, plus remarkable contributions of top colorist talent such as Ross A Campbell (Pathfinder, Jirni), Ander Zarate (Transformers, JLA) and Lielz Buenaventura (Grimm's Fairy Tales, Stabbity Bunny). While I wrote the story and did the lines.

For these first 3 issues all art is finished and we are in the last stages of colors and lettering. After that is straigh to print. No major delays are expected.

I'm sure you'll go crazy about this saga and surely come back for the second part of the series, with the next 3 issues. Sometime in a not-so-far future.

Your support means everything. This book will only be in print if youself, and others like you, dig what you see. And when you support this campaign you wont be doing it just for me. You'll be helping all independent creators, that plow through in sweat and blood, everyday and every night, free from the shackles of overbearing brands with indoctrinating agendas.

So have at it! One perk only. Three books and some goodies to go with them. Worldwide delivery. 

 

Thanks for your time!

story:
Newly minted heroes must learn to adapt to their new lives while attempting to take down a deadly human trafficking ring!

Hybrids: The Sons of Gods -  Volume 1 - "Trash Day" is a 128 page graphic novel that combines the 5 issue mini series, the Saraphina expansion story, and an exclusive "end credits" story into a single volume with bonus content from the creator.

 

  • All work for the 128 pages is complete and ready to be printed!

 

Terraform Comics Founders have successfully funded and fulfilled more than 25 campaigns!

Join the hundreds of others who have joined in on the story and the Hybrids Universe.  There will be exclusive covers by Caanan White and Bryan Dawson, as  well as the first access to the production copy of the H:SoG Role Playing Game QUICK PLAY!

Who will like this series?

Hybrids is an action/adventure story set around the advent of a new super human species.  It includes theories surrounding the NEPHILIM and ANCIENT ALIENS set against a fast paced rescue attempt.  This series will appeal to you if you like the following...

Superheroes
Obscure History
Greek Mythology
Nephilim
Conspiracy Theories
Religious Lore
Movies like "Taken"

 

vvvv LEARN MORE HERE vvvv

 

Standard Cover

HOLOFOIL Cover

Cover C - INKS

The Goal:
Bringing H:SoG Volume 1 to Terraform Comics is an exciting opportunity to get the story into as many hands as possible.  It is our goal to expand the audience of Hybrids and we need your help to do that.  By putting the entire collection of floppies and extra content into 1 volume, we are able to give old and new fans alike an opportunity to see inside the process and enjoy the  universe we have built!

Funding will go to cover the printing and distribution of this Trade Paperback Edition do Hybrids: The Sons of Gods "Trash Day".

Like, Share, and Pledge!  

Reward Tiers:

The Story So Far...
A brief look at what Hybrids: The Sons of Gods really is. 

 

Not the Typical Superheroes...

There are no magic hammers or vats of toxic chemicals that produce these heroes.  Rather, the origin of our HYBRIDS can find it's roots in several major religions.  The book of Genesis talks about a monumental event in the 6th chapter when it recounts the "Sons of God" coming to Earth and finding the daughters of men to be attractive.  These attractions lead to unholy unions that produce a human/angel HYBRID called the Nephilim.

Stories of the Nephilim predate the Greek Gods by several hundred years and many scholars believe that the stories of Zuess and the other gods where just exagerations of true stories about these Nephilim.

Imagine that these accounts are all true and not only did these creatures exist, but they continued to reproduce with humans.  Eventually these Nephilim traits and abilities would subside, but the genetic code would still remain.  What if walking around us right now we had the real life ancestors of the Greek Gods?  What if something were to happen to cause these recessive Nephilim traits to wake up?

In Hybrids: The Sons of Gods, that is exactly what happens.  People begin to develop God-like abilities seemingly out of nowhere.  This however, is not the whole story.  Just as quickly as these individuals begin to develop these fantastical powers, they also start to vanish.  All that is known is that they are being taken.

We follow a band of intrepid heroes who seek the answers to 3 questions.  Who is taking these people, where are they taking these people, and why are they taking these people.

Very personal connections fuel this endoevour as we descover corporate greed, human trafficking rings, and genetic experimentation at the root of this new epidemic.

Stretch Goals

$8k - 12 more pages of content from guest creators

$10K - Every physical backer get copy of the H:SoG RPG Quick Play and it gets unlocked as an add-on perk.

Backer Goals

75 - Add Chlorine Chibi to the sticker pack

100 -Add Bone Chibi to the sticker pack

150 - Add ION Chibi to the sticker pack

First Sticker to UNLOCK

Second Sticker to be UNLOCKED

 

Third Sticker to be UNLOCKED

story:
Hey there.

It's Blake. I'm the creator and writer of "The Saga of Evil Monkey Man!"  I can hardly tell you how thankful I am for all the support we've had over the last few years for this crazy monkey project. As many of you know, it has literally been years in the making. From the New York Comic Con down to MegaCon Orlando we've met so many supportive folks, and here online we're approaching 4,000 followers! It is truly magical to be able to make Frank's song, and my characters, come to life.

Where we're at now is completing what I'm calling "Season One." It's the first four of twelve "episodes" of "The Saga of Evil Monkey Man!"  The story and most of the (over 80 pages) of art are done - so we're turning once again to you...family, friends & fans to help fund the printing of the individual issues, as well as our first trade paperback (which collects all four stories into one larger book.) Once we have actual physical copies, I can and will travel from city to city promoting Evil Monkey Man.

We can't do all this without you. Your contributions literally make this happen.

What We Need & What You Get.

We're looking to raise at least $500.00 in order to print enough copies of issues 2-4 as well as the trade. Any additional monies will simply mean more copies for more promotion. With all of this, eventually Evil Monkey Man will become a household name - and it all started and starts right here - with  you.

This time around we have a couple of really exciting, exclusive perks to share, including a signed print to accompany the trade paperback. Series artist Butch Mapa literally traveled all the way from the Philippines just to sign these prints! (Actually, he was in town to visit family and attend a wedding, but for the purposes of this campaign, we'll go with he came here to sign these prints story. And, by the way, these are Butch's first-ever signed prints!) We'll also be offering an exclusive poster, as well as original art by myself, and Russ Braun (who has drawn for Disney, DC & Marvel in addition to, and perhaps most famously for, the new Amazon TV series "The Boys.") And for those hardcore fans among you - you can actually get drawn into one or more upcoming episodes!

The Impact.

"The Saga of Evil Monkey Man"  is a really cool, all-ages comic book (if I don't say so myself) based on the FL!NG Lo!S tune by Frank. It's got all the elements of those classic adventures that we either grew up with or are now enjoying on the big screen and TV. Lovable, relatable characters on a quest, helping our main protagonist Mike find his way back to being human. It's a time-traveling reality-bending romp, criss-crossing North America with innumerable easter-eggs and some esoteric surprises. And you need a few copies. I'm sure of it.

This will be our second (and hopefully second successful) campaign for Evil Monkey Man along with successful campaigns for Witch Hunter and The Last. Under the Monarch Comics imprint we've been selling out at conventions and later this year we will be distributed to BAM! (Books-A-Million.) But again, it all starts here, with your contribution. These campaigns not only give us the seed money to get going - they get you copies from early short print runs, exclusive collectibles, and of course, future bragging rights.

Incentive Perk!

When we hit the $500.00 funding goal - every backer will be offered a custom recording of Evil Monkey Man to be used as your outgoing voicemail - this means Mike (the Evil Monkey Man, as performed by Chuck Carbonaro) will actually answer your phone for you, and invite callers to leave a message!

Risks & Challenges.

Like I mentioned, the story and most of the art is already complete. Once this campaign is funded, print sourcing, printing and shipping is all we need to do, and we're doing that on a pretty regular basis at this point. So barring unforeseen tragedy, if we raise the funds we'll print the books. :)

Other Ways You Can Help.

I understand some folks just can't contribute right now, I get it, but that doesn't mean you can't help - get the word out and make some (monkey) noises about our campaign - share it with somebody who may be interested. Ingiegogo has sharing tools built right in - feel free to use 'em please and thank you!

Once again, thank you all for all of your support. It's so much fun to be able to work on this, and work with Frank & Butch. Thank your time and consideration.

STRETCH GOAL PERK

Hey folks! We reached our initial goal - thank you! When/if we reach $750.00 everyone will also get two previously unreleased promo postcards, all five promo business card-sized prints, and a new Evil Monkey Meme sticker! So spread the word - we have a few days to hit our new mark!
story_txt:
Hey there.
It's Blake. I'm the creator and writer of "The Saga of Evil Monkey Man!"  I can hardly tell you how thankful I am for all the support we've had over the last few years for this crazy monkey project. As many of you know, it has literally been years in the making. From the New York Comic Con down to MegaCon Orlando we've met so many supportive folks, and here online we're approaching 4,000 followers! It is truly magical to be able to make Frank's song, and my characters, come to life.
Where we're at now is completing what I'm calling "Season One." It's the first four of twelve "episodes" of "The Saga of Evil Monkey Man!"  The story and most of the (over 80 pages) of art are done - so we're turning once again to you...family, friends & fans to help fund the printing of the individual issues, as well as our first trade paperback (which collects all four stories into one larger book.) Once we have actual physical copies, I can and will travel from city to city promoting Evil Monkey Man.
We can't do all this without you. Your contributions literally make this happen.


What We Need & What You Get.
We're looking to raise at least $500.00 in order to print enough copies of issues 2-4 as well as the trade. Any additional monies will simply mean more copies for more promotion. With all of this, eventually Evil Monkey Man will become a household name - and it all started and starts right here - with  you.
This time around we have a couple of really exciting, exclusive perks to share, including a signed print to accompany the trade paperback. Series artist Butch Mapa literally traveled all the way from the Philippines just to sign these prints! (Actually, he was in town to visit family and attend a wedding, but for the purposes of this campaign, we'll go with he came here to sign these prints story. And, by the way, these are Butch's first-ever signed prints!) We'll also be offering an exclusive poster, as well as original art by myself, and Russ Braun (who has drawn for Disney, DC & Marvel in addition to, and perhaps most famously for, the new Amazon TV series "The Boys.") And for those hardcore fans among you - you can actually get drawn into one or more upcoming episodes!


The Impact.
"The Saga of Evil Monkey Man"  is a really cool, all-ages comic book (if I don't say so myself) based on the FL!NG Lo!S tune by Frank. It's got all the elements of those classic adventures that we either grew up with or are now enjoying on the big screen and TV. Lovable, relatable characters on a quest, helping our main protagonist Mike find his way back to being human. It's a time-traveling reality-bending romp, criss-crossing North America with innumerable easter-eggs and some esoteric surprises. And you need a few copies. I'm sure of it.
This will be our second (and hopefully second successful) campaign for Evil Monkey Man along with successful campaigns for Witch Hunter and The Last. Under the Monarch Comics imprint we've been selling out at conventions and later this year we will be distributed to BAM! (Books-A-Million.) But again, it all starts here, with your contribution. These campaigns not only give us the seed money to get going - they get you copies from early short print runs, exclusive collectibles, and of course, future bragging rights.
Incentive Perk!
When we hit the $500.00 funding goal - every backer will be offered a custom recording of Evil Monkey Man to be used as your outgoing voicemail - this means Mike (the Evil Monkey Man, as performed by Chuck Carbonaro) will actually answer your phone for you, and invite callers to leave a message!


Risks & Challenges.
Like I mentioned, the story and most of the art is already complete. Once this campaign is funded, print sourcing, printing and shipping is all we need to do, and we're doing that on a pretty regular basis at this point. So barring unforeseen tragedy, if we raise the funds we'll print the books. :)


Other Ways You Can Help.
I understand some folks just can't contribute right now, I get it, but that doesn't mean you can't help - get the word out and make some (monkey) noises about our campaign - share it with somebody who may be interested. Ingiegogo has sharing tools built right in - feel free to use 'em please and thank you!
Once again, thank you all for all of your support. It's so much fun to be able to work on this, and work with Frank & Butch. Thank your time and consideration.
STRETCH GOAL PERK

Hey folks! We reached our initial goal - thank you! When/if we reach $750.00 everyone will also get two previously unreleased promo postcards, all five promo business card-sized prints, and a new Evil Monkey Meme sticker! So spread the word - we have a few days to hit our new mark!

story:
England. 1941. In its darkest hour Britain's most legendary hero will return. But this time he's a she.  And before she can save an empire, she has to find herself. And the true nature of love. But she better do it fast. Because this time she is not just saving England. She is saving the World...

BE ENTERTAINED AND SUPPORT PEOPLE IN NEED! 20% OF OUR PROCEEDS WILL BE CONTRIBUTED TO CHARITY.  10% to CURE (Citizens United for Research in Epilepsy) and 10% to the  International Autoimmune Encephalitis Society. 

WHAT ARE THE RISKS YOU ASK? NONE. As with all Mythographer's Workshop launches, THE WORK IS ALREADY COMPLETED.  All we need is the number of backers and how many runs we need to print! Well, we suppose there is a risk we could get a hernia hauling all the backer kits out if this is as successful as we hope, but that is up to you guys! 

SO WHO ARE YOU ANYWAY?  We are Mythographer's Workshop, a small press indie publisher. All of our work is completed by some of comic's finest professional artists, colorists, and letterers. Our last work (which you can still pick up as part of our PERKS!!), TIR NA FUIL won an INDEPENDENT PUBLISHERS BOOK AWARD  in 2017 alongside STAN LEE and WILLIAM SHATNER. 

Once and Future will be presented in 130 pages of beautiful full color art on heavy high gloss paper, each signed by the author. TAKE A TEST FLIGHT BELOW...

story:
About Hero Nation

Hero Nation–Ypsilanti was inspired by:

  • The need for more visibility for everyday heroes and positive people 
  • The need for more diverse and intersectional safe spaces in the Ypsilanti community
  • The need for opportunities for people to experience self-empowerment
  • The chance to give back to the community through partnerships with local non-profits and charities

We also want to create an environment where learning and creativity can flourish. So, we'll be providing:

  • Free comic books to help increase youth literacy
  • Various youth workshops for kids and teenagers
  • Free vendor spaces for aspiring young artists  

It's imperative that Hero Nation serves as a platform for diverse artists, youth and community leaders. By supporting this campaign, you help start a new legacy in the Ypsilanti community that we believe will change lives and continue to expand while having a lasting impact on this city.

In addition to offering an empowering and inclusive experience, Hero Nation will also offer:

  • Free arcade games
  • Free console gaming
  • Free workshops
  • Free film screening
  • Free school supplies
  • Free Guest performances
  • Artists Exhibitions
  • And more

The Hero Nation Team

The Hero Nation team consists of community leaders, educators, activists and professionals who wholeheartedly believe in empowering the Ypsi community and uplifting marginalized voices. 

Check out the Hero Nation team as they answer these important questions: 

What Does Being a Superhero Mean to You?

 
What does representation mean to you? 
 
 
Video content by Better Planet Media.

What We Need 

We want Hero Nation to be a fun, educational, family-friendly experience. However, we need your support to help make this happen. In addition to collaborating with various community and state-wide partners to host inspiring performances, workshops, exhibitions and exciting entertainment, we’ll need your help raising $3500 for the following:

  • Special Guest Appearances
  • Entertainment
  • Venue
  • Permits
  • Print Advertisement
  • Promo Videos

All leftover funds will go towards Hero Nation community workshops, youth programs, local charities, and next year’s event.

The Impact

Ultimately, Hero Nation is more than an event—it’s a movement. Moving forward, we will continue to create year-round programming for youth that centers superheroes and self-empowerment. We’ll also continue to collaborate with local non-profits and charities like the Ozone House, Bright Futures and the YMCA to spread the message that there’s a hero in us all.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Because Hero Nation is a first year event, one of the largest challenges we’re facing is getting more visibility. We want the entire community to know that this is a space for everyone. Also, because this is a grassroots initiative, much of what we’ve done so far has come from our personal budgets. We truly believe in this cause and will do all that we can to ensure that it is successful.

Call For Artists

Hero Nation seeks to empower diverse creative voices. If you're an artist interested in vending at the event, register TODAY at https://www.heronationypsi.com.

Other Ways You Can Support

Can't donate? That's OK. Here are other ways you can help:

  • Share and spread the word about the campaign on your social media. 
  • Follow us on Facebook and Instagram.
  • Tell us what you think about Hero Nation. 
  • If you have any questions, contact us at heronationypsilanti@gmail.com.

 

Thank you for your support.

story:
Gurukitty Studios is a small but determined comic duo that creates and self publishes our own stories as well as anthologies.



Our Anthologies were originally started when talking to other artists who were troubled by the fact that they didn’t have enough work to make a full book and wanted ways to promote themselves and have things to sell on their convention tables while they worked on bigger projects. Gurukitty Studios also had a similar issue, having lots of projects on the go, but producing nothing in the meantime, we wanted some nice looking books and we wanted to help out the other creators who were also looking for an outlet.


The answer was anthology projects and how they work is, anyone can contributes a completed story, we jury them and  select some awesome ones. We then collect them in a book where the Gurukitty duo also add a story each to keep our skills sharp!

Finally, we hold a cover contest to have another (or one of the contributors) artist (perhaps an aspiring cover illustrator) have an opportunity to get their work out there.

Artists are compensated with comp copies of the book as well as the ability to buy additional copies at wholesale to sell at their convention tables for profit.

It costs us a lot of money to produce these anthologies, and we are not well off by any means, we are hard working, self published comic artists just doing our best to get out there like everyone else and we work full time jobs on the side as well.  We need funds to buy the compensation copies for artists, mail them out to artists all over the world, additional copies for promotional giveaways, as well as stock to sell at local conventions. We also have to do a lot of marketing and promotional things to help get the book noticed which also costs money.

The anthologies are also a lot of work to put together, coordinating all the files and people, editing the files to fit to the specifications (we’re talking 100’s of files), making the covers, adding tables of contents, credits and additional pages, registering ISBN and getting barcodes…

the list goes on.

The end goal is that the contributors (including us!) now have some published work to use for portfolios, promotion and to sell for profit.



Cover Illustration by Jason Hart.

Our newest anthology, Gateways to Beyond, is what we are currently raising money for to publish, is Science Fiction themed.

This book contains 23 Black and white stories by artists all over the world, during the course of this campaign we will be showing samples from each story to show the variety of art styles and stories that will be contained within. You can already see many samples on our Facebook page!

If you have followed our other anthologies you'll know that each time we want to take It up a notch and go a little farther. With Gateways to Beyond we were more selective with the artwork and lettering but we are also going to take the distribution and marketing to the next level as well.

Below is a detailed breakdown of our plans for the funds:



$535 Studio stock of books for conventions

$165 Comp copies for artists and contributors

$400 shipping (could be more)


So the minimum we need to raise is  $1100.00 to just print the book and fulfill the artist copies.

Once that’s done, any additional funds would be funneled into marketing/distribution.


$250-500 Project wonderful AD campaign


We want to launch an ad campaign for Gateways to Beyond on relevant sites through project wonderful, that will also increase the traffic to our website to generate revenue from our ad space as well. The Idea is that we will have this bank of project wonderful money to start off with and,  hopefully, we can sell ad space on our own site to continue the cycle of money without the need to refill it.  That will take a large chunk of money at first to get the traffic we need right away.


after that we’d like to look further into other venues for sales:

Amazon listing

Diamond (or other) distribution


Any and all extra funds gained after the project wonderful stretch goals would go into distribution of any kind. Amazon would be one of the ones we'd like to do, and we would like to try and get Gateways to Beyond as well as the other anthologies into some bookstore and comic shops. We've looked into some distributors as well, but they are super expensive, so that would be something we would look more into if we had the funds to make it possible. 


So that's it in a nutshell!


We will be posting sample comic pages and other content during the course of the campaign! If you have any questions please feel free to ask away!

story:
About This Project

My name is Jordyn F. Bochon. I'm an artist and filmmaker currently residing in Halifax, Nova Scotia. A long time in the making, The Terrible Death of Finnegan Strappe is the macabre story of one man's self destructive, occult journey to utter ruin told through a veil of humor, gore, and glamour. This project is a labor of love, spanning several years. With this fundraiser I hope to self-publish the first three issues and get my work out to a larger audience. I've been publishing my own comics for years because I am passionate about what I do and can't imagine doing it any other way. 


A new online comic starring Finnegan Strappe can be seen here: http://finnegan.8et8.net/

My portfolio site: http://8et8.net



Why Indie Gogo?

It's quite a feat to create comics, and it's another one altogether to fund them. The reality is, I'm not able to bring together the funds I need to do this on my own. I'm hopeful that there are enough people out there who have been enjoying my work for free over the past several years who may also be interested in investing in it's evolution. By investing in this project, you become an important part of it.



What We Need & What You Get

The goal is to raise $2500, which would prominently go towards printing three 8.5x11" issues. This is a large format comic, very satisfying to read, and full of work unavailable anywhere else. In addition to this, I'm trying to get my comics to wider audience by bringing them to events in the US (first time ever). Conventions in the future include SPX in Bethesda, MD and MIX in Minneapolis, MN. This fundraiser will help make this happen!


Everyone who contributes will be included in the credits and thank yous of each issue. The more you donate to the cause the more you receive in turn! Not only will you be able to look forward to receiving three separate stories in the mail, but you will also be rewarded with a variety of treasures befitting the contribution.  There are limited edition screen-prints, Terrible Death tote bags, original art, and even a personalized adventure comic starring you and any of my characters of your choosing!!


Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help me by spreading the word far and wide! The more people come to see this pitch, the bigger chance it has of making it! To make the goal I would only need 100 people to donate $25! That's not a lot! Any help you can offer to my cause is deeply appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

ABSOLUTE book 1 is a 46page black and white adventure taking place in a time after an alien invasion where they rule the world. A group of accidental heroes are thrust into their unknown destiny that tests their will and self worth. Join the tale today!

It's a time after the alien invaders known as the Onvi have overthrown the planet.

A lone traveler and bounty hunter will seek the ultimate prize.

 

And a rebellious woman is set out to seek her destiny.

Will they be able to take down the evil overlords with the help of others?

or will they fail!?

Stretch Goals

2.500 Unhinged Entertainment logo stickers! - Unlocked!

5k Every backer will get a trading card by veteran comic artist and creator of Black Flag DAN FRAGA! FragaBOOM!- UNLOCKED!

6k - More Stickers! - UNLOCKED!

7,500 - Unhinged Entertainment Patch! - UNLOCKED!

9k - Bonus for the editor!

Main Cover

Variant Cover

The insert poster

Absolute Valkyrie trading card

 

Samurai Priest trading card by DAN FRAGA!

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking for enough that will allow us to continue to make great comics for everyone! The projected fixed goal is what it will be to print and ship the books. We would like this to be a full time gig to pump out future projects (which we have many in mind!) and to also give you the reader more stories that you want.

We hope to offer great perks provided the funding goes well. The book is black and white and one goal would be to make it color if we get there. Updates will be added! Thank you very much!

 

The Impact

We hope to bring you something fun and unique that you'll talk about and be entertained by and to spark that love for comics that seems to have run a little stale to us the past few years.

Risks & Challenges

It's a fixed goal so if it doesn't get funded, we don't keep your money and if it's successful you'll get a great product with hopefully some great perks! We know shipping seems daunting and hope it doesn't detour you.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't back it you can help us by sharing our link and spread the word of ABSOLUTE!

And that's all there is to it.

It's a fixed goal so if it doesn't get funded, we don't keep your money and if it's successful you'll get a great product with hopefully some great perks! We know shipping seems daunting and hope it doesn't detour you.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you don't back it you can help us by sharing our link and spread the word of ABSOLUTE!
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Michael Oden, and I want to thank you for your interest in Elysian Fields. Right off the bat, I want to establish what it is we are hoping to create here. This Zero Issue will serve as an EXCLUSIVE COLLECTOR'S ITEM for its supporters, as this project is being used to move the overall series forward. This edition of this book that will be released for this campaign will have a very nice, CARD STOCK COVER WITH FOIL STAMP, AND WILL INCLUDE 30+ PAGES OF STORY AND ARTWORK. This project is something that's been going around my head since High School, and it's something very special to me. Born out of a love for mythology, the idea of a deathmatch style tournament between legendary heroes of old was always something that I wanted, no, needed to bring to life. 

After years of this idea circling around I finally made a script for a first issue, and I found a fantastic artist in Marcelo Oliveira Costa (portfolio included at the bottom of the summary) who is really kicking ass in bringing this vision to life, and with the Main Line in the state that it's in and the ongoing quarantine from Covid 19, I figured it would be best if we went the crowdfunding route. Anyways, without further ado, I present Elysian Fields:

Achilles fought with a fiery rage for glory during his short life when he arrived in the underworld and reunited with his beloved comrade Patroclus, he thought he could finally spend eternity enjoying the things he missed out on in life. This was not the case, after a momentary reunion the Best of the Greeks was ferried away to an amphitheater where he was to fight alongside other heroes of his world: Herakles and Theseus, for the God Hades to regain his dominion over the underworld. With the world’s pantheons expanding, and past pantheons crumbling, Hades is willing to grant Achilles his greatest desire.


Marcelo’s Portfolio: https://marcoliverpenciler.wixsite.com/portifolio

Page 1: Pencils/inks/ Colors




 

Page 2: Pencils/Inks/ Colors


 

 

Page 3: Pencils/ Inks/ Colors


 


 

 

Page 4&5: 

 

 


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The goal here is to publish this Zero issue to do a few things: 1. gauge public interest, 2. deliver a quality product for our consumer, 3. Raise enough to not only fund this book but to put money aside to invest in the future of this series and our new Independent Brand: 9 Realms Publishing. I have Reset the flex goal to 7,000 to make sure we hit it, but I do think we can still hit that 10,000 and as a result provide a majority of the funds for the next book as well!
  • There will be 4 perk tiers to start off: 1. Single issue: $10, 2. Double Trouble: $20, 3. Single Issue Deluxe: $15, 4. Double Trouble Deluxe: $25. Deluxe editions will include signatures from me! However, as publicity grows, and we gain traction, more tiers may become available.

The Impact

The impact of this campaign is simple. It has become very difficult for people with both passion and talent to get involved in this industry. I remember growing up where both companies were readily accessible for fans to pitch ideas and concepts in monthly writing contests, and submissions. However, with COVID 19 crippling the mainline after years of lackluster sales, the time for independent, crowdfunding creators is now. We can revolutionize this market together, and with the success of this book will come the rise of my own publishing company: 9 Realms Publishing. While it is a very pretentious and overused quote, Gandhi once said: "Be the Change you want to see in the world." This is the change I want for the industry, quality content written by people who care, so I am going to be it. 

Risks & Challenges

Obviously, the biggest risk and challenge here is failure. This is our first time trying to make a comic, with that, comes the hurdle of anonymity. I don't have a name, my artist has a portfolio and some fantastic art, but is not an industry legend that has made waves. So how are we going to combat this, the answer is aggressive marketing and, well, you.

  • With connections, I have made through networking online for the past 4 years and as an Industry News writer, I have several connections on multiple social media platforms for nerd pages. 
  • The plan will be to reach out to my various contacts, comic stores, and hell even people I haven't talked to that have massive youtube and social media followings, and promote this campaign as much as possible! And then there is what I am relying on you for because it's so much more than just money. 

Other Ways You Can Help

While contributing is awesome and I super appreciate it if you do, but there is a much bigger way you can help. A way that goes so far beyond the monetary support. Share this campaign around, the more the merrier and the faster we can get this book to you the consumer. With this campaign's success will come more of these stories, and we want more than anything for you to experience them! So please if you could:

  • Share this link on any and all social media platforms, send it to your friends that you think will be interested. This is our greatest weapon in combatting our struggle of anonymity.
  • If you are a part of a media outlet or run a Youtube channel, or know anyone that does either, please reach out to me on here and I'll be happy to do interviews!

story:
******August 18th: We’re funded! Thanks, everyone for your help! Late to the game? You can still donate!******

--------------

As the founder of OCF, I am personally taking on the financial responsibility to make sure this event happens. Though we are trying to get sponsors (please sponsor us!) there are costs associated with paying talent that I just can’t do alone. I have worked with performers for many years and I know there is nothing worse than expecting an artist to work for free.

Our goal is to pay every performer, cover venue fees, and make sure the marketing is ON POINT.  This fundraising goal will ensure we can cover costs that have already arisen, the remaining will come from ticket sales and sponsorships we hope to receive.

We are aiming to raise at least $2500.00, which will act as seed funding to cover costs for talent and venue fees. All other projected expenses will be covered by ticket sales. No matter how much we raise, this funding will be used to pay the talent.

------

If you can't donate you can:

1. Share this with others.

2. Follow us on IG + FB @oaklandcomedyfest

3. Buy a ticket(s)!

story:
Galaxafreaks will eat your brain!

Then chew it up and spit it out in a reconstructed mind-freak! Trust me, you'll feel better for it!

*****STOP PRESS******

Sorry, just to make it clear....All perks come with a copy of Galaxafreaks Issue 3

***********

Welcome back space-siblings! Hot on the heels of the stellar success of Galaxafreaks Issues 1 & 2 comes the pre-order freakout for No:3! More freaky art, pyschedelic nonsense and quantum story fun!

My name is Andrew Pawley, I'm a pencil squeezer based on the South Coast of England. I draw freaky comics and illustrations.  You might know me from my first two editions of Galaxafreaks.

I've been working on a comic book called Galaxafreaks about galaxy sized weirdoes getting up to all sorts of shenanigans! I work using digital media and have been publishing web-comics for a while now. I love the ol'interweb but would also love to spread my cosmic funk-juice through the medium of printed 'zines. Over the last few months I've successfully funded the publications of Galaxafreaks. All thanks to you lovely freakzoids! I'd love to do the same again. Hopefully, with your support I can!

New Campaign- New Perks!!!

This time round I'm offering the chance to snap up some premium Galaxafreaks merchandise! Using 3D modelling, printing and resin casting I'm proud to announce the start of the Galaxafreaks Action Figure series!!!



Want a Captain Yeah! but just too broke?

Download this paper toy version for free! HERE

No support is too little or too much!

There are a full range of perks to suit all types of pockets including;

  • A copy of the final printed comic
  • Original artwork
  • Limited edition screen-prints and posters
  • Resin cast action figures!
  • Appearing as a Galaxafreak!! (cosmic!!)

I really hope you can help out and get freaky with these dudes!

Who are the Galaxafreaks?

Where to start? Basically the Galaxafreaks are a bunch of friends who happen to be the size of whole galaxies. However, the whole story takes place inside the brain of a cosmic universal baby who lives inside a Higgs Boson particle. Obviously!

The next issue is all about the music!! The first story features Dj Boomertron and a loads of bad vibes going down at The Particle Club! Here's a glimpse of the action!





Galaxafreaks will be exclusively available in print as a 32 page, full colour comic book. None of the content will appear online (apart from the teaser story above). I was amazed at the print quality of Issue No:1, high quality gloss in full glorious freak-out colour. It really is an awesome item! If you could help make this a reality (what is reality anyway?) then I'd be able to continue freaking people's mind for just that little bit longer!

You never know, if it's successful I might be able to make it a series and stop washing dishes!

I've finished over half the comic already and will be posting glimpses and exclusive updates here as the project progresses.

However, to get this freak-show on the road I need to raise funds to pay for the printing & distribution of the old beast. 

How else can you help out?

If you're strapped for cash, don't worry none, you can still lend a hand:

  • Make as much noise as possible on social media

@drewdrewcito

 http://www.facebook.com/andrewpawleyillustration

  • Give those Indiegogo share tools a good ol'clicking!!

story:
Through her nearly 45 year history, many artists have left their mark on the She-Devil with a Sword. Arguably, none have impacted the heroine quite like Frank Thorne. His clean lines on Red Sonja and her fearsome foes catapulted the character from a supporting footnote in Hyrkanian lore to a worldwide fan-favorite. Through his judging of “Lookalike Contests” at early conventions, Thorne and Sonja fans even contributed to the rise of cosplay. Thorne’s definitive style is brought into the third dimension and your collection in this 1/6 scale collectible statue sculpted and painted lovingly based on the cover to Marvel Feature #4. 

To celebrate this major milestone, Dynamite is launching this statue pre-order campaign with additional offerings of Red Sonja products at prices you can't find anywhere else!

Some people believe that sites like Indiegogo are simply places for creators to raise the money needed in order to bring their project to fruition. While that is often true for most independent creators on Indiegogo, companies like Dynamite use crowdfunding for a different reason. 

Our goal is to make sure our wide range of comics and collectibles are available to EVERY FAN, regardless of where they live and shop. Indiegogo grants us the ability to share our limited edition products directly with the fans, educating fans about new releases and offering them a means to purchase items that may not be found at their local retail store.

In addition to expanding our outreach to fans, crowdfunding also gives us the chance to receive direct feedback from our customers and the early support from these customers often allows us to upgrade and improve upon our finished product.

Whether you're an independent creator, or an established company, crowdfunding is a group effort and the fans win when they're able to make their purchasing choices directly with the creator.

story:
My name is Matthew Gilpin. I'm a writer and filmmaker with a handful of award winning short films under my belt, both as writer, and as director. You can see some of my previous work here!

I've always loved comics and graphic novels, from Marvel and DC to more independent books. I'm incredibly excited to finally be getting the chance to create a comic book, in collaboration with the amazing artist Agata Babinska. 

Secrets and Shadows is an ambitious Urban Fantasy series, inspired by Film Noir. I hope you enjoy it! 

Below you can see some of the concept art drawn by Agata, and a couple of pages of rough layouts. All character concepts include alternate versions that may not feature in the final book.

 

This project is fairly far along it's development process, but could not exist without your help. We will need:

  • Roughly £200 for printing costs.
  • £300 in artist fees. Agata needs to live, and can't afford to spend time working on this project without payment.
  • £150 writers fee. I have spent many hours working on this story, developing the idea and making plans, as well as organising the process at the current stage. This is my payment for that. 
  • £50 Postage and other costs
  • £50 Indiegogo's cut. 

  • £2 Street Thug Donor: A digital copy of Secrets and Shadows Issue #1 as soon as it is complete.
  • £5 Heavy Donor: A digital AND physical copy of Secrets and Shadows Issue #1 as soon as they are available. 
  • £10 Detective Donor: All previous perks, and digital downloads of the original comic script, the screenplays that formed the basis of the story, and the original roughs.
  • £20 Femme Fatale Donor: All previous perks and high quality downloads of all concept and cover art.
  • £50 Mysterious Donor: All previous perks, and a custom portrait by Agata in the style of Secrets and Shadows
  •  

  • £900 - Marketing budget. We'll put this money towards getting this comic book in front of as many eyeballs as we can (if possible, by paying for a 'billboard' spot on The Adventure Zone) 
  • £1000 - Alternate Cover. For this much money we can pay another artist to create unique cover art for the limited run. 
  • £1200 - Stickers! Items and characters printed onto stickers, and sent to everyone who paid £10 and up! They would also likely be available for purchase after the end of the campaign for anyone who wants them! 
  • £1500 - Secrets and Shadows issue #2. Oh my goodness! Issue #2 has been plotted and is in the process of being written. If we reach this much, we'd definitely be able to finish, print and ship issue #2 as well! Digital copies would go to every level, and physical copies to all levels £5 and up! 

 

For both me and Agata, this comic represents a new chapter in our artistic careers. Telling a visual story is natural for me, but this format was fascinating and challenging to write for! Similarly, this is the longest visual story that Agata has told. It's stretching both of our artistic abilities. 

At a practical level, neither of us has run a crowd funding campaign before, and neither of us have had a book or magazine professionally printed. Similarly, we've not had to deal with large amounts of international postage. 

However! We've considered all the things we don't know, and done the relevant planning and research for how to deal with these issues. We're sure that we can push through and deliver a high quality piece of work. I've managed to get countless short films off the ground before, and I know that Agata has done some amazing illustration work. Between us, I'm sure we can make something fantastic! 

 

We know that not all of you can contribute, so if you can't you can always feel free to: 

  • Share this campaign on:
    • Facebook
    • Twitter
    • Instagram
    • Email your friends and family
    • Send strongly worded letters to your local TV and Radio stations. 
  • Follow both me and Agata on social media to stay up to date

 

Thanks for reading, and I hope we can make something great together!

Facebook
Twitter
Instagram
Email your friends and family
Send strongly worded letters to your local TV and Radio stations. 


Follow both me and Agata on social media to stay up to date

 
Thanks for reading, and I hope we can make something great together!

story:
TIPS!

Combining 20 years of service industry experience with a lifetime of art and writing expertise, TIPS Comix, is striving to be nothing less than the greatest service industry comic in the world. For the past 4 years, TIPS has been portraying the twisted absurdities of the fastest growing industry in the western world.  Whether you’re a grizzled service vet, or have ever set foot in a restaurant or bar, everyone can relate and have a laugh.

Through this campaign, you are making several projects possible:

1. “The TIPS Guide to Improve Proper Service”, a 50 rule “server manual” teaching you everything you need to know, and what never to do, as a restaurant server. This is the first in a series of self-published books, which will include “The TIPS Guide to Bartending” and “The TIPS Back of House Manual”.

2. “TIPS the Animated Series” will be animated shorts based on the comics available to watch for free on YouTube. Someday, when TIPS is on adult swim, you’ll be able to say, “Hey! I helped make that happen!”

3. “TIPS Zine” is a quarterly magazine, online and in print, of writing, art and humor, by and for the service industry. This project will be a launching pad for the artistic careers of industry professionals who are also writers, musicians and artists. Issue one will be press-ready by early May. Funds received will go directly to the print costs.

I’ve been turning out comics for free online for 4 years now, and will to continue to do so. There is so much more that can be done! This is your opportunity to be part of the next big thing in funnies!

Even if you can't contribute, spread the word! Share! Tell your bartender or waitress (and tip them 20% or more)!
story_txt:
TIPS!
Combining 20 years of service industry experience with a lifetime of art and writing expertise, TIPS Comix, is striving to be nothing less than the greatest service industry comic in the world. For the past 4 years, TIPS has been portraying the twisted absurdities of the fastest growing industry in the western world.  Whether you’re a grizzled service vet, or have ever set foot in a restaurant or bar, everyone can relate and have a laugh.
Through this campaign, you are making several projects possible:
1. “The TIPS Guide to Improve Proper Service”, a 50 rule “server manual” teaching you everything you need to know, and what never to do, as a restaurant server. This is the first in a series of self-published books, which will include “The TIPS Guide to Bartending” and “The TIPS Back of House Manual”.
2. “TIPS the Animated Series” will be animated shorts based on the comics available to watch for free on YouTube. Someday, when TIPS is on adult swim, you’ll be able to say, “Hey! I helped make that happen!”
3. “TIPS Zine” is a quarterly magazine, online and in print, of writing, art and humor, by and for the service industry. This project will be a launching pad for the artistic careers of industry professionals who are also writers, musicians and artists. Issue one will be press-ready by early May. Funds received will go directly to the print costs.
I’ve been turning out comics for free online for 4 years now, and will to continue to do so. There is so much more that can be done! This is your opportunity to be part of the next big thing in funnies!
Even if you can't contribute, spread the word! Share! Tell your bartender or waitress (and tip them 20% or more)!

story:
Short Summary

This is a small campaign for those E-Depth Angel readers who wishes to buy one of the printed magazine sized issues (8X10") in physical copies signed by Mayshing. (printer: ka-blam.com)

(Shipping included in all perks)

 

Mayshing/CD = a never-stop-working online manga artist.

This is the campaign to fund (finally!) all of the E-Depth Angel web manga issues in print form from Chapter 1-21! Because some of the earlier chapters are longer in length, and issues only go to 64 pages, some chapters are split into two.

Note: If we don't raise pass 250 we are canceling the orders and refunding minus the amount indiegogo took from us.) *Edit: Fear not, we're not canceling the orders! Thank you fans for surpassing that!

 

***To order: Pick a pledge of how many you want to buy

Enter your information, and at the comment section, enter the chapters you want to order. (You can copy and paste from this list) 

Comment: 

File # - #copies (ex: perk $25: file 21: 2 copies, file 08: 2 copies)

 

Chapter listing: (links to website pre-view pages)

File 01: None and Tempest

File 02: Reconstruction

File 03: Hugs prohibited!

File 04: Colosseum Pt 1

File 04: Colosseum Pt 2

File 05: Revenge 

File 05.2: Revenge II

File 06: Zombies

File 07: None

File 08: Pinocchio Brothers

File 09: Pinocchio Project Alpha

File 09 2-2 Pinocchio Project Beta (and the Forgotten Warrior)

File 10: Pinocchio Project Delta

File 11: Fall back

File 12: Turn about

File 13: Grass Roots

File 14: The Missing Pieces

File 15: The King of Hope

File 16: New Order

File 17: Angel

File 18: Stories

File 19: Memories

File 20: Power Struggle

File 21: Guardians of the deep (in progress chapter)

 

*NOTE: I gave up on printing full length books for now as it's too expensive to manage. >.< Until we sell enough issues, we can no longer print volumes anymore. ;_; sorry sorry sorry. 

Everyone will get to choose the chapters they would like most to order. Then I will get it made into products hopefully within 2-4 months time. (If there's any delay, I will let you know~) Some chapters will be done slower than others because of editing issues. The faster ones will be done first. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need a total of $1000 all together, to get them all printed, and I can start selling them at cons too. 

~Some part of the graphics will be updated, never posted online before for this print job. :) 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this project with other people on your Facebook, blog, twitter, tumblr or website, and take a screen cap or send us the link of your share, then we will give you a raffle number.  We will do a raffle at the end of the campaign, and the winner gets one issue for free! 

CD: Soooo... go forth and spread the word! If you are already buying one issue, you can get an extra one for free if you win! 

For any not-on-the-list pre-order and a winning chance, e-mail your screen shot to: roxie.altabe@gmail.com

For any questions to ask me directly: mayshing AT gmail.com

story:
How does this stretch goal work? Simple!  If we make up the cost of putting together a new Middle book as described below through sales of "The Pan-Universal Parental Reconciliation" then we will create an an entirely new Middleman adventure for 2015 - another 88-100 page graphic novel that will continue the Middleman saga and go on sale as a print on demand title on the Middleman web store!


Sadly, we cannot offer the 2015 book as a solo premium or as an add on to new or existing donations -- merely that we will produce it if we meet our goal and offer it on our forthcoming webstore at a fair and delightful price!


New to the page?  Wanna know what this is all about - keep reading!




In 2005, Viper Comics published The Middleman. It didn’t just spawn three more graphic novels, it also made the Young Adult Library Services Association's list of “Great Graphic Novels For Teens!”  Not bad for an indie black-and-white book, right?  

In 2008, The Middleman exploded into TV - and though we only lasted twelve episodes, The New York Times did use the word “genius” in their review! 

Now, the comics are in danger of going out of print, and with them, our only hope of creating new Middleman material. The Middleman is owned by ABC Family/Disney... but they have graciously given me, Les McClaine and Viper the right to publish new Middleman adventures in comics!

With your help, we will create an epic tale in which the comic book characters collide with their TV counterparts: The Pan-Universal Parental Reconciliation!

This isn’t just about making a new comic, but about giving The Middleman a new home - a print-on-demand webstore where you will be able acquire both our legacy books and the new adventure, at fair prices, with new covers - in a never-before-seen large format!



Wanna read io9's exclusive review of the script for "The Pan-Universal Parental Reconciliation?"  Click HERE!

Once this campaign funds, production will begin on the new graphic novel - which is currently scheduled to debut in July of 2014, and the remastering of the legacy books... the web-store should open in the second quarter of 2014!



Perks? Boy, have we got perks, starting with...



Gosh yes! We're getting the band back together for one night only, and you can be there to see it: a live reading of “The Pan-Universal Parental Reconciliation” followed by an autograph session!

And yes, Matt “The Middleman” Keeslar, Natalie “Wendy Watson” Morales, Mary-Pat “Ida” Gleason, Brit “Lacey Thornfield” Morgan, Alan “High-Aldwyn” Smyth, and - of course - Jake “Noser” Smollett have all agreed to attend!

And that’s not all! To play the role of “Comic Book Wendy,” we have a special guest, Amber Benson, of Buffy The Vampire Slayer! Don't believe me? Take a look at THIS:



Or how about this? (and why is he standing by a nuclear reactor?)



The event is scheduled for Saturday May 24, 2014 in Los Angeles... you have to furnish your own airfare and accommodations, but this will be a unique opportunity to see the original cast, and get two items of your choice autographed by the stars of The Middleman (yeah, there's a limit, we don't want them getting carpal tunnel)!

The reading will be taped, edited and released on YouTube sometime after the book’s debut at the 2014 San Diego Comic Con!




Wanna see  a preview image of the bookplate? CLICK HERE!



Wanna see a black and white preview of the print - which will be full color and measure 18X25?  Here it is:

And that ain't it -- here's a couple more perks we got for ya!


And here are a few new Middleprops!

In the case of a bidding conflict for the items below, the perk will go to the first bidder on indiegogo's record and all other payments will be refunded.

For larger images click HERE!


WHERE THE MONEY’S GOING.

PRODUCTION OF THE PAN-UNIVERSAL PARENTAL RECONCILIATION (95-100 pages: pencils, black-and-white inks, lettering and covers) - $20,000

LAYOUT/DESIGN FOR SIX BOOKS (5 legacy graphic novels with new covers, one new graphic novel) - $2,000

POSTAGE/PRINTING COSTS FOR PREMIUMS (including set-up fees and printing of crowd-funded premium books) - $6,200

LIVE READING (Including venue and travel expenses for actors) – $5,000

LIVE READING TAPE AND EDIT - $1,000

CROWDFUNDING COMMISSIONS - $2,800

TOTAL - $37,000

STRETCH GOAL - page coloring and upgraded printing of "The Pan-Universal Parental Reconciliation" - $20,000


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

There is, of course, the possibility that one or more of our cast members will - due to personal or professional emergency - not be able to join the live reading.  As of the launch of this campaign, they are committed and we will make every effort to not only insure their participation moving forward but also to keep donors informed of any changes in the line-up.

Finally - comic books are artisanal and hand-crafted, so there may be delays.  Les McClaine and I are committed to publishing the book by the 2014 San Diego Comic-Con, but if any issues should arise, we will keep donors informed of any and all changes in our production timeline.

LIVE READING (Including venue and travel expenses for actors) – $5,000
LIVE READING TAPE AND EDIT - $1,000

Finally - comic books are artisanal and hand-crafted, so there may be delays.  Les McClaine and I are committed to publishing the book by the 2014 San Diego Comic-Con, but if any issues should arise, we will keep donors informed of any and all changes in our production timeline.

story:
WHAT YOU'RE FUNDING

Basically the funding for this project will go to helping me live the dream and for a few amazing months be able to work solely on my comics. The money will be going to art supplies, and other production costs required to work on it full time. I have some funds saved but not enough to make it long on my own.

I have been making comics for a few years now on my own while working fulltime and going to school full time. Each issue takes a lot of time to make for just a few minutes of reading and appreciation. Recently I have been published by Forbidden Panel, a comics publisher based in Redlands, CA. for my work on “The Plagued”. I am currently about 1800 dollars in the negative towards comics just in the last year. This year I am hoping I can at least break even, and that is where I need your help! I need this money so I can live my dream and tell this amazing story the way it’s meant to be told. 

The story starts with a short 10 page Prologue. This prologue gives a short look at the rich back story that is the base for The Endangered (the thumbnails for the prologue are featured in the video above). After the Prologue comes Chapter 1. This official start of the story which begins with a man awaking from a hibernation pod alone in a pitch black room. He doesn't know where he is or what is happening. There is no one there to help him and this is where the fight to survive begins.

With the funding raised for this project in a month I will be able to have the pencils for the first issue complete. This means the collection of the Prologue and Chapter One will be done. But that wont be the only thing that gets completed. This fundraising project was created to give me multiple months away from work with my sole focus being this project. This means that by the end of the 3 month period this funding would allow me to have Issue #1 finished, and the pencils for Issue #2 finished.  

I have the whole story planned in concept, and the first two issues written and ready to go. With your help I could create this amazing thing, but without your help it may take me years just to get started. The story as it is so far is just about 25 issues long, but is really meant to be ongoing. I hope that you can help me to create my best work so far, because without my help it may take another 6 months before I can finish the first issue. 

 

WHAT YOU GET IN RETURN!

Everything in the world worth doing takes hard work and substantial amounts of time. In reality all I am asking for is the time. I will put in all the work if I can get the time I need to make this project succeed. I’m asking you to donate to my goal of 2500 dollars, but I want everyone to know before they give money that this money isn’t just for my personal spending. Printing costs a lot of money, but so do things like merchandise and advertisement. I’ve worked out all the costs for shipping incentives and everything else that needs to be done.

I have lots of incentives for the people who donate and I am really excited about them. They range from a PDF version of the Plagued, to a special first edition issue of The Endangered, all the way up to family Zombie Portraits and Original Pages from the first issue.

I want to point out that no matter how much money I am able to make I am still going to do everything I can to put this comic out into the world. Without reaching my goal I just am not able to guarantee the time it will take to make it happen.

 

STRETCH GOALS

I have some great stretch goals planned for the project. Here they are, all the way up to 4000 dollars which if I were to reach, there really isn’t any telling what I could accomplish.

  • $2,800 – Special Edition alternative cover for all issues printed of The Endangered Issue #1. This cover will only be available for this printing of the first issue.
  • $3,200 – At this amount I can have funds enough to confidently put up preorders for issue #2 of The Endangered as a incentive prize separate from the others.
  • $3,500 – Everyone who has donated 20 dollars or more will receive Issue #2 of The Endangered as soon as it is released.
  • $4,000 – I will be able to work on The Endangered for the foreseeable future. This is truly my goal, but I feel like asking for this amount would be unreasonable. With this amount I would be able to finish the first issue, the second issue, and possibly have the pencils done for the third or even more. Also at this amount everyone who has donated $12 or more will receive a Special Edition Issue of The Plagued that will only be available through this project and in the first trade of The Plagued. The issue will also include special pages of Zombie Sketches and images of some of the portraits created for people during this issue.

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

If you are unable to donate or contribute to the project financially I understand. I am very poor and can totally relate, but please share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, or your website if you have one. Any way that you can spread the word to help me get more pledges would be not only absolutely fantastic, but also deeply appreciated.
