story:
Portraits of Poe

Portraits of Poe is a illustrated collection of our favorite Edgar Allan Poe works in graphic novel format. The bulk of the illustrations will be provided by Bill Pulkovski, Tony Miello and Bruce Gerlach with some special guest artists providing portraits of Poe. Contributing creatives that I can mention at this time are Matt busch, Dirk Manning, Rhiannon Owens, Jay Fosgit, Nina Edlund, Tim Shay and Tim Proctor... more to be announced later.

Coinciding with the release of the book will be our first trading card release. Portraits of Poe will be a Premium trading card set limited to 150 packs. Each pack will contain a full 8 card base set and 1 original sketch card from some of the best talent in the industry. 

A fine art print by Bill Pulkovski will also be produced. The print will be limited to 50 and hand signed by the artist.

Rocket Ink Studios

This will be Rocket Ink Studios' first major project. Rocket Ink Studios was founded last year by Bill Pulkovski and Tony Miello. We're in the Detroit, Michigan area and have worked in the industry for years. We've provided licensed work for Star Wars, Marvel and DC to just name a few. 

Rocket Ink Studios provides illustration and design services as well as publishing books, graphic novels, fine art prints and trading cards. Our group of creatives have also provided licensed work on properties as Star Wars, Marvel, DC, The NHL, Universal monsters and many more!

Portraits of Poe is our flagship project. We believe in it so much that we are certain that it will be a springboard rocketing our studio in a position to consistently publish top notch products on a regular basis for years to come. We may be a young and small studio, but we have very large ambitions!

What We Need & What You Get

We plan on distributing the book through Diamond Distributors and would need a hefty number printed. This cost will be our largest overhead along with paying our artists, designers and contributors. The production of the trading cards is also a factor. We want to produce quality products.

All the funds raised will go into using high quality materials, printing and shipping fees, and hiring the best creatives we can. Should we exceed our goal, extra funds will just be put towards insuring this project is a success. Marketing, materials, bonuses for our creatives. 

If we do not reach our goal, the funds we do raise will still be allocated as stated, the book will be published, the trading cards will be produced and all incentives will be given. The impact will determine the amount of creatives we can bring in on the project.

We tried to set donation amounts to meet everyone's budget and have some really exciting incentives for helping us! Donations range from $5-$500 and incentives include things like signed copies of the book, original artwork, trading cards, prints and more!!! Look at the list on the right to get a full break down!

Shipping is included on all incentives shipping within the U.S. and Canada. Please contact us as a small fee may be added to incentives going out of the country. rocketinkstudios@gmail.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean that you can't help:

  • You can get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use Indiegogo share tools!

Our sincerest thanks for just taking a moment out of your busy day to learn about our campaign!
story_txt:
Portraits of Poe
Portraits of Poe is a illustrated collection of our favorite Edgar Allan Poe works in graphic novel format. The bulk of the illustrations will be provided by Bill Pulkovski, Tony Miello and Bruce Gerlach with some special guest artists providing portraits of Poe. Contributing creatives that I can mention at this time are Matt busch, Dirk Manning, Rhiannon Owens, Jay Fosgit, Nina Edlund, Tim Shay and Tim Proctor... more to be announced later.

Coinciding with the release of the book will be our first trading card release. Portraits of Poe will be a Premium trading card set limited to 150 packs. Each pack will contain a full 8 card base set and 1 original sketch card from some of the best talent in the industry. 

A fine art print by Bill Pulkovski will also be produced. The print will be limited to 50 and hand signed by the artist.

Rocket Ink Studios
This will be Rocket Ink Studios' first major project. Rocket Ink Studios was founded last year by Bill Pulkovski and Tony Miello. We're in the Detroit, Michigan area and have worked in the industry for years. We've provided licensed work for Star Wars, Marvel and DC to just name a few. 

Rocket Ink Studios provides illustration and design services as well as publishing books, graphic novels, fine art prints and trading cards. Our group of creatives have also provided licensed work on properties as Star Wars, Marvel, DC, The NHL, Universal monsters and many more!
Portraits of Poe is our flagship project. We believe in it so much that we are certain that it will be a springboard rocketing our studio in a position to consistently publish top notch products on a regular basis for years to come. We may be a young and small studio, but we have very large ambitions!



What We Need & What You Get
We plan on distributing the book through Diamond Distributors and would need a hefty number printed. This cost will be our largest overhead along with paying our artists, designers and contributors. The production of the trading cards is also a factor. We want to produce quality products.
All the funds raised will go into using high quality materials, printing and shipping fees, and hiring the best creatives we can. Should we exceed our goal, extra funds will just be put towards insuring this project is a success. Marketing, materials, bonuses for our creatives. 
If we do not reach our goal, the funds we do raise will still be allocated as stated, the book will be published, the trading cards will be produced and all incentives will be given. The impact will determine the amount of creatives we can bring in on the project.
We tried to set donation amounts to meet everyone's budget and have some really exciting incentives for helping us! Donations range from $5-$500 and incentives include things like signed copies of the book, original artwork, trading cards, prints and more!!! Look at the list on the right to get a full break down!
Shipping is included on all incentives shipping within the U.S. and Canada. Please contact us as a small fee may be added to incentives going out of the country. rocketinkstudios@gmail.com


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean that you can't help:

You can get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Use Indiegogo share tools!


Our sincerest thanks for just taking a moment out of your busy day to learn about our campaign!

story:
Neighborhood #27 is a comic that follows the misadventures of the inhabitants of a small suburban neighborhood. Little do these people know, their whole town is constantly under watch of a group called the Operators. They never interfere with the neighborhood they moniter, their only purpose is to make sure these dysfunctional people don't destroy the world and to be incredibly amused.

Among the people who live in Neighborhood #27 include a little boy who carries around his unborn brother in a jar, a schizophrenic homeless man, and a commune of Chinese people who's numbers seem infinite. Here are some bios for you.

Cletus & Fetus

Dessie

 

Huxley

 

If you like It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia and Ed, Edd, n Eddy then this comic is right up your alley.

Interested yet? You better be.

So here's what we need:

$800 to print the first issue which will be distributed both in select stores and online for free

$1200 to print the 120 page graphic novel which will be released both digitally and in beautiful hard cover glory.

$500 goes towards supplies for merchandising which will include posters, 3D models of the characters, pins, and whatever other crap we can put our name on.

We're depending on you to make this a possibility. And hey, if this takes off, we might even see you at this year's Baltimore Comic Con.

Neighborhood #27 is:

Sean Costello: Creator/Illustrator/Writer

Johnny Lehman: Writer

story:
What is it?

Pipun the Magnificent is a modern hero, who lives in the period before the new era. Comic contains simple drawings and is written in plain language, and topics that are covered are complicated  themselves. Incompatible things were combined in order to reach an original plot. The series were originally conceived as a comic book race through history, and  the themes are close to us and affect us.
It is about a family that moves to Pompey, the tragedy that has fallen on their hometown. In Pompeii Pipun finds a shelter with his family,finds love, and at the end all tragedies fall on them again. It is the circular composition of the comic.


Who are we?

Maja Kostić, Student of the University Atlas in Podgorica, Montenegro, artist of this modest work of art. Maja loves pancakes and  eats  them daily. She hopes that because of this vice she won’t be socializing with insulin when she gets older. In this comic she invests ideas, sweat, hard work and does not complain.

Asja Šašić, a student of the Faculty of Law in Podgorica, Montenegro, makes her  contribution by writing these comics. She does not  have a sweet tooth, she's more for the salty versions. She hopes that her kidneys will not fail and she drinks preventive lemonade every morning in order to avoid that. In this project, she invests her "language" and complains more than  Maja.


What would it take, and what do you get?


- We need your financial support as well as professional, if  you can provide some.

- You get a piece of art that you will want to give away to your friends, wanting extensions.

- Support the development of this type of art, which is underdeveloped in Montenegro.

- Support the development of alternative art.

- Do a good deed !

- If this project becomes successful, we will be an example to young people who could get encouraged  to apply new, valuable, fresh projects.


Should this project turn out to be successful, we will print a modest number of copies. By this, it would mean that following comics would experience the daylight.
Our first comic, and all the next, will have the same shape as well as heroes, and our comics will be attractive at first sight, even if  you do not read them.

This project is the first step towards our most important project, the opening of the Alternative Center for Youth. It will be a place where artists will be able to freely create works of art, get the proctor, and material support. This place is also conceived as a cultural shelter, where young people meet their leisure time in a creative, different (an alternative) than  the usual way.


Other ways by which you can help:

- If you are not in a position to help us financially, you could share a link from this site via social networks or similar service, which provides us a variety of audiences.

- You could recommend us to people who could  help financially.

- You could reread our project and help us though ;)

Impact:


We will be a role model to young people and perhaps they will do projects that are similar or better than ours.

story:
Stretch Goals!!!

 

Stretch goal #1 :$5,000 - Trading Cards

Stretch goal #2: $6,000 - Pin Set

Stretch goal #3: $12,000 - Action Figure!

 

Besides already getting a sticker pack, a poker chip and a free sketch with every perk or package, we are going to be adding even more great content for our backers. Check it out!

1.  We are stoked to announce we have passed our goal and now will be trying for a few Stretch Goals! Our first goal is $5k and is for 5 Johnny Phantasm trading cards in packaging.

*not actual art 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mLvhtmxizj4&feature=youtu.be

2. Our second stretch goal is for a pair of pins. Here are some examples of Pins Patrick has designed in the past.

 

3. For our last goal, the biggie, will be a Johnny Phantasm 3  3/4" action figure. Designed by Shoulong Tian who has done many things for Hasbro such as the Star Wars Rouge One and Solo Black Series action figures.

 

The Story So Far:

 

 

Evan K. Pozios is a professional writer & attorney from Detroit, MI. Most notably, Evan is the creator of Time Grunts, published by Caliber Comics.

Patrick Thomas Parnell is a professional illustrator and college instructor from Sarasota, FL. Patrick has worked on projects such as Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Mega Man and Sonic the Hedgehog. 

After successfully collaborating on Time Grunts for Caliber Comics, Patrick & Evan are bringing their newest creator-owned title to IndieGoGo . . . JOHNNY PHANTASM!!! 

We are more then halfway through completion of a 80 page graphic novel. Be a part of this project and help us cross over the finish line!

story:
Canadian Comedy Award Winner Sandra Battaglini in...

CLASSY LADY

Hi, my name is Sandra Battaglini. I'm a Toronto-based artist and am mounting a new solo show, CLASSY LADY, premiering this June at Toronto's Alumnae Theatre.  This is my sixth and most exciting solo presentation. My last solo show, Hard Headed Woman, played to sold out audiences and won a Canadian Comedy Award. 

All of my projects are fuelled primarily by passion. Up until now I've funded my own shows and it's my dream to be able to share this project and future projects with people who are supporters of the arts, theatre, and comedy.

My goal with this campaign is to raise $10,000. These funds will be used toward the compensation of the theatre rental, promotion (printing & publicity), support staff (director, stage manager, technical director, etc), and costumes. And if my entire goal is not met, whatever is raised will be distributed as an honorarium to those individuals who worked so hard behind the scenes to make my vision a reality.

CLASSY LADY is my most imaginative adventure yet, and I'm so excited to bring this to life with the help of your donations. And I always love to meet and communicate with my supporters and fans - so each of the donations will be met with some perks that will allow you to enjoy the work that came out of your generosity!

Your generosity will be met with one or more of the following perks:

* tickets to CLASSY LADY

* A signed official CLASSY LADY poster

* Special mention in the CLASSY LADY program

* CLASSY LADY swag (t-shirt, book bag, mug)

* Double Date: dinner and CLASSY LADY tickets for 4

* Dinner for you and a guest with the star & the director of CLASSY LADY, Sandra Battaglini & Phil Luzi

* A CLASSY LADY Producer credit

* An event hosted by Sandra Battaglni & Phil Luzi as Sandy Frigginelli & Sal Feldman, stars of the smash hit variety cabaret "The Sal & Sandy Show"

The Impact

Your contributions will help to realize an artist's vision of creating a space of joy and laughter. I love making people laugh, it's the most rewarding element of my work. My vision for CLASSY LADY is to have a successful sold-out run, and to then take the show on the road; Across Canada, the United States, and even Europe!

Based on my last solo show, Canadian Comedy Award Winning Hard Headed Woman, I know that this goal is within reach.  And I would like to package a show that is ready to take on tour. CLASSY LADY is that show!

Other Ways You Can Help a CLASSY LADY

A CLASSY LADY knows that some people are just not in a position to contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help in your own way. Please take advantage of your social network contacts to get the word out and make some noise for my campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools - easy as pie.

story:
GOAL!

Thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you! I know how you spend your money matters – and it matters to me, too – but!!

IT’S NOT OVER!


I’ve maintained all along that $1,350 was a start – it affords me the essentials: finite physical supplies to produce a 150 page graphic novel (equivalent to about 6 issues of a monthly comic), and reward you with awesome perks!

I already put up the money to produce one of the perks - prologue issue EBFTZERO - and hitting $1,350 guarantees I can print the short run of graphic novels and posters (and yes, one copy of a limited collectible coffee table sketchbook) required to fulfill all the perks purchased so far in this campaign.

I obviously don’t get to quit my day job, (and I don't want to) but now look at all the things I am FOR SURE GETTING:

  • A Wacom tablet (appx $300 after taxes and shipping). 
  • Artograph LED Lightpad at 12” x 17” (appx $300 after taxes and shipping). 
  • The volume and quality of paper (Strathmore 500 11x17” Plate Bristol, list price is $45 per pad of 15 sheets) upon which I would prefer to illustrate the book. 
  • Various and sundry pens (weirdly expensive), Copic markers (to quote the internet these are “spendy” but worth it), erasers (cheap), and pencils (also, cheap, but I burn through Prismacolor 919 Non-Photo Blue pencils like crazy) necessary to illustrate the book.
  • I already ordered a short run of EBFTZERO, but now I can do another one.
  • I can also do a run of the inevitable EBFTVOL1. I might even already be able to squeeze in a run of Mattachine #1.

THE STRETCH

So you know it’s not over, but what does that mean, and what does it get you? Well, for starters there are perks available at every level of giving from a postcard to a visit by yours truly to paint a mural in su casa. See here what else I can have and do if we hit stretch goals!

In the meantime, I’ve begun to book tables, hotels, flights, and rental cars to attend conventions. My first con is local to Dallas FanExpo Fan Days, October 17, 18, and 19; and I’ll be at Bent Con in Burbank, CA, November 7, 8, and 9; and I’m eye-balling Albuquerque and Portland in January... I’m happy to drop my day-job earned coin booking these trips, BUT in order to maximize on MY investment it would be a huge help to be able to order

  • Business Cards [DONE!]
  • A Pop-Up Banner [DONE!]
  • Manufacturing of collectible full-color prints and/or posters
  • Re-prints of OLD stuff like my 1st novel, my books of poetry, and the ability to get more EBFTZERO made at a moment's notice, all of which can be sold and monetized at cons!
  • Merch for the comics, merch for my “company” XI Comix

Hitting somewhere around $3,000 total donations would offset some of the on-the-ground costs of these cons – fast food, fast women LOL you know what I mean. Cons are the best way to promote my work as an artist and now that I’ve got access to the materials, they’re the next thing I need access to. Which brings us to:

Going back to that Portland con I'm eye-balling for January: it’s part of the WizardWorld family of conventions, and they do this pretty great thing where the more cons you pre-register for, the bigger a discount you get. I’ve checked off 7 (including Portland) regional cons that I think will be heavily attended by my potential demo (hip, queer, indie), which would be a fee of $1,905 after the discount for the WizardWorld con circuit.

It boggles the mind to think of getting enough money to cover all of these things, so let's go back to the basics in case you haven't been to this page before, and you're all, "What is he even talking about? WHAT THE HELL IS EBFT?"

THE BOOK

Elegant Battle Face Teenagers is EBFT.  is a story about good and evil; love and hate; potential and failure; 1997 and 2197. 

In 1997, a madman called Adam has left a bloody trail of destruction across the globe on a hunt for a boy named Hype who has the power to defeat him. With the help of Ashlynn and the rest of his friends, Hype is able to hide away across space and time in 2197 and plan his revenge on Adam. 

Adam, too, gathers followers and bides his time until he can vanquish the Hype. But as Hype delves deeper into history – both his own and Adam’s – he learns that good and evil are never black and white, and they’ve both made decisions that altered many fates far beyond their imagining.

The images in this campaign comprise some panels from the opening pages of EBFTZERO (prologue to Volume One)- it's a time-hopping, globe-trotting adventure that jumps from the ruin of Dallas to the backroads of central Texas to the Tombs of the Apostles in Italy.

"A rockin' indie comic flavored like Claremont's X-Men, BKV's Saga, and Buffy the Vampire Slayer."

My name is James Bevard Hargrave, and I'm the creator, writer, and illustrator of Elegant Battle Face Teenagers. I just finished my MFA in Creative Writing at The New School University in New York, NY and moved back to Texas. My master’s thesis consisted of the Prologue to Volume One – and it’s an instant perk as a .PDF for every donation over $5.00.

I’ve been cooking up EBFT in one form or another (for years I thought it would be a YA novel) since 2009 when I was Assistant Maneater (typo and it stays, but MANAGER is what I meant) at the world famous Lone Star Comics Dallas (R.I.P., long live URBAN LEGENDS COMICS in Mesquite, TX). Now that I know it is a graphic narrative, being able to properly illustrate, edit, manipulate, and publish it in a timely fashion means the world to me – I’m doing everything myself, which is why I need help assembling my supplies in a timely fashion.

Risks & Challenges

I know I can get my product into local comic shops, and DFW, TX has more than a couple. However, beyond that, I don’t know. I don’t think making funny books is going to get me rich, and my personal available resources are already going into the production of the ZERO issue, but I do think this project could be a MAJOR step in making it possible for me to make THE NEXT THING, and your contribution is the first step in that being true.

I dream of writing X-Men, Green Lantern, and Buffy the Vampire Slayer comics.The only way that dream can come true is to make my own comics – to prove to The Powers That Be, that I can do something amazing with a property that I myself invented, completed, AND sold.

When I complete EBFT VOLUME ONE, I will have put together a big enough, bad enough (the good kind of bad, duh) body of work that I could potentially team with publishers like IMAGE or DARK HORSE to reissue it in a major pro-printed and designed edition, and go forward with EBFTVOL2. That's right, I have plans for at least 6 volumes down the line.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, and I more than understand that, but that also doesn't mean that you can't help in some way:

  • Please, help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.Especially pass this campaign along if you know any LGBT comic fans or comic fans who are People of Color, because even as a gay white guy, I have a strong interest in making sure my book is representative of my readership - and I hope to reach all races, sexualities, gender identities, and political affiliations. (Those queer trans black Republicans are going love my comic book,  y'all, no kidding!)
  • They tell me that IndieGoGo has some awesome on-board share tools, so don't be afraid to use those! LOL.
  • Check out our shops at http://cafepress.com/elegantbattlefaceteenagers    and http://www.cafepress.com/xicomix    for cool swag you can carry around with to promote EBFTZERO and our new comic studio XI COMIX. We receive a 5% royalty from sales, but it's a better deal than printing our own merch - for now.

TL;DR       ;-D

Thank you

· For reading this far.

· For contributing.

· For thinking of contributing.

· For spreading the word.

· For being a friend.

· For being a relative.

· For you.

     sheets) upon which I would prefer to illustrate the book. 
Various and sundry pens
     (weirdly expensive), Copic markers (to quote the internet these are
     “spendy” but worth it), erasers (cheap), and pencils (also, cheap,
     but I burn through Prismacolor 919 Non-Photo Blue pencils like
     crazy) necessary to illustrate the book.

I already ordered a short run
     of EBFTZERO, but now I can do another one.
I can also do a run of the
     inevitable EBFTVOL1. I might even already be able to squeeze
     in a run of Mattachine #1.
THE STRETCH
So
you know it’s not over, but what does that mean, and what does it get you?
Well, for starters there are perks available at every level of giving from a
postcard to a visit by yours truly to paint a mural in su casa. See
here what else I can have and do if we hit stretch goals!
In
the meantime, I’ve begun to book tables, hotels, flights, and rental cars to
attend conventions. My first con is local to Dallas FanExpo Fan Days, October
17, 18, and 19; and I’ll be at Bent Con in Burbank, CA, November 7, 8, and 9;
and I’m eye-balling Albuquerque and Portland in January... I’m happy to drop my
day-job earned coin booking these trips, BUT in order to maximize on MY
investment it would be a huge help to be able to order

Business Cards [DONE!]

A Pop-Up Banner [DONE!]

Manufacturing of collectible
     full-color prints and/or posters

Re-prints of OLD stuff like my
     1st novel, my books of poetry, and the ability to get
     more EBFTZERO made at a moment's notice, all of which can
     be sold and monetized at cons!

Merch for the comics, merch for
     my “company” XI Comix
Hitting
somewhere around $3,000 total donations would offset some of the on-the-ground
costs of these cons – fast food, fast women LOL you know what I mean. Cons are
the best way to promote my work as an artist and now that I’ve got access to
the materials, they’re the next thing I need access to. Which brings us to:
Going
back to that Portland con I'm eye-balling for January: it’s part of the WizardWorld family
of conventions, and they do this pretty great thing where the more cons you
pre-register for, the bigger a discount you get. I’ve checked off 7 (including
Portland) regional cons that I think will be heavily attended by my potential
demo (hip, queer, indie), which would be a fee of $1,905 after the
discount for the WizardWorld con circuit.
It
boggles the mind to think of getting enough money to cover all of these things,
so let's go back to the basics in case you haven't been to this page before,
and you're all, "What is he even talking about? WHAT THE HELL IS EBFT?"

THE BOOK
Elegant Battle Face
Teenagers is EBFT.  is a story about good and evil; love and hate; potential and failure; 1997
and 2197. In 1997, a madman
called Adam has left a bloody trail of destruction across the globe on
a hunt for a boy named Hype who has the power to defeat him. With the help of
Ashlynn and the rest of his friends, Hype is able to hide away across
space and time in 2197 and plan his revenge on Adam. 
Adam, too, gathers
followers and bides his time until he can vanquish the Hype. But as Hype delves
deeper into history – both his own and Adam’s – he learns
that good and evil are never black and white, and they’ve both made
decisions that altered many fates far beyond their imagining.
The images in this campaign
comprise some panels from the opening pages of EBFTZERO (prologue
to Volume One)- it's a time-hopping, globe-trotting
adventure that jumps from the ruin of Dallas to the backroads of central Texas
to the Tombs of the Apostles in Italy.
"A rockin' indie
comic flavored like Claremont's X-Men, BKV's Saga,
and Buffy the Vampire Slayer."My name is James Bevard Hargrave, and I'm the creator, writer,
and illustrator of Elegant Battle Face Teenagers. I just finished my
MFA in Creative Writing at The New School University in New York, NY and moved
back to Texas. My master’s thesis consisted of the Prologue to Volume
One – and it’s an instant perk as a .PDF for every donation over
$5.00.
I’ve been cooking up EBFT in one form or
another (for years I thought it would be a YA novel) since
2009 when I was Assistant Maneater (typo and it stays, but MANAGER is what I
meant) at the world famous Lone Star Comics Dallas (R.I.P., long live URBAN
LEGENDS COMICS in Mesquite, TX). Now that I know it is a graphic
narrative, being able to properly illustrate, edit, manipulate, and publish it
in a timely fashion means the world to me – I’m doing everything
myself, which is why I need help assembling my supplies in a timely fashion.Risks & Challenges
I know I can get my
product into local comic shops, and DFW, TX has more than a couple. However, beyond
that, I don’t know. I don’t think making funny books is going to get
me rich, and my personal available resources are already going into the
production of the ZERO issue, but I do think this
project could be a MAJOR step in making it possible for me to make THE NEXT
THING, and your contribution is the first step in that being true.
I dream of writing X-Men, Green Lantern, and Buffy
the Vampire Slayer comics.The only way that dream can come true is
to make my own comics – to prove to The Powers That Be, that I can do
something amazing with a property that I myself invented, completed, AND sold.
When I complete EBFT VOLUME ONE, I will have put
together a big enough, bad enough (the good kind of bad, duh) body of work that I
could potentially team with publishers like IMAGE or DARK HORSE to reissue it
in a major pro-printed and designed edition, and go forward with EBFTVOL2. That's
right, I have plans for at least 6 volumes down the line.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some
people just can't contribute financially, and I more than understand that, but
that also doesn't mean that you can't help in some way:

Please, help me get the word
     out and make some noise about my campaign.Especially pass this campaign
     along if you know any LGBT comic fans or comic fans who are People of
     Color, because even as a gay white guy, I have a strong interest in
     making sure my book is representative of my readership - and I hope to
     reach all races, sexualities, gender identities, and political
     affiliations. (Those queer trans black Republicans are going love my
     comic book,  y'all, no kidding!)

They tell me that IndieGoGo has
     some awesome on-board share tools, so don't be afraid to use those! LOL.
Check out our shops at http://cafepress.com/elegantbattlefaceteenagers    and http://www.cafepress.com/xicomix    for cool swag you can carry around with to
     promote EBFTZERO and our new comic studio XI COMIX. We receive
     a 5% royalty from sales, but it's a better deal than printing our own
     merch - for now.
TL;DR
      ;-D
Thank
you
· For
reading this far.
· For
contributing.
· For
thinking of contributing.
· For
spreading the word.
· For
being a friend.
· For
being a relative.
· For
you.

story:
Short Summary

WELCOME TO THE CORPORATION...Where a life can be terminated for the right price...and no one will be the wiser.

Malice is forever cloaked in mystery.  It lurks in an invisible universe filled with strangers – both interconnected and disconnected.  His was a world, in which life was expendable and identities could be bought.  Sex was common ground and murder was always a way out. Secrets and lies were celebrated until one got caught. In his world she could be anyone she wanted while completely losing sight of who she was.  Welcome to The Corporation – an organization unlike any you’ve ever worked in before.

My name is Angela Fielder, and I am the creator/author of The Corporation project. I started my writing career, just about 15 years ago.  I worked as an Arts & Lifestyle journalist, mainly covering movie junkets and premieres as well as celebrity profiles for various publications (Rolling Out Urbanstyle, The Robertson Treatment, Vodka Magazine and a host of others.) From there, I went on to write spy novellas. Two of the characters made their debut to the world in a few of those novellas.  

This campaign is super important to me for a number of reasons.  First and foremost, both stories have been stuck in my head for years and without funding it is tough to get the illustrations done right. There are two stories in one! Which means that we're making 2 comic books - 1 gives you the backstory on the dangerous Dawud El-Hashem, #7 on the U.S. terrorists list, and the 2nd tells the story of the lead assassin in El-Hashem's Corporation , Khadijah Khan. This is only the beginning of an amazing series on the deadly assassins that El-Hashem manages to have do his dirty work. But the story is sort of being told backwards (from the end to the beginning) instead of vice versa. 

 "The Corporation" answers the question - what happens when a gorgeous, one-eyed, middle eastern assassin turns on her mentor? Will she kill him or will he kill her? He trained her, and taught her all that she knows - but in "The Corporation-Wrath of Khan", Khadijah Khan questions her loyalty to her mentor, #7 (aka, billionaire tycoon and former-asset-turned-terrorist, Dawud El-Hashem).  In the second story, 

Khadijah Khan, Lead Assassin with The Corporation.
(Story 1)

THE CORPORATION: Wrath of Khan 

© 2014 Angela G. Fielder. All rights reserved.

One deadly woman. One masochistic man. She's hired to kill, and he's on her kill list. Who will make it out alive?

Meet Khadijah Khan - one of the more psychotic women in El-Hashem's lot of assassins. In this story, Khadijah is fed up with El-Hashem. He stole her beauty (took out her right eye), forced her to kill people, and turned her into a monster. That was not the initial plan that she had for her life. While en route to a hit, she contemplates killing El-Hashem instead. That's where the story kicks into overdrive. El-Hashem is already on the run from the CIA and MI-5, but his billion dollar lifestyle enables him to hide comfortably in plain sight. Khadijah knows this, and wants to overnight his remains to either government in a fedex box. It's cat and mouse for these two as she kicks up the octane in order to do one thing...Kill El-Hashem.


Dawud El-Hashem (CEO of The Corporation,Asset-turned-Terrorist, #7, Person of Interest to the U.S. and U.K.)

(Story 2)
THE NAME IS EL-HASHEM: A Calculated Risk
© 2014 Angela G. Fielder. All rights reserved.

Meet Dawud El-Hashem, a billionaire businessman, former asset to the United States, and now #7 on the Persons of Interest list in both the nation that leads the free world and the United Kingdom. To date, he has killed two federal agents and used his connections in various puppet regimes to kidnap and incarcerate another federal agent. The game just got real for him because the United States has sent yet another rookie in the field to track him and bring him to justice...alive. They'll never catch him, or so he thinks. 

The product of a rape during India's post partition years, El-Hashem had a life riddled with strife until a chance meeting with an Arab businessman changed his life forever. It was through working with the businessman that El-Hashem gained power, insight and wealth in the Arab world which led to him being a most coveted asset for the United States. When the special ops team doesn't uphold their end of the bargain, he turns rogue which is where this book begins. He's on the run - with properties all over the world, it isn't hard to hide, but with an ambitious and vivacious federal agent on his heels, trouble is sure to brew in the undertow.


In "The Name is El-Hashem: A Calculated Risk", the reader gains better insight as to why Dawud El-Hashem is the sociopath that he is.  His past haunts him daily and definitely regulates the on-goings of his future.  He is a child of partition, left to fend for himself when he fled to the U.K. with his family.  He is orphaned by the time he's a teenager and all of these things play a role on the type of man that he currently is now.  In this particular story, we meet an ambitious U.S. federal agent, whose quest to avenge the lives of her colleagues leads her into the deadly auspices of Dawud El-Hashem.  What happens when he gets caught adds to the web of deceit in which his life and work has been carefully crafted from.  

What I've tried to create are high octane, kickass, spy stories that originate in exotic places without all of the stereotypical rhetoric that readers are usually exposed to.


The Corporation Assassin, Vashti Bizri on assignment.

THE BOOK(S) (DETAILS)

Dimensions: 6.625 x 10.25 - standard comic book size 

Quality Printing: Both "The Corporation: Wrath of Khan" and "The Name is El-Hashem: A Calculated Risk" will be printed on high quality paper using a professional offset printer I'd like to make sure that the book makes a great first impression and lasts. (Both books will be full color, soft-cover books).

Exclusive First Edition Cover: I'd like the first run to be a collector’s item, especially for the people who helped me out from the start.

24 Story Pages: There will be 24 amazing pages in both books that will be used to unveil a kickass story for your viewing pleasure.

Here's an idea of the quality of the pages and how the storyline will unfold.




What We Need & What You Get

Believe it or not, the funding is going towards covering production costs.  This is essential.  Furthermore, a portion of the funding will go towards the rewards gifts that each indiegogo contributor will receive.  Take a look at the swag below!


REWARDS 

$5-$50  

See details in the perks section.

$75

1 Digital PDF copy of both books || 1 Print copy of both books || 3 Postcards featuring characters from the books.|| 3 Buttons - One of each of the main characters.||Executive membership card featuring "The Corporation" || 5 Stickers || 1 Poster|| 5 pieces of stationary|| 1 T-shirt|| Your name listed on the website as a backer of the project|| Signed sketch postcard(s)

$100
1 Digital PDF copy of both books || 1 Print copy of both books || 3 Postcards featuring characters from the books.|| 3 Buttons - One of each of the main characters.||Executive membership card featuring "The Corporation" || 5 Stickers || 1 Poster|| 5 pieces of stationary|| 1 T-shirt|| Your name listed on the website as a backer of the project||Signed sketch postcard(s)|| with characters/cells featured.||12” x 16”x 5” "Project Supporter" reusable grocery bag with characters featured.

$150
1 Digital PDF copy of both books || 1 Print copy of both books || 3 Postcards featuring characters from the books.|| 3 Buttons - One of each of the main characters.||Executive membership card featuring "The Corporation" || 5 Stickers || 1 Poster|| 5 pieces of stationary|| 1 T-shirt|| Your name listed on the website as a backer of the project||Signed sketch postcard(s)||12” x 16”x 5” "Project Supporter" reusable grocery bag with characters featured.|| Your name listed in the "Acknowledgements/Special Thanks" section of the book.|| Print copy of the first draft of the completed two books.

$250

1 Digital PDF copy of both books || 1 Print copy of both books || 3 Postcards featuring characters from the books.|| 3 Buttons - One of each of the main characters.||Senior Management level membership card featuring "The Corporation" || 5 Stickers || 1 Poster|| 5 pieces of stationary|| 1 T-shirt|| Your name listed on the website as a backer of the project||Signed sketch postcard(s)||"V.I.P. Backer" grocery tote with characters/cells featured.|| Your name listed in the "Acknowledgements/Special Thanks" section of the book.|| Print copy of the first draft of the completed two books.||12” x 16”x 5” "Project Supporter" reusable grocery bag with characters featured. ||"The Corporation" themed May 28th watch.

$400+

1 Digital PDF copy of both books || 1 Print copy of both books || 3 Postcards featuring characters from the books.|| 3 Buttons - One of each of the main characters.||Board of Trustees level black membership card featuring "The Corporation" . || 5 Stickers || 1 Poster|| 5 pieces of stationary|| 1 T-shirt|| Your name listed on the website as a backer of the project||Signed sketch postcard(s)||"V.I.P. Backer" grocery tote with characters/cells featured.|| Your name listed in the "Acknowledgements/Special Thanks" section of the book.|| Print copy of the first draft of the completed two books.||12” x 16”x 5” "Project Supporter" reusable grocery bag with characters featured. ||"The Corporation" themed May 28th watch.|| 13"x15.5x7" cotton and twill grocery tote.

Here  are a few thumbnails to give you an idea of how many of the rewards will look.


The Impact

A percentage of the proceeds will also go as a contribution to autism research at the Kennedy Krieger Institute.  Someone super special and extremely close to my heart has an autism spectrum disorder.  He and I have walked the walk along the autism spectrum together, and a portion of your donation will go to Kennedy Krieger Institute.  You can't imagine how much the folks there have helped that special someone in my life.  Here's a way where everyone can win!
Risks & Challenges

The main risk is financial.  I need funding in order to cover mass production costs.  Setbacks should not occur, but if they do I know how to finagle around them. I do not forsee any other production setbacks.  Here is a breakdown of where your contributions will go.

-To pay for the creative costs associated with writing, drawing, and coloring the book. 

-To pay for the production, high quality printing and shipping of this first run of at least 1,000 comics. I intend to use high quality paper for printing, which has an overall better quality.

-To pay for the creative costs, production costs and shipping of the reward items.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate money, it's all good! I understand that money is tight nowadays. Maybe you can help me get the word out about the campaign.  Use some of Indiegogo's share tools and let your friends know!


Recent Press

Check us out here..

PRESS

The following places gave "The Corporation" AMAZING press!  Special Thanks to:


Patch.com

story:
If you've already donated, your donation is noted and you WILL get a copy of this edition IN ADDITION to the final comic!

Short Summary

Lunaria is a comic book featuring super heroes and villains called "Daemons", who have a variety of innovative powers and abilities, living in cadence with regular citizens, vigilantes, and police. The story centers around a conflicted young woman named Lunaria, who was driven to vigilantism by childhood traumas. She soon discovers that she is a daemon, in the midst of dealing with politics, love, and intrigue. The comic book series is coupled with a live action serial of the same title, featuring award winning actors and multi-internationally award winning director Brandon Scott Jensen, and featuring guest directors Craig A. Butler (The Righteous and the Wicked), Rachel Sampson, and Jessica Osbourne.

What We Need & What You Get

Pre-buy NOW to get perks! Copies MAY still be available after Tri-Con!

The Impact

We are creating an original and innovative comic book series and live action serial. These products are being created by absolute industry professionals, and provide a family friendly, action packed entertainment that will blow you away!

Other ways you can help

If you aren't able to help fund the project, you can still promote the project. Tell your friends, and make sure to get every issue of the comic and to see every episode of the live action! Once again, you will have our eternal gratitude for this.
 

Beyond the Comic

The comic book is only part of the action! Look for more details on the currently in production Lunaria live action serial coming soon. www.facebook.com/lunariaworld

If you've already donated, your donation is noted and you WILL get a copy of this edition IN ADDITION to the final comic!
Short Summary
Lunaria is a comic book featuring super heroes and villains called "Daemons", who have a variety of innovative powers and abilities, living in cadence with regular citizens, vigilantes, and police. The story centers around a conflicted young woman named Lunaria, who was driven to vigilantism by childhood traumas. She soon discovers that she is a daemon, in the midst of dealing with politics, love, and intrigue. The comic book series is coupled with a live action serial of the same title, featuring award winning actors and multi-internationally award winning director Brandon Scott Jensen, and featuring guest directors Craig A. Butler (The Righteous and the Wicked), Rachel Sampson, and Jessica Osbourne.


What We Need & What You Get

Pre-buy NOW to get perks! Copies MAY still be available after Tri-Con!

The Impact
We are creating an original and innovative comic book series and live action serial. These products are being created by absolute industry professionals, and provide a family friendly, action packed entertainment that will blow you away!

Other ways you can help
If you aren't able to help fund the project, you can still promote the project. Tell your friends, and make sure to get every issue of the comic and to see every episode of the live action! Once again, you will have our eternal gratitude for this.
 
Beyond the Comic
The comic book is only part of the action! Look for more details on the currently in production Lunaria live action serial coming soon. www.facebook.com/lunariaworld

story:
In the year 2069, the Xtreme Champion Tournament (XCT) has cloned some of the pasts greatest heroes, villains and monsters.  Caged and forced to comply, they have only one choice - to compete in the most brutal sport in the world as a part of the XCT!

 

This issue takes the action out from the arena and brings it into the real world. This amps up the action, excitement and intrigue. For new readers coming aboard the journey, there are PDFs and physical copies of all the previous issues available as rewards or add-ons!

 

 

After a fiery explosion rocked the XCT arena, Spartacus and his team tried to stop the bloodthirsty monsters and villains from escaping but . . failed. Now with a team member down and the rest scattered across the countryside, Khan uses this opportunity to his advantage. Will Spartacus overcome his defeat to take up arms against Khan or will he stand by and watch the world fall? 

 

 

Praise and Acclaim

 

 

 

XCT: Fractured Worlds is a 64 page full coloured graphic novel in standard comic size (260mm x 170mm). It is printed on 150gsm glossy interior paper and a 250gsm cardstock cover. For those unfamiliar with gsm it is very high end paper, providing the best quality finish.

 

 

This first edition of XCT : Fractured Worlds is being published by Australia's premier graphic novel publisher COMICS2MOVIES. If the initial target is met, this first edition will be limited to only 1000 standard copies and 500 variant copies. The quality of this publication is extremely high but if we are able to gain more funds and reach some of our stretch goals then you will see the book increase in size, cover type, pages and edition. Please help to see how far we can reach in this campaign!

 

Creative Team

Shaun Keenan - Creator/Editor -  Owner of the Australia's premier graphic novel publisher COMICS2MOVIES and creator of the XCT universe and general story line. I have been working on the XCT universe over the past 5 years, released a second Sci-Fi title called Terralympus and am currently working on a third alt-history series called Talos of Sparta. My business COMICS2MOVIES will also be opening up it's publishing wing to other creators in 2020 with an aim of telling unique and exciting stories.

Alex Malyshev - Artist - Alex has been a freelance artist for the last 6 years working with pencils, inks colours and digital media. He has done work for a lot of independent publishers including Champion Comics, been a cover artist for the independent series 5 Star and Angelica Reigns and is currently working on a Sci-fi series called Metamora. As a young artist Alex has great potential within the comic industry and we can't wait to show you what he has been working on for us.

Ben Rosenthal - Writer - Ben has been a comic book writer for several years producing his own comics, working on the Australian comic series Killeroo and even doing a short story within the XCT universe. Ben also hosts the podcast Hack the Dino, works within the Australian wrestling scene and is extremely talented in writing, editing and critiquing written work.

Wilson Go - Colourist - Wilson has jumped back on board to do the colours for this XCT graphic novel. We know he does a fantastic job in making all the characters jump right off the page and hit you in the face and this book is no exception.   

 

Our rewards include the digital and hard copies of the XCT: Fractured Worlds graphic novel.

We have got an exclusive variant cover that be will limited to only 500 copies. This amazing cover is done by Italian and Marvel artist Francesco Tomaselli. Francesco has an amazing painted style and this exclusive cover is a must for any collector.

 We are also offering the whole XCT collection (that's over 350 pages) in PDF format as well as in printed editions in both the standard and incentive covers. We also have some amazing enamel pins as well as sketch covers done by some guest artists like Ken Lashley (Marvel - Gambit), Wayne Nicholls (Star Wars - Forced Unleashed), GRUM and Luke Andrew.

 

 

You can also get some CGC Signature Series San Diego Comic Con (SDCC) exclusive comics signed by Jerry Gaylord and myself or even get your likeness drawn into the next book

Our top tiers included designing your own cover and purchasing some original art from the series. You can checkout all the rewards on the right hand side of the screen.

story:
‘Dark, edgy, and inflicted with just the right degree of lyricism.’ 
William Gibson

'Here is a fusion of Japanese manga with American comics that is vivid, exciting and lovingly-detailed. Giron is one of the very best working in comics today.'  Lavie Tidhar

‘Dead Girls is a fiendish futuristic fairytale full of style and invention. A thrilling tale told at breakneck pace with beautiful manga-inspired artwork. Highly recommended.’  SFX

    Hi. I’m Terry Martin, head honcho of the publishers The House of Murky Depths, responsible for the award-winning* anthology magazine Murky Depths that mixed short stories with comics. I won’t bore you with other interesting facts about me, this is about Dead Girls - The Graphic Novel.  While I'm part of the team that's making it possible, it's writer Richard Calder and artist Leonardo M Giron that deserve the accolade.

Dead Girls - The Graphic Novel is Richard Calder's adaptation - and radical re-imagining - of his 1992 cyberpunk novel Dead Girls, written while he was living in Nongkhai, Thailand, a small border town on the Mekong River, overlooking Laos. Other novels include Dead Boys, Dead Things (which, of course, completed the acclaimed 'Dead' trilogy), Cythera, Frenzetta, The Twist, Malignos, Impakto, Lord Soho, and Babylon. Following a decade-long sojourn in Thailand and the Philippines, he returned to the UK and currently lives in London.

  

  Filipino artist Leonardo M Giron lives in Manila. His work - an eclectic, turbocharged mix of Eastern and Western influences - is inspired by Japanese mangakas, such as Shirow Masamune, and DC luminaries, such as Mike Mignola and Eduardo Risso. Richard Calder says: 'Leonardo M Giron's indigenous grasp of the ambience that Manila shares with Bangkok, and his ability to translate this into a unique, manga-like idiom - a kind of "manga+" - makes him perfect for delineating the cyberpunk exuberance and sheer down-and-dirty exoticism of Dead Girls.'

Back in 2008 Richard Calder said he’d like to turn the film script of his cult cyberpunk novel Dead Girls into a graphic novel – and we jumped at the chance! Leonardo M Giron, an artist from the Philippines, had worked with us on a number of James Johnson’s comic shorts and when approached was keen to collaborate on the project. His manga-inspired style gave Richard Calder's characters, Primavera and Iggy, brilliant new life, and the story, serialised, first in award-winning* anthology magazine Murky Depths, and then later in issues #1 - #8 of Dead Girls the comic series, has drawn a following from around the world.

  

Murky Depths #9, published in the Autumn of 2009, launched Dead Girls. It ran, with a three-issue break, from issue #12 through #18 – the last issue of Murky Depths to be published. But Dead Girls had momentum. Two guys were set on creating something new and exciting while remaining faithful to the spirit of the original novel. So, with additional pages and a full-colour make-over (Murky Depths'  internals were printed in black monotone) the eight-comic Dead Girls series of fourteen episodes came into being. Dead Girls #8 - Just Like Heaven, the final comic in the series, running to thirty-two pages, was published in May 2014.

The series was intended to keep the Dead Girls franchise alive and in the minds of readers. It gave its creators something tangible; a reward for their labours. Dead Girls -The Graphic Novel, with additional pages to iron out those small continuity issues that Mike Carey, for one, picked up on in the comic series, and with an introduction by World Fantasy Award winning author Lavie Tidhar, and an afterword by Aurealis Award winner KJ Bishop, is therefore ready to go to the printers. But this is going to be the biggest single investment that The House of Murky Depths has made and to that end we ask that you support Dead Girls - The Graphic Novel with a pledge to one of our perks.

We’ve had our fingers burnt in the past. Publishers, like any innovative producers, are taking major financial risks. By choosing one of the perks, and supporting us, you will help alleviate the stress. And, of course, we believe that Dead Girls - The Graphic Novel is a great story with awesome artwork that will in time be seen as a classic.

*British Fantasy Awards Best Magazine/Periodical 2010

We need £5,000 (which includes estimated shipping costs) to get the first run printed and out into the big wide world. £2,000 will guarantee a slot in the printers schedule and with a planned launch at Worldcon (Loncon 3) in August 2014 there is some urgency. If we exceed our target we will use the money to print additional copies - it will have demonstrated a demand. If we don’t reach our target we’ll be funding the project by securing a loan - so your assistance is greatly appreciated! Fear not, Dead Girls - The Graphic Novel  IS happening.

The perk that we think will be most subscribed to is the copy of the 208-page full-colour trade paperback edition of Dead Girls - The Graphic Novel (which is what this is all about) signed by Richard Calder and Leonardo M Giron (sample pages above). But the other perks have a collectable value that's worth considering and that will assist us in achieving our funding goal.

You'll find further details below.

  

While we have every intention of making this project happen, by investing in one of the perks you can say that you had a hand in assisting us. When you invest in a perk your name will be mentioned in a roll of honour at the deadgirls.co.uk website, unless you choose to be excluded.

The House of Murky Depths has published the award-winning Murky Depths anthology magazine, Sam Stone’s Vampire Gene series (five novels in all) featuring the award-winning Killing Kiss, two of Lavie Tidhar’s comics/picture story books, not to mention the eight-comic Dead Girls series that this project is collecting, and several other successful publications from a variety of authors. All of which you can check out at the murkydepths.com website.

You might not be able to invest in a perk right now. We understand that. Sometimes life has to take precedence over entertainment. But the investment isn’t huge – and the return is a truly unforgettable product!

So, please help us by getting the word out about this campaign. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! We love you!




A 148 mm x 100 mm postcard featuring Jim Burns illustration for the wraparound cover of Dead Girls - The Graphic Novel.

The front and back:-


Pack of four button badges. Sixteen designs. Four different designs in each pack.


Title page of Dead Girls - The Graphic Novel. Size 285 mm x 440 mm (11 1/4" x 17 1/4"). Slight marking on some corners where they have been taped to a wall, but otherwise fine.


... featuring Act 1 of the serialised Dead Girls (minus the extra pages included in the limited edition hardback), Episodes 1 to 4.


... featuring Act 2 of the serialised Dead Girls, Episodes 5 to 7.


Plans change. Limited edition hardbacks (numbered 1 to 100 and signed by Richard Calder and Leonardo M Giron) were to be a part of a series of hardbacks collecting several episodes of Dead Girls. Act 1, the only one that went into production, includes Episodes #1 through #5. This copy is numbered 98. Extremely rare, and extremely collectable. A bargain!   


   This lovely black vinyl case featuring the artwork that will be used for the front cover of Dead Girls - The Graphic Novel  contains the complete eight-comic set of Dead Girls. Also we'll be slipping in a Jim Burns' postcard and two sets of badges.


A signed first-edition hardback of Richard Calder's original 1992 cult novel.
Cover by Surrealist artist Hans Bellmer.
   



Here's The House of Murky Depths' table at one of the Demoncon conventions in the UK. The two banners that are perks can be seen on the left. Individual banners can be seen below.

  

Used at conventions, this roll-up banner is a favourite. One of a kind, we'll be sad to see it go, but if it helps us achieve our target the sacrifice will be worth it. What an awesome piece of art to own and display in your house! Two metres high by 850 mm wide.


This roll-up banner is also used at conventions. And it will be likewise missed. Support us, and own a stunning Dead Girls original! Two metres high by 850 mm wide.

      

An evening out with Richard Calder at an Indian restaurant in Brick Lane, London, where the derelict pub called The Seven Stars (pictured below) – inspiration for ‘Queen of the Dolls’ Titania’s hideaway – still stands, and where Primavera and Iggy begin a journey that takes them to Bangkok, and beyond. And, of course, a signed copy of Dead Girls - The Graphic novel. The House of Murky Depths CEO, Terry Martin, will join you too!

story:
Indigogo campaign

Begging To Differ: Get It On The Road

My name is Daphna Baram, I'm a London based stand up comedian. I had big dreams for the Edinburgh Fringe this year. After the success of my 3rd solo show, the "immigrational comedy" Something To Declare, I have written a  topical political show, told from my personal prism. I called it Begging To Differ. It is my 4th solo show and I believe it is funny and poignant. But I can't take it to Edinburgh. A combination of financial disasters and wrong timing made it impossible for me to take it to the one festival where shows come to live or die.

I was devastated for a  while and then decided to go a different route, to tour Begging to Differ across the UK and in a few European destinations and bring it to Edinburgh for 2017 when it is all toured and honed. My aim is to play Begging To Differ 30 times before the end of August - this would put me at an equal footing with shows that go through a full run at the Edinburgh Fringe.

But touring costs money too. Travel, Posters designs, contacting venues and promoters across the country, advertising, accommodation, flyers, flyerers, PR. I am not spoiled, I'm not looking to do this in luxury, I aim to go to maximum of places, reach a maximum audience, say what I want to say, get the laughs, beg to differ, make a difference.

A small budget like the sum I'm bidding for can take a comedy show a long way, to cities and villages, local fringe festivals, rooms above pubs, community centres and suburban theatres, making people laugh; urging them to think. Your contribution will make me your laughter envoy, carrying my jokes-trolley across the UK, over to Ireland, France, Spain and Italy. My main hope is to cross the channel and perform it for the refugees and volunteers in Calais.

I will use the funds I raise to pay Festival Fees (Festivals and festival venues charge 10-100 pounds for one show), travel to shows, pay for AirBNB rooms in places where I can't sofa-surf, get flyers designed and printed.

Also, it is my birthday! I'm 46 on 14 April. Please don't buy me scented candles and body butter this year. I do love them, but this year I'm asking you to help me push my dream forward.


What I need

To get this show on the road I need to book it into as many venues as possible. I already have 4 shows booked for the Brighton Fringe, 4 at the Camden Fringe, Two at the Hastings Fringe, Two at the Manchester Women In Comedy Festival, and I'm negotiating with other festivals and venues.

Not making the goal will not mean that all is lost. It only means that I could do less, Going over the goal would not mean I'll spend it on pizza and loose men - it means I'll be able to perform more shows.

What You Get

You get to contribute to a funny show written from the unique point of view of a comedian who had in her lifetime the fortune and the haplessness of being the boss and the subject, the coloniser and the immigrant, the chief and the traveller. I was a rebel and a soldier, a fat girl and a thin one, a human rights lawyer and a news editor, a journalist and an academic. I sat crying on the "immigrants bench" in Heathrow, I've scored drugs in an ambulance - I've seen a thing or two.

Also, you can claim a perk. I realised that I'm really terrible at organising a shipping service, and that postal prices in the UK could devastate a whole campaign if I start posting signed posters (or unsigned ones) around. The whole purpose of the campaign is that you can come watch it, so all perks involve free tickets for shows, and extra perks that are to be delivered during said shows. I think that's the most effective way to go about it. That said, if you can't make any show, and can't put in the kind of contribution that would make me come to you, let me know, and I'll post you a few signed flyers and posters.

Challenges

The main challenge is to get the show booked for as many venues as possible, and particularly to hit the target number of 30 shows before the end of August. But It is possible! Especially with your help, see the next section.

Other ways you can help

You may well be just as skint as I am, but you still can help! You can share this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook, twitter and any other social media. Follow me on twitter @missdcomedy and encourage others to follow and contribute.

And if you are aware of a venue near by you that can host a comedy show, whether it is a regular ongoing comedy club or a theatre/pub that runs events, let me know and I'll get in touch!

If you are a part of a group of people (social club, workplace group, extended family, old people's home, trade union), who can arrange a group or anything over 20 people in a venue of your choice, you can organise a group donation and I will bring the show to you!


I am most grateful for any help you could offer and looking forward to seeing you along the Begging To Differ journey.
story_txt: Indigogo campaignBegging To Differ: Get It On The RoadMy name is Daphna Baram, I'm a London based stand up comedian. I had big dreams for the Edinburgh Fringe this year. After the success of my 3rd solo show, the "immigrational comedy" Something To Declare, I have written a  topical political show, told from my personal prism. I called it Begging To Differ. It is my 4th solo show and I believe it is funny and poignant. But I can't take it to Edinburgh. A combination of financial disasters and wrong timing made it impossible for me to take it to the one festival where shows come to live or die.I was devastated for a  while and then decided to go a different route, to tour Begging to Differ across the UK and in a few European destinations and bring it to Edinburgh for 2017 when it is all toured and honed. My aim is to play Begging To Differ 30 times before the end of August - this would put me at an equal footing with shows that go through a full run at the Edinburgh Fringe. But touring costs money too. Travel, Posters designs, contacting venues and promoters across the country, advertising, accommodation, flyers, flyerers, PR. I am not spoiled, I'm not looking to do this in luxury, I aim to go to maximum of places, reach a maximum audience, say what I want to say, get the laughs, beg to differ, make a difference.A small budget like the sum I'm bidding for can take a comedy show a long way, to cities and villages, local fringe festivals, rooms above pubs, community centres and suburban theatres, making people laugh; urging them to think. Your contribution will make me your laughter envoy, carrying my jokes-trolley across the UK, over to Ireland, France, Spain and Italy. My main hope is to cross the channel and perform it for the refugees and volunteers in Calais. I will use the funds I raise to pay Festival Fees (Festivals and festival venues charge 10-100 pounds for one show), travel to shows, pay for AirBNB rooms in places where I can't sofa-surf, get flyers designed and printed.Also, it is my birthday! I'm 46 on 14 April. Please don't buy me scented candles and body butter this year. I do love them, but this year I'm asking you to help me push my dream forward.What I needTo get this show on the road I need to book it into as many venues as possible. I already have 4 shows booked for the Brighton Fringe, 4 at the Camden Fringe, Two at the Hastings Fringe, Two at the Manchester Women In Comedy Festival, and I'm negotiating with other festivals and venues. Not making the goal will not mean that all is lost. It only means that I could do less, Going over the goal would not mean I'll spend it on pizza and loose men - it means I'll be able to perform more shows. What You GetYou get to contribute to a funny show written from the unique point of view of a comedian who had in her lifetime the fortune and the haplessness of being the boss and the subject, the coloniser and the immigrant, the chief and the traveller. I was a rebel and a soldier, a fat girl and a thin one, a human rights lawyer and a news editor, a journalist and an academic. I sat crying on the "immigrants bench" in Heathrow, I've scored drugs in an ambulance - I've seen a thing or two. Also, you can claim a perk. I realised that I'm really terrible at organising a shipping service, and that postal prices in the UK could devastate a whole campaign if I start posting signed posters (or unsigned ones) around. The whole purpose of the campaign is that you can come watch it, so all perks involve free tickets for shows, and extra perks that are to be delivered during said shows. I think that's the most effective way to go about it. That said, if you can't make any show, and can't put in the kind of contribution that would make me come to you, let me know, and I'll post you a few signed flyers and posters. ChallengesThe main challenge is to get the show booked for as many venues as possible, and particularly to hit the target number of 30 shows before the end of August. But It is possible! Especially with your help, see the next section. Other ways you can helpYou may well be just as skint as I am, but you still can help! You can share this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook, twitter and any other social media. Follow me on twitter @missdcomedy and encourage others to follow and contribute. And if you are aware of a venue near by you that can host a comedy show, whether it is a regular ongoing comedy club or a theatre/pub that runs events, let me know and I'll get in touch!If you are a part of a group of people (social club, workplace group, extended family, old people's home, trade union), who can arrange a group or anything over 20 people in a venue of your choice, you can organise a group donation and I will bring the show to you!I am most grateful for any help you could offer and looking forward to seeing you along the Begging To Differ journey.
